loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: Don José de La Cruz Pérez tiene como actividad un taller de soldadura ubicado en su casa de habitación, está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de materiales, además de trabajar en su casa lo hace de manera ambulante. Cuando lo buscan para instalar algún techo u otro trabajo tiene 18 años de trabajar como soldador. Es  padre de 3 hijos los cuales son personas preparadas que con el esfuerzo de sus padres lograron coronar sus carreras. El señor José es un hombre humilde, trabajador y de buenos principios. Pero aun así su mayor sueño es seguir adelante cada día con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. José de La Cruz Pérez has a welding shop located in his home. He is requesting a loan in order to buy materials, since working in his home can appear less stable. Customers know when they need to install a roof or some other project that José has eighteen years of experience working as a welder.

He is the father of three children, who were prepared to reach their career goals thanks to the effort of their parents. José is a humble man, a hard worker, and of good moral character. His biggest dream is to continue improving his business each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials for his welding business

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina D. has been selling pots and pans in Abura since 2006. She has received no formal education.  She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a steel bender. Rosina is responsible for paying for clothes and food. Her loan will be used to buy more pots and pans for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more pots and pans for resale

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is 26 years old and lives in Beirut, the Lebanese capital. He has been working as a car electrician for five years. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mhammad first started his business, he had financial issues, especially because he was used to being an employee. He set up his business because he learned it when he was young.

Mhammad has requested a loan of $2,000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase parts for his work such as car batteries, car accessories, car radios, alarms and wipers. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. Mhammad's previous loans helped him improve his business. In the future, he plans on improving his store.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his work

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen S. C. es una señora de 37 años de edad quien vive con sus tres hijos en una  comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio.

Doña María del Carmen inicio su negocio hace poco más de dos años. Ella tiene una panadería, dice que sus productos son muy aceptados en su comunidad ya que son muy buenos y de gran calidad, además comenta que está muy feliz de poder tener un negocio propio en su casa así puede estar al cuidado de sus hijos y no dejar de lado las tareas del hogar y  que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.

En estos momentos doña María del Carmen desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones), para comprar otro hormo industrial, una batidora industrial y diferentes materiales necesarios para elaboración de sus productos. Con esta inversión  espera incrementar la producción para atraer más clientes, ofrecer un mejor servicio y así hacer que su negocio crezca más y lograr ser una microempresaria exitosa. 

Doña María del Carmen del es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.

loans.use: Compra de horno industrial, una batidora industrial y materiales.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthou N. is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 7-hectare field to cultivate rice for a living. On this farm, she faces a problem because she does not have enough equipment to plow the field so she decided to ask for a loan to buy an electric cow to plow the field. She will also rent it to other villagers to earn more profit. Her husband, Mr. Put Sek, is a vice village chief in the local village and he also helps his wife on the farm. Mrs. Chanthou N. is 30 years old and the mother of three children who all attend the local school. Her husband is shown with her on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an electric cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: Norberta is a 36 year old married woman. Her business is a sari-sari (variety) store; she sells goods to her neighbors and people in her town. She has three children she takes care of very lovingly. As a member of CEVI, she hopes that the MFI will continue to grow and help the poor. Norberta applied for a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use this loan to buy stocks for her store so that she can be of service to people in her town.

loans.use: financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase special materials for saving his products.

loans.name: Safwan

texts.en:
Safwan is a 35-year-old man who lives with his wife and their four children in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon.

Safwan works as a taxi driver and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and to pay for his wife’s medication. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time.

Safwan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is punctual. His clients are his friends, neighbors and passers-by. When he first started his business, he had difficulty buying his car number plate since it cost a lot. He decided on doing his business because he had to find work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his taxi and to pay for his wife's medication

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the market and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Keji is 29 years old and is married to a soldier. She has five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: G.s. Pablo Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Pablo II está conformado por Gregoria y Petrona De Los Milagros ambas tiene diferentes actividades económicas, anteriormente ellas habían realizado financiamientos en Fundación León 2000 que son muy importantes para su negocio. Gregoria se dedica a la elaboración de repostería hace mas de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha sido de gran ayuda pues han sido muy importantes. Petrona en cambio se dedica a la elaboración de bordados para toallas, manteles y sabanas por lo que ambas ha puesto de su parte para solicitar este nuevo financiamiento para proporcionarle a sus negocios los materiales necesarios. Ellas sueñan con mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Pablo II group consists of Gregoria and Petrona de los Milagros. They each have different jobs. They have previously received financing from Fundacion Leon 2000, which are very important for their business. Gregoria has been a baker for over 16 years, which has been a great help to her. Petrona embroiders towels, tablecloths and sheets. They have requested this financing to purchase materials for their respective businesses. They dream of improving the living conditions of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
El banco comuna Las Caleras está formado por un grupo de mujeres que saben que en la vida nada es fácil pero con sudor y sacrificio pueden llegar a tener muchas cosas para poder entregarle lo mejor a su familia, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca siendo esta la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, que se distingue por su belleza arquitectónica y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Sra. María Zhamnay es socia del banco comuna Las Calera, vive en la Virgen del Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene un gran vinculo de amistad con todas sus compañeras de la banca comunal,  tiene 42 años de edad, se encuentra casada siendo el fruto de su unión conyugal el haber procreado 3 hijos que se encuentran de 21, 15, 4 años de edad, su hijo de 21 años estudia en la Universidad Sudamericana, su hijo de  15 años estudia en el colegio Miguel Moreno, su hijo de  4 años está en el jardín, su esposo es Mecánico Industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en  casa de su suegra.

María se dedica a la venta de pollos, tiene 3 años en este negocio, los pollos los compra ya pelados y luego los vende, tiene una tienda en María Auxiliadora, vende solo los domingo de 6 a.m. a 1 p.m. el resto de días ayuda a sus esposo en el taller, tiene 6 años trabajando con el bankito y nos comenta que los créditos le han ayudado mucho con el pago de deudas y estudios de sus hijos, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para continuar con su negocio, su gran sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Caleras is a group of women who know that nothing is easy in life, but with a great deal of effort and sacrifice they can obtain many things to improve the lot of their families. They live in Cuenca which is the third most important city in Ecuador. It is known for its architectural beauty and its warm and friendly people. Sra. María Zhamnay is a member of the community bank. She lives in the Virgen del Milagro area of Cuenca where she is close friends with the other members of the bank. She is 42-years old, married, and has three children aged 21, 15, and 4. Her 21-year old son studies at the Universidad Sudamericana, her 15-year old son is a student at the Miguel Moreno high school, and her 4-year old daughter is in kindergarten. Her husband is an industrial mechanic. As they do not own their home, they live with her mother-in-law. María has sold chickens for three years. She buys them already plucked and then sells them. She has a store in María Auxiliadora which is open only on Sundays between 6am and 1pm. The remaining days she helps her husband in his workshop. She has been a member of the bank for six years and says that the loans have helped her greatly to pay her debts and contribute to her children’s education. With this loan from Kiva partner Fundacion Espoir she will buy more chickens so she can continue in the business. Her greatest desire is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens for resale

loans.name: Mergelyn

texts.en: “We have a one-hectare farm, which we till for so many years now. It is our only source of livelihood. That is why we keep our best to sustain it so that we could provide our family with all their needs,” says Mergelyn C., a twenty-five-year-old farmer from Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. Now, she is preparing the farm, but she still needs an additional amount of money to buy all of the supplies she needs for farming. She hopes to receive a loan of PHP 6,000 through Community Economic Ventures, Inc., She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Feliciana es soltera, tiene 49 años y 1 hijo, Feliciana se dedica a la compra de animales en las diferentes ferias, luego comercializa la carne al por mayor en el camal de la ciudad.
Feliciana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ovejas.
Los sueños de Feliciana son mejorar su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a partner of the Communal Bank “Legioncito”. She is single mother of 1 son and is 49 years old. She buys animals from different fairs and wholesales the meat to the city slaughterhouse. Feliciana needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to purchase sheep. She aspires to improve her home and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Wright, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Sheep

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 34 years old and married with two children, ages four and two, one of whom is in school. He is a dairy farmer near Litein in Western Kenya. He's been farming for three years and sells his milk through the Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He says that the main challenge to his business is providing enough feed from his small farm for his cow.

Wesley already completed a previous loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo, and requested this loan for 70,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the loan will provide extra income for his family and he'll be able to pay his school fees. In the future, he would like to get a dairy cow that could produce up to 20 liters a day.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: B & B Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'B & B Group'. They are small-scale businesswomen from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to help them expand their businesses. 

Isatu K. is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old was born in Makeni; she is married to a mechanic and they have 5 children. Two of her children are attending secondary school and three are in primary school. Isatu sells firewood and 'gara lappers' (locally dyed cloth). She has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. With this loan, she will buy piles of firewood and 'gara lapper'-making materials.

loans.use: Buy piles of firewood and 'gara lapper'-making materials

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es: Martha Emilia
texts.en: Martha Emilia

loans.use: Purchase dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy children's shoes

loans.name: Mardoqueo Secundino

texts.es: Don mardoqueo Secundino Torres, se dedica al comercio venta de articulos de electricidad tales como Focos, lamparas, accesorios como tomacorrientes, alambres, y entre otras cosas, cuenta con 5 hijos 3 varones y 2 mujeres, es originario del paraje Chocruz Aldea Los Cipreses, del municipio de Momostenango, vive a 5 kilometros del centro de la ciudad de Momosteanango, actualmente necesita un prestamo que lo utilizará para capital de trabajo, el cual desea mejorar sus ganancias, al mismo tiempo mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mardoqueo Secundino Torres has a business selling electrical appliances such as lights, lamps, and accessories like electrical outlets and wires, among other items. He has 5 children – 3 boys and 2 girls. He is from Chocruz Aldea Los Cipreses in the municipality of Momostenango. He lives 5 kilometers from the center of the city of Momostenango. He currently needs a loan that he will use for working capital, with which he wants to improve his earnings while also improving his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: cliente FELIX Q. Q.,es casado tiene hijos mayores,independientes,tiene casa propia en Cañete que ha ido construyendo poco a poco con ingresos propios, actualmente se dedica a la actividad de renovadora de calzados en kiosko alquilado en la calle LA MAR Nº221, del cercado de ica, tiene experiencia en el negocio hace 8 años, empezó trabajando en una empresa y luego se independizó con un capital de s/ 1 300 trabajando 12 horas diarias su objetivos es tener mas renovadoras con empleados encargados.
texts.en:
Felix Q. Q. is married, and he has grown, independent children. He has his own house in Cañete. He has been building it little by little with his own income. He currently repairs shoes in a rented kiosk on La Mar Street N°221 in the Ica district. He has eight years of experience in the business. He started working for a company, and then he used 1,300 PEN to become independent. He works 12 hours a day. His objective is to have more repair shops with employees in charge.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Socorro De Los Santos

texts.es: Socorro de los Santos tiene la edad de 54 años, tiene 5 hijos y solo 2 de sus hijos están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos, ya que ella siempre está buscando la forma de aumentar su capital de trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Desea seguir manteniendo su actividad como lo ha hecho todo el tiempo.
texts.en:
Socorro de los Santos is 54 years old and has 5 children, two of whom are still in her care. Professionally, she sells general commodities. For more than 5 years she has been in this business. This is not the first experience she has had with financing, since she is always looking for a way to increase her working capital. The financing that she requests is for working capital for the purchase of raw materials. She wishes to continue to maintain her business as she has been doing thus far.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion M. is from the village of Anonang, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 37 years old, married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Salvacion owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products, such as candies, snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Salvacion has been in business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Salvacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Salvacion is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Salvacion from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of zinc and cemento

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 29 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años cultiva alfalfa y cría cuyes, por lo que cada día cuida con mucha dedicación ambas actividades, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que la ayuda en el trabajo. Juntos han logrado en poco tiempo mejorar su condición de vida, por el bienestar de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente y en cuanto a la venta de cuyes tiene un cliente estable que siempre hace pedidos de la venta de este animal, además esta buscando oportunidades de mejorar sus ingresos. Su deseo es tener una granja de cuyes más grande y también extensiones de terreno. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará madera para construir nuevos galpones y también invertirá una parte en la instalación de fluido eléctrico para su casa, con el fin de tener iluminación en su granja ya que de noche es muy oscuro y le dificulta el trabajo de alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Víctor is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and three children. For more than three years he has been growing alfalfa and raising guinea pigs. He continues in both of these activities every day with great care and dedication. His wife supports him and helps him with the work. Gradually they have worked together to improve their living conditions for the benefit of their children. What he enjoys most about his work is being independent. Víctor has a stable customer base that is always submitting orders for guinea pigs, so he is looking for opportunities to improve his income. His wish is to have a larger guinea pig farm and more tracts of land.

This is his second loan with MFP. Víctor is very happy to know that he has a source of financial support, which explains why he has always demonstrated responsibility when making his payments. He enjoys being part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. Víctor is grateful to those individuals who will be approving his loan request because the money will be useful in helping him to make progress in his business. The loan will go toward the purchase of wood for building new pens. Part of the money will be used to have electricity installed into his home. This will allow him to have light on his farm because it is very dark at night, thereby making it difficult for him to feed the animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to build more guinea pig pens & pay to have electricity installed

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, tiene 35 años y esta casada con Nildo de 38 años, ambos tienen dos hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia. El motor de su vida, son sus hijos, a quienes quiere brindarles todo lo que ella, no tuvo, por eso con bastante dedicación siembra gladiolo, papa, arveja y maíz. Lleva 10 años trabajando, en compañía de su esposo. Ama la tranquilidad que le brindan los campos, pero le incomoda trasladar sus cosechas hacía el mercado de su ciudad.  Asimismo, considera que las utilidades que le deja su labor agrícola es muy bueno, es por eso tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad porque está segura de poder cuidar adecuadamente sus tierras, además desea comprar un carro para que brinde el servicio de transporte público. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP,  y está muy agradecida por la confianza que le brindan, pues para ella, el crédito significa una oportunidad para salir adelante, además le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá, piensa comprar bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old and is married to Nildo, 38. They have 2 children who live with them in their own house. The driving force in Esther's life is her sons, to whom she wants to give everything that she didn't have. For this reason Esther is very dedicated to her job planting gladioli, potatoes, peas and maize. She has been working with her husband doing this for 10 years. Esther loves the tranquility that the country gives her, but it is an inconvenience for her to transport her harvest to the market in the city. She considers the profits that her agricultural labour gives her are very good, so she has planned to sow a greater quantity of plants because she is sure she will be able to look after them adequately. Esther also wants to purchase a car to provide a public transport service. This is the third loan she has had from MFP and she is very thankful for the confidence that they have shown. For Esther, this loan signifies an opportunity to improve her situation, and she also likes working in her communal bank. With the loan she will receive she will purchase bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertiliser.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda R. is from the village of Luksoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Creselda is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Creselda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Creselda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Creselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Creselda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Creselda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Las Rosas De Maria Group

texts.es:
ALCOM“LAS ROSA D. MARIA”
Isabel Peña C. tiene 36 años vive en el distrito D. san juan D. Lurigancho anexo Huáscar es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora madre D. 2 hijos por los cuales lucha día a día por darles una mejor educación a sus dos pequeños hijos el primero D. 9 años y el segundo D. 7 años, Isabel es separada del padre D. sus dos hijos pero El como buen padre responsable lo apoya en los gastos y estudios D. sus hijos.
 L. alcancía  esta formada por seis entusiastas y comprometidas socias y un socio en L. cual Isabel ejerce el cargo D. presidenta es una alcancía"LAS ROSAS D. MARIA", es uan alcancia nueva recién formada que encontraron en EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD L. oportunidad D. crecer y tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
 Hace tres años que Isabel se dedica a L. venta D. DVD en L. casa D. sus pedrés donD. vive; por las mañanas trabaja vendiendo gelatinas,tortas,bocaditos en L. puerta D. un colegio cercano donD. vive, como un pequeño ingreso más a su canasta familiar,porque tiene tambien L. responsabilidad D. pagar todo los fines D. mes luz y agua D. L. casa doD. vive.      
 Isabel sueña con tener su casa propia y dentro D. elL. abrir una tienda D. repuestos D. motos y autos pero sabe que para dicho negocio necesita un capital mucho mayor para ello el préstamo actual lo volvera a usar como capital D. trabajo porque desea implementar más el negocio D. L. venta D. DVD comprando lo último y novedoso D. L. cartelera y así obtener mejores ganancias,D. esa manera ver lo más pronto realizado su sueño.
texts.en:
“LAS ROSA D. MARIA” (MARY’S ROSES) COMMUNAL BANK Isabel Peña C., 36, lives in Huáscar Annex, San Juan D. Lurigancho district. She is an enterprising and tenacious mother of two children for whom she struggles daily to proviD. a better education. Her first is 9 years old and the second is 7. Isabel is separated from the father of her children but, since he is a good, responsible father, he helps with educational and other expenses. The communal bank has six enthusiastic, committed women members and one male member. Isabel is the group President. This is a recently formed communal bank that found in EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD the opportunity to grow and have a better quality of life. Isabel has sold DVDs for the last three years from her parents’ house which is where she lives. In the morning she sells gelatin treats and other snacks at the entrance to a nearby school. This provides a little extra income for the basic family needs since she also has to pay the monthly water and gas bills where she lives. Isabel dreams with owning her own house and to set up spare parts store for cars and motorcycles but she knows that such a business requires a much larger amount of capital. The current loan will be used once again as working capital. She wants to better stock her DVD business buying the latest movies so that profits will improve and thus get closer to seeing her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the most current DVDs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For natural products.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice D. is from the village of San Carlos, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 22 years old. Janice is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Janice buys and sells bags and shoe products in the local community. Janice has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Janice joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Janice from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man with two young children attending school. He is an experienced carpenter of almost 15 years and has owned a carpentry shop since 2004. He works at the request of  clients and in collaboration with some galleries. Today, he is requesting $900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. wood. He reports that this will help him increase his profits by a large percentage. In the future, he looks to further expand his business and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Minsapinit, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Helen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional firewood. Helen is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul M., aged 36, is a dealer in the scrap metal business. He buys pieces of used and worn out metals and sells them in bulk. His business is located along Magadi Road, which is busy and he gets many customers. 

He is married to Mercy Wangari and together they have a daughter and son who are both in primary school. He has been running this business for a period of 3 years and his monthly income is Kshs 10,000.

He was introduced to KADET by KADET existing customers. He has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD and he plans to increase his stock of scrap metal for resale. If the loan boosts the business, Paul will buy a piece of land.

Rental houses have become a good business in Kenya and so Paul dreams that one day he will build many rental houses and become a landlord. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica O. is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Argao, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: buying and selling livestock and a food vending businesses. Her husband Erwin O., who is 39 years old, works as a Security Guard to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 1 child who is 15 years old. Jessica joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jessica has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 21000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7200.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20000, which she intends to use to fund business operations. Jessica O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To funds business operations

loans.name: Gretel

texts.en:
Gretel R. is from the village of Galas. She is 54 years old, married, and has 3 adult children and 1 school-aged child. Gretel operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, primarily farming, in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gretel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Gretel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor for preparing the rice fields. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gretel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: use to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor for preparing the rice fields

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Doña Petrona  de 56 años de edad, tiene una hija que se desempeña como docente de secundaria de donde obtiene ingresos, la Sra Petrona es una persona activa, responsable y muy trabajadora, labora para el Hospital Jacinto Hernandez desde hace 30 años desempeñandose como supervisora,  ambas comparten con los gastos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos, cabe mencionar que esta Señora ha trabajado con Kiva por lo que con el credito anterior pudo repellar la pared de su casa.

Por lo tanto se siente muy agradecida y  solicita 6to. credito para hacerle un anexo a la casa y pìntarla y de esta manera continuar mejorando su vivienda por lo que es una persona asalariada y con lo que gana no es suficiente para realizar estos gastos de un solo; por tanto tiene que mejorar con creditos, los cuales asume con respnsabilidad. 

Su mayor mayor sueño en la vida  es que su familia goze de mucha salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Petrona is 56 years old.  She has a daughter who works as a high school teacher and earns a salary.  Petrona is an active, responsible and very hard-working person.  She has worked as supervisor in Jacinto Hernandez Hospital for 30 years.  She and her daughter share the household expenses and any financial obligations.  We should mention that this lady has worked with Kiva before.  She used her previous loan to plaster the wall of her house, therefore she feels very satisfied.

Petrona is requesting her 6th loan to build an extension on her house, paint it and thereby continue improving her home.  She earns a wage but what she makes isn't enough to allow her to incur expenses such as these all in one go.  For this reason, she must improve her home with loans which she takes on responsibly.  Her biggest dream in life is for her family to enjoy good health and stability in their work.

loans.use: To build an extension to her home and paint it

loans.name: Michael Chepkwony

texts.en:
Michael Chepkwony M. is a married man of sixty-one years.  He sells fruits in Cheplaskei in Eldoret town.  He has four children. Michael has been in this business for seven years now and earns a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be Michael's first loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the loan to buy  different types of fruits for resale in his business. 

In the future, he wants to complete building his family house (which is half-way built), and to have a wholesale shop for cereals.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits for resale

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Marilu tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez ha desempeñado las tareas agrícolas, hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia, por lo que ahora cuida de las tierras que sus padres le heredaron y de otros que tiene en unión con su esposo; ambos son cultivados y trabajados. Es entonces que las planta de papa, maíz  habas, cebollas entre otros son los productos que cosecha y comercializa en diferentes puntos de la ciudad a los comerciantes minoristas. Durante estos años de experiencia ha visto que este negocio es muy rentable y beneficioso, por los que ahora desea continuar adelante en esta actividad. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en: Marilu is 31 years old.  She lives with her husband and their children in her own home.  Since her childhood she has done agricultural work.  Now, she has become a source of income for her family as she now cares for the land that her parents left her, and the other land she holds together with her husband; they are both farmers and hard workers.  She plants potatoes, corn, and onions among others.  These are the products that she harvests and commercializes in different parts of the city to the small businesses.  During recent years she has seen that the business is very profitable and beneficial and so now she wants to continue moving ahead with this work.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she has always demonstrated that she is responsible in her payments.  Also, she is grateful to be part of the community bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She thanks the people who will fund the loan that she is asking for and that will be very useful in the profess of her business.  With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of bags of fertilizer for the next growing season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Teresita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años ha decidido tener su tienda, vendiendo diversas clases de productos así mismo artículos para la casa. Desde entonces, atiende a sus clientes, quienes están más que satisfechos encontrar lo necesario. Ella considera que su negocio le es rentable debido a la ubicación de su casa, por estar en una zona muy transitada por la gente; además que ayuda el trato amable que ella da a los clientes. Otras de las ventajas que considera ella ser buena para su negocio, es el hecho de que sus proveedores van a su establecimiento, ahorrando así tiempo para estar pendiente de su hijos. Por tanto tiene el deseo de mejorar la infraestructura de su tienda y ampliarla para que pueda vender más productos. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos anteriores, tuvo la oportunidad de   ser integrante de un banco comunal que  se desintegró y en la actualidad solicita un crédito de manera individual, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadearía, como: útiles de escritorio y escolar, por estar en campaña.
texts.en: Miriam is 40 years old and lives with her 2 children at her home.  It has been more than 3 years since she decided to have a store, selling a variety of products and home products alike.  Since then, she tends to her clients who are more than satisfied to find everything they need.  She considers her business to be profitable due to her home being located in a high-traffic zone; also the good customer service she gives her clients.  Other advantages she considers her business to have are that her providers go to her establishement, saving her time so she can care for her children.  She wants to improve the infrastructure of the store and expand so she can sell more products.  This is her 7th loan with MFP and since she has always been responsible with previous payments she is happy to have the financial backing.  She had the opportunity to be part of a communal bank that dismantled and now she solicits the loan individually.  She thanks those who will manage the loan since it will be very useful to the progress of the business.  With the loan requested she will purchase more merchandise, such as; office and school supplies that are in season.

loans.use: Purchase office and school supplies.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana Daysi R. G., de treinta años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a la compañía de sus padres, Ana Patricia y Don Tomas. Ella tiene un comedor en la zona industrial de colonia Santa Elena, del departamento de La Libertad. lugar en el que se sitúan muchas empresas y por lo cual Ana cuenta con muchos clientes, quienes la prefieren por sus deliciosas comidas, higiene y costos accesibles, ella vende desayunos por las mañanas como pupusas, tamales de gallina y almuerzos por las tardes. Ahora Ana Daysi solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar variedad de materia prima, verduras, carnes, mariscos, bebidas y granos básicos como frijoles, arroz, maíz, entre otros. Todo esto necesario para contar con una mayor variedad de platillos  a la hora de las comidas y siempre ser la primera opción para que sus clientes la prefieran. Es así que Ana esta depositando toda su confianza en que a través de incrementar sus ventas diarias podrá aportar mas para ayudar a sus padres y mejorar la calidad de vida de todos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana, 30 years of age, resides in her own house with her parents, Ana and Tomas.  She has a restaurant in the industrial sector of the Santa Elena neighborhoo in La Libertad department.  Here there are many enterprises and for that reason, Ana can count on lots of customers, who prefer her delicious, hygienic, and low-cost meals.  Mornings she sells breakfasts consisting of stuffed tortillas and chicken tamales, and afternoons she sells lunches.

Now, Ana is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy a variety of primary materials; vegetables, meats, sea food, drinks, and basic grains such as beans, rice, and corn, among others.  All the necessary things to make a variety of dishes at meal time; she wants to always make what her customers prefer.

Thus, Ana is confident that increasing her daily sales will increase her ability to help her parents and improve the quality of life for everyone in her home.

loans.use: TO BUY VEGETABLES, MEAT, SEA FOOD,SAUSAGES, AND DRINKS TO PREPARE MEALS TO SELL

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar Eduardo M. G., tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos que son solteros, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar, tiene 8 hijos.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Cesar trabaja en la agricultura como fuentye de ingreso economico para la familia, siembra maiz y trigo y en pocas cantidades legumbres.Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es con el dinero que gane de la venta de la produccion ponerse un negocio.

Los desafíos la sequia afecta en gran magnitud a los cultivos. Le gusta criar cuyes y conejos.
texts.en:
Cesar Eduardo M. G. is 54 years old, married, and lives with his wife and single children in San Miguel in the Tangara area, which belongs to the Province of Bolívar. He has eight children.

The name of this communal bank is “Campesinos Unidos” and it is located in the Tangara area, 15 minutes from the Canton of San Miguel. The members of the communal bank work in farming and in business.

Cesar works in farming for a living, growing corn and wheat, as well as small amounts of vegetables. He buys his products in San Miguel and sells them at the market in the same canton.

He is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers and seeds. The loan will help his family business, as he will produce more and he needs to work to pay off the debt. His dream is to set up a business with the money he earns from selling his crops.

The challenge he faces is drought, which affects his crops greatly. He likes raising guinea pigs and rabbits.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and seeds

loans.name: Regi Henry

texts.es: Regi tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero. Vive con sus padres en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, una zona joven y rural ubicada en la provincia de Chepen en el norte de Perú. Regi se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Los cria en corrales ubicados en un pequeño terreno cerca de su domicilio. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con su préstamo, Regi desea arreglar sus corrales para mejor proteger a sus animales ya que la zona donde vive no es muy segura. Tambien comprará alimento balanceado para usar en la crianza de sus animales. Espera que sus animales logren un mejor tamaño y peso para poder venderlos a un mejor precio. Regi agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en el crecimiento de su negocio,
texts.en: Regi is 34 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the district of Pueblo Nuevo, a new and rural zone located in the province of Chepen in the north of Peru. Regi raises and sells small animals. He raises them in pens on a small plot of land near his home. When they have reached a good level of development, he offers to sell them to the businessmen that usually visit the area. With his loan, Regi wants to fix his pens to better protect his animals, since the area where he lives isn't very secure. He will also buy balanced feed to use to raise his animals. He hopes that his animals will reach a good size and weight so that he can sell them for a better price. Regi thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in the growth of his business.

loans.use: to fix his pens and buy balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Liverpool Group

texts.en:
Teddy J. is in her early thirties and is a widow with two daughters.  She has had a food vending business for one year. She works from 6.00am to 6.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Teddy's 1st loan from Tanzania.  She wants a loan to buy more stock of food items.  Her dream is to one day own a big restaurant.

Teddy will share this loan with her loan group "Liverpool" which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Teddy is in the front row 3rd from left.

loans.use: To buy more food items for resale.

loans.name: Peter Kairu

texts.en: Peter has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. He is 48 years old, married to Jane Nduta and they have one child. Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labur. In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 2 years, Loyce has been operating a clothes vending business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Loyce faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Loyce wants to purchase bundles of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Rie

texts.en:
Rie, 30 years old, is a tailor. She is married to a state teacher and they have two children, 5 and 2 years old. They both get an income of only $5 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $70 on food and $10 on electricity. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics to make those into clothes that she can sell to get some profit. She wants to open a tailoring shop in the future if her career gets successful and she can earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jessilyn

texts.en:
Jessilyn is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Jessilyn has a retail shop that sells "hypo" (cleansing agent). She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making hypo.

Jessilyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jessilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making "hypo" (cleansing agent).

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child, who isn't currently in school. Ibrahim is involved in a grocery business since one year.         

To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used for purchasing grocery items for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ibrahim hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, Ibrahim hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice‘s group is comprised of three hard working women. Alice is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Alice has a business of selling food, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Alice hopes to build a house of her own.  Alice is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business and capital.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karina; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella prepara estofado de pollo, pollo al horno y caldos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar la atención del negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Karina belongs to the “Nueva Alternativa” (New Opportunity) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Karina is 26 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She makes breakfasts, lunches, and dinners.  She makes chicken stew, baked chicken, and soups.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to improve the service at her restaurant.  She is requesting the loan to buy ingredient like meat, chicken, and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Makara

texts.en: Makara is 29 years old and works in construction. His wife works in a factory and their combined income is $11 per day. He has two children who are four and two years old. Every month, he spends $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on rent, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. He is applying for a loan for $1,200 to buy wood that he needs to repair his house. In the future, he would like to open a small beauty salon in his home where his wife could earn an income while also caring for their children.

loans.use: to buy wood to use to repair his house.

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesús

texts.es:
A sus 65 años de edad, Consuelo es una mujer emprendedora que se rebusaca la vida con el propósito de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Consuelo lleva más de 20 años produciendo la tradicional arepa antioqueña, las cuales vende entre sus clientes frecuentes, vecinos de la zona donde ya es reconocida. 

Incrementar sus ventas es el sueño de esta emprendedora que actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar un motor para moler el maíz lo que le permitirá agilizar su producción y hacer mayor número de arepas por día generando mayores ingresos.
texts.en: At 65 years of age, Consuelo is an enterprising woman who uses her wits to get ahead and improve her quality of life. For more than 20 years, Consuelo has produced traditional arepas [corn cakes] from Antioquia, which she sells to her regular customers, neighbors in the area where she is well-known. The dream of this entrepreneur is to increase her sales. In order to do so, she currently needs a loan to purchase a motor to grind corn which will enable her to speed up her production and make a larger number of arepas every day, thereby generating a greater income.

loans.use: to purchase a motor to grind corn.

loans.name: Angel Rafael

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a Ángel, tiene 32 años de edad, está soltero vive con su mamá y un hermano menor. Está en el Banco Comunal hace un año y le gusta porque los créditos son con intereses muy bajos.

Nuestro amigo para ganarse la vida y con esto ayudar a su mamá con los gasto de la casa se dedica al comercio informal, el se dedica a la venta de CD de películas y de música, trabaja de martes a domingo ya que deja el dia lunes para descansar del arduo trabajo, su forma de venta es ambulante pues el recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, además de esto el también realiza trabajos de filmaciones de actos y compromisos sociales los mismos que le dejan muy buenas ganancias, lleva 8 años dedicado a estas actividades.

Este crédito es para comprar CD de música y peliuculas para venta y CD en blaco para realizar sus filmaciones.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia casa para un dia cercano formar su hogar.
texts.en:
The 22 de Julio communal bank meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. The place is known as a commercial area and also for its traditional celebrations in honor of San Pedro and San Pablo as well as for the happiness of its people.

Here we meet Ángel who is 32 years old, single and lives with his mother and a younger brother. He has been a member of the communal bank for one year and he likes it because the interest rates on loans are very low.

In order to make a living and help his mother, our friend is involved in the informal economy. He sells CD’s of movies and music and works from Tuesday to Sunday, since he rests on Monday from the arduous work he does as a street vendor, traveling throughout the city offering his wares. Besides this business, he also works filming proceedings and social events, which provide a very good income. He has been doing this work for 8 years.

This loan is to buy music and film CDs to sell as well as blank CDs to use for his filming.

His dream is to have his own house in order one day soon to establish his own home.

loans.use: to buy music and film CDs, as well as blank CDs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married with 6 children. She is 43 years old.

Elvira owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 1000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3000 to purchase stock for her general store.

Elvira has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Elvira hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Matilde Rosa

texts.es:
MatilD. D. 39 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios sólo D. luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Morropón que pertence al departamento D. Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

MatilD. se dedica a la elaboración, venta D. chicha D. jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base D. maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad lo realiza desD. hace 2 años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado D. generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas D. la chicha D. jora, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  También comercializa aves D. corral, lo que le permite ayudarse con otro ingreso.

Teniendo la oportunidad D. que su negocio crezca MatilD. a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. harina D. maíz para la elaboración D. chicha D. jora y alimento balanceado para sus aves, con la finalidad D. obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y tener mejoras económicas para su familia.
texts.en:
MatilD., 39, lives with her husband and children in her own house which only has electricity and is located in Morropón District belonging to Piura Department.  All the residents in this zone are in farming, animal husbandry and crafts.

MatilD. makes “chicha D. jora” (a delicious beverage maD. from corn and consumed in northern Perú).    She’s been in this line of work for two years since it’s a custom passed down from generation to generation.  Lately, sales of chicha D. jora have increased which has led to a favorable increase in her income and improved quality of life for her family.  She also sells barnyard fowl which helps her with some additional income.

Having the opportunity for her business to grow, MatilD. has requested a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger amounts of corn flour to make the chicha D. jora and to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her fowl hoping to earn higher profits and to increase her number of customers to repay the loan and have improved family economy.

loans.use: to buy corn flour and nutritionally balanced feed for her barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Emin

texts.ru:
Эмин /Emin/ родился в 1959г. в селе Хдранц/Khdrants/, там же он и окончил Агаракскую  сельскую среднюю школу, затем поступил и окончил Капанское Профтехучилище. Эмин  по специальности токарь. Эмин женат имеет сына и двух дочерей. Сын женат и живет отдельно от родителей. Дочки тоже замужем и каждая живет отдельно от родителей ,вместе со своими семьями. Жена Эмина очень помогает мужу по хозяйству. Эмин работает  лесником  в Капанском лесхозе. Кроме работы по специальности с 1994 года Эмин также занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью в селе Хдранц. Имеет крупный рогатый скот, кур, свиней, пчел и огород на котором выращивает овощи. Эмин имеет также собственный земельный участок, где Эмин усердно выращивает  пшеницу. У него есть постоянные клиенты в г. Капане, которые покупают  выращенные им овощи, а также говядину, свинину, мед, яйца, молоко. Так как зарплата лесника маленькая, то выручка  от продажи сельскохозяйственных продуктов очень помогает Эмину содержать как свою семью, так и  помагать семьям своих  детей . 
Эмину нужен кредит 600.000 драм для посевных работ (покупки нового сорта зерна, дизельного топлива), которые намного улучшат производительность сельскохозяйственных продуктов.
texts.en:
Emin was born in 1959 in Khdrants village, there he graduated from Agarak village high school and then enrolled in and graduated from Kapan Vocational School.  Emin is a lathe operator by profession.  Emin is married and has a son and two daughters.  The son is married and lives separately from the parents.  The daughters are also married and each lives separately from the parents with her family.  Emin's wife helps him a lot with managing the household.  Emin works as a forester in the Kapan forest.  

In addition to working in his profession Emin has also been working in agriculture since 1994 in Khdrants village.  He owns livestock, chickens, pigs, bees and a garden where he grows vegetables.  Emin also has a plot of land where he diligently grows wheat.  He has regular customers in Kapan city who purchase vegetables that he grows as well as beef, pork, honey, eggs and milk.  Since a forester's salary is low the earnings from the sale of agricultural products help Emin to support his family and also to help the families of his children. Emin needs a loan of 600,000 dram for planting (purchase a new variety of grain, diesel fuel), which will significantly improve the performance of his agricultural products.

loans.use: To plant (purchase a new variety of grain, diesel fuel)

loans.name: Mujeres Bonitas Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado gracias al apoyo de la señora Mariana. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona. El comité se denomina “Mujeres Bonitas”. Están en el Primer Ciclo y está constituido por 15  integrantes. Tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, trabajan en conjunto para realizar actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad.
La señora Mariana se dedica a la venta de plantas ornamentales, comenta que tiene buenas ventas, ya que tiene muchas clientas que gustan de las plantas que vende. Gracias a este trabajo ella logra aportar para los gastos diarios de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plantas, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad para mostrar a sus clientes y de paso atraer a más.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the support of Mariana who contacted her friends and neighbors to form the group in her area.  The committee is called 'Mujeres Bonitas' (Beautiful Women) and its fifteen members are in their first loan cycle.  They have a great entrepreneurial spirit and work together to carry out activities to collect funds which can save the committee should the need arise.

Mariana's business is selling ornamental plants.  She tells us that she has good sales as she has a lot of customers who like the plants that she sells.  Thanks to this work she manages to contribute towards covering her household's daily expenses.  Mariana is requesting this loan to buy plants which will give her a greater variety to show her customers and, at the same time, attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy ornamental plants for resale

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is 30 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married and has no children. Chona has a barbeque and vegetable vending business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase ingredients for her barbecue and to purchase more vegetables for her vegetable vending as well. Chona has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her barbecue and to purchase more vegetables for her vegetable vending.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 21 years old and married with no children. She owns a general store which she has run for 2 years. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil, andazi (fried dough) and biscuits to sell in her store.

Dative will use any profits towards buying a cow. She would like to one day be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 30 years old and married to a businesswoman. For the last three years, he has made a living by selling mobile phone accessories and money transfer services. He earns about KES 15,000 in a month and supplements this income by charging and repairing phones. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to our organization by a friend. He plans to use the loan to expand his business. His goal for the future is to become finally stable by opening a large store that sells mobile accessories.

loans.use: to expand a mobile phone business.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is married with five children who all go to school. 

For four years, she has had a retail shop. She has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT -SACCO and wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. Kasifa sells on a retail basis and works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation of commodities from Kampala city to her shop in Natete and increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  

She aspires to seeing her business grow so big that she can own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to facilitate transportation.  Kasifa resides in a rented house and the family has electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Bianca

texts.es:
Bianca integrante del Banco comunal “Futuros Emprendedores” perteneciente a la comuna de Peñalolén. 
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo productos de artesanía, entre los cuales se encuentran ropa hindú para dama, varón y niños, además accesorios como; aros, collares, pulseras, pañoletas, entre otros. Todo esto lo ofrece en un puesto que instala en una feria libre y feria persa. Su horario de trabajo es de martes a domingo.
Comenta que su negocio es familiar y está funcionando desde hace 7 años. En éste negocio también trabaja su madre y su hermano. 
La mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras, primordialmente donde los precios sean más convenientes económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio, principalmente productos innovadores.  
Sus metas son seguir prosperando en su negocio y que éste se pueda mantener en el tiempo. 
Bianca vive junto a su madre, su hermano y su hija de 6 años de edad. Bianca comenta que estudia en la Universidad la carrera de derecho, por lo que uno de sus sueños es terminar sus estudios, además le gustaría obtener su vivienda propia y brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que le permite brindar un sustento económico para su familia. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además comenta que la ayuda recibida no es solo monetaria, sino también educativa, ya que con las capacitaciones ha aprendido de contabilidad de una forma más técnica.
Por otro lado el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido, responsable y comprometido.
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
Bianca is a member of the Communal Bank “Futuros Emprendedores” (Future Entrepreneurs) which is located in the town of Peñalolén. She works in the retail trade, specifically selling handcrafted products, which include clothing from India for women, men, and children, and accessories such as rings, necklaces, bracelets, scarves, and other items. She offers all of her merchandise from a vending stall at both the open market and at the Persian fair. Her work schedule is from Tuesday to Sunday.

Bianca says that her venture is a family business that has been in operation for seven years. She works with her mother and brother. Bianca purchases her merchandise from different distributors, especially those that offer the most affordable prices. With this loan she will buy merchandise for her business, mostly innovative products.

Bianca lives with her mother, her brother, and her six-year-old daughter. She says that she is studying at the university for a law degree, so one of her dreams is to finish her studies. In addition, she would like to buy a house of her own and provide her daughter a better quality of life. Bianca is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza so that she can invest in her business. In addition, she says that the assistance she receives not only consists of financing, but it also includes education. As part of her training classes, Bianca has learned more advanced methods of accounting. By working alongside her Communal Bank group, she feels united, responsible, and committed.

Peñalolén is located east of the Metropolitana region. It has several attractions such as vineyards, historical buildings, and natural archaeological sites. These elements have transformed this area into a tourist haven in the Metropolitana region.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Mwamko Ilela Group

texts.en:
Valentin is a 35-year-old father of five children, four of whom attend secondary education. He has grown maize, coffee, beans and cassava for over ten years. He works hard but earns a low income due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.
Valentin is looking for financial help to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. He also desires to expand the scale of his production from 5 to 14 acres in five years in the hope of earning more income for the family's clothes, food and medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 18 years. He describes himself as honest and God-fearing. He operates a carpentry shop where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a highly populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber for making furniture. His business goal is to run more furniture stores within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will run a showroom for furniture.

loans.use: to buy more timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Nahartenga Group

texts.fr:
Mr IDRISSA ZACKARIE représente le groupe NAHARTENGA. Marié, il est père de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 04 vont à l’école et il a 09personnes en charge.
Il est cultivateur et fait l’élevage  depuis 35ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son village. Ses clients viennent de Ouagadougou.
Mr veut s’acheter 02 moutons.
Il veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mr ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation et payer 02 motos pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Idrissa Zackarie represents the Nahartenga Group.  He is married and has six children, the eldest is 22 years old and the youngest is four years old.  Four of his children attend school and he is financially responsible for nine people.

Idrissa Zackarie has been a livestock farmer for 35 years.  He buys his supplies at the local village market, and sells to customers who come from Ouagadougou.  Idrissa Zackarie will use his loan to buy two sheep, and his earnings will be reinvested in his business.  

In the future, he would like to build a house and buy two motorcycles for his family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sheep.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.
