She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved and better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris B. is 36 years old from the village of Sokol. He is married and has two children. His wife is an employee of the Bulgarian Post Company. Five years ago he worked in “Zemya-96” Agricultural Cooperative in Sokol as a combine-operator, but was discharged. So he decided to deal with agriculture.
As he does not own agricultural techniques he uses the loan to pay the services related to harvest the crops – 50 decares sunflower and 10 decares corn. A part of the loan will be used to pay for the rent of the premises where he keeps the production until it is sold.

loans.use: Working capital and harvest the crops

loans.name: Ma. Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hernandez sells clothes in the city markets. She buys new merchandise herself by making trips to the state of Guanajuato. A large part of her sales are orders that her clients place. She says, "I've been doing this for a long time, so I already have my client list and I can easily sell them most of my merchandise. The rest of what I buy I sell in the market. At the moment, I don't have summer items, and I would like to buy a supply. I am asking for a loan of $1200."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. H. vende en los tianguis de la ciudad, ella misma compra la ropa nueva mediante viajes que realiza al estado de Guanajuato, gran parte de sus compras son encargos que le realizan sus clientes. "Llevo ya mucho tiempo haciendo esto así que tengo ya mi lista de clientes y no batallo para acomodar la mayoría de mi mercancía, otra parte de lo que compro lo vendo en el tianguis, por el momento no tengo mercancía de verano y quisiera abastecerme, solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: To buy summer merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en: Ana Maria R. has four grown children and 5 grandchildren. She lives with her husband, Thomas Ismael, in the small town of Rincon located along the beach on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. She sells shoes, children’s clothing, women’s clothing and hair accessories like barrettes, combs, clips, and brushes. She has received and successfully paid back three loans. This loan of $450 will allow her to buy sheets wholesale from the capital of the Samana Province. Ana Maria looks forward to adding bedding to her inventory.

loans.use: Purchase bedding for her retail store.

loans.name: Margrate

texts.en: Margrate  is married, mother of 3 children who are in school. She is an active member of Kandara moonlight women group. She practices farming which is the only source of income. She rears 1 dairy cow on zero grazing. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. Margrate would like to buy a high breed dairy cow. She is applying a loan to be able to buy the cow at once and repay the loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Margaret would like to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa is a hard-working woman. She is married and she and her husband work in their business together. They have six children and they started the business to be able to educate them. Two of their children work with them in the shop. When they started the business María Luisa's husband's salary was too small to support their family. This is why María Luisa decided to open a welding shop with tools that her brother lent her. Since her husband also knew the trade, they started the business and gradually became known for their work. Now they have a successful business but would like to continue expanding it and improve their family's quality of life.

María Luisa is asking for a loan of $275 to buy an electric welder that will help their business a lot and give faster service to their customers. They will pay back the loan in 6 months. She, her husband and their family are very grateful for your support that will help them improve their business.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

María Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora y esta casada, ella y su esposo trabajan en el negocio, ellos tienen seis hijos por los cuales pusieron el negocio para poder educarlos, dos de ellos ayudan a sus padres en el negocio, cuando iniciaron el negocio su esposo trabajaba como empleado con un sueldo base muy pequeño para poder mantener a su familia, y fue en ese entonces que su esposa decidió poner el taller de soldadura, con unas herramientas que le presto su hermano y como su esposo también conocía algo del negocio, lo iniciaron, poco a poco se han hecho conocidos y ahora han podido con su negocio salir adelante pero desean continuar con su crecimiento y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.

María Luisa está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar una planta de soldadura eléctrica que le facilitará mucho el negocio y tendrá mayor rapidez en la atención a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella, su esposo y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que le des para poder mejorar con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy an electric welder

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad lives in the south of Lebanon in the region of Saida with his family. He has eight children.

Ahmad has a pharmacy and needs to buy merchandise to sustain his business. This is the second time he will take a loan from Al Majmoua to buy inventory for his pharmacy. Ahmad is striving to support his family and has started in another job to generate more revenue to provide for his family. This loan will help him do that through the pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Lanza 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria Luz has had a grocery store in her house for 5 years. She is 44 years old, has three children, and her husband is a farmer. The other members of the group are Carolina, who has a candy store in her mother's home; Flor, who sells fruits and vegetables in her house; and Alejandra, who sells butchered chickens. As their businesses are diverse they will share the loan and each woman will invest in purchasing merchandise for her respective business so that she will be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA LUZ TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS , ELLA TIENE 44 AÑOS , TRES HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO . LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO TIENEN COMO ACTIVIDAD : DOÑA CAROLINA UNA DULCERIA EN LA CASA DE SU MAMA , DOÑA FLOR VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN SU CASA Y DOÑA ALEJANDRA VENDE POLLOS TROZADOS COMO SUS ACTIVIDADES SON VARIADAS ELLAS SE REPARTIRAN EL PRESTAMO Y CADA UNA INVERTIRA APORTANDO MERCADERIAS A SUS NEGOCIOS PARA PODER DE ESTA FORMA AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to better supply their businesses

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en: Tuti, 34, is a mother of two sons. Her husband, D., works as a coolie in a fishing area and earns very little. Tuti has to earn extra income to support her family's needs. She sells instant noodles and beverages at her house, earning US$5 a day. Tuti is a member of MBK and is requesing a loan of US$125 to increase her business capital, so she could pay for her children's education. She promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Kamwokya C Group

texts.en:
Catherine N. is a 37-year-old mother of seven children in Kamuli, Uganda. She earns a living selling charcoal, making about $10,000 Ugandan shillings (the equivalent of $9 U.S. dollars) each week. In order to pay for her children's mandatory school fees, Catherine hopes to expand her business.

Catherine has applied for a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars along with four other women. Ayoa has taken out a loan before and paid it back on time, so she is confident that she will be able to repay this one as well. In this type of group loan, the money is divided among each woman to invest in her own business. They guarantee each other's loans, so that if one woman can't repay it, the others will cover her share. Eva M. wants to grow her retail shop; Ruth K. hopes to grow her fish market; Norah N. plans on buying more fruit for her produce stand; and Miranda B. wants to build up her charcoal-selling business.

loans.use: To add in charcoal business and make more profits

loans.name: Lout

texts.en:
Mrs. Lout S., 23, works selling grocery products and earns around $1 a day of profit. 
Her husband Mr. Soun Bora, 23, supplements the household income as a motor-taxi driver. On average, he earns about $5 a day of profit. She will use this loan to purchase more grocery products.

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Armonia 4 Group

texts.es:
Eneida Bonifacia has been selling clothing for two years along with gift items. She purchases her merchandise in Mexico City, which is ten hours away from her home. She travels there every 15 days, or once a month, depending on her sales. She works from home and part of the gift items she sells she makes with creativity, using materials like foam, thread, felt, cloths etc. She is 29 years old, the mother of three and belongs to the group called Armonia 4 (Harmony) along with: Rosario (who sells shoes), Evelia Roselva (who sells cakes), Olga Octavia (who raises chickens and pigs), Ana Isabel (who sells ice) and Frine Dessire (who sells silver jewelry).

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ENEIDA BONIFACIA SE DEDICA DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS A LA VENTA DE ROPA Y ARTICULOS DE REGALO. SU MERCANCIA LO COMPRA EN LA CIUDAD DE MEXICO LOCALIZADO A DIEZ HORAS, ELLA VIAJA CADA QUINCE DIAS O CADA MES DEPENDIENDO CUANTO HA VENDIDO DURANTE ESE TIEMPO. SU NEGOCIO LO TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA, PARTE DE LOS REGALOS QUE VENDE LOS ELABORA CON CREATIVIDAD UTILIZANDO MATERIAL DE FOMI, HILOS, FIELTRO, TELAS, ETC. ELLA TIENE 29 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO ARMONIA 4 JUNTO CON: ROSARIO (VENTA DE ZAPATOS), EVELIA ROSELVA (VENTA DE PASTELITOS), OLGA OCTAVIA (CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y PUERCOS), ANA ISABEL (VENTA DE PALETAS DE HIELO) Y FRINE DESSIRE (VENTA DE JOYERIA DE PLATA).

loans.use: To purchase clothing and gift items.

loans.name: Nadya

texts.id:
The business of Nadya U. is selling packed rice daily. Her husband's income as a driver is not enough to fulfill household needs. That is why she is also working. Every day she sells packed rice around her house in Mertasari Suwung street, Denpasar. Her customers are mostly workers who works in that area. Afterwards in the afternoon she moves to sell in Bdung's market, since in evening that place is packed with visitors. Her daily income is sufficient to fulfill household needs. Nadya U. hopes the help could be used to add business capital., and also to buy an oven and other cooking utensils.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Nadya U. sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penjual nasi bungkus. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai sopir belum cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Karena itu dia juga ikut bekerja. Setiap hari dia berjualan nasi bungkus disekitar rumahnya di Jl. Mertasari Suwung Denpasar. Pelanggannya kebanyakan para pekerja yang bekerja dikawasan itu. Kemudian pada sore harinya dia berjualan di Pasar Badung, karena pada sore hari tempat ini sangat ramai pengunjungnya. Penghasilan yang didapatnya setiap hari cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Nadya U. mengharapkan bantuan untuk dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha dan juga untuk membeli kompor dan peralatan masak.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increased capital to grow her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana F., 67, is married with 12 children.  She has 1 year year of experience in the pancake/porkbun business. She sells to the village and public people 5 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $125 USD).  SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  This loan will be used for the business.  Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and a big frying pan

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a 29-year-old married mother of 4 living children. She lives with her husband in Kisumu, Kenya. She initiated her retail shop business in 2006. She sells essential items such as bread, rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation, and 2 years in business, coupled with a well established client base, ensure that her business will continue to grow. She has applied for a loan of US$350 to help her purchase additional stock of essential commodities for sale.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To add stock of essential commodities

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 53 años, en la actualidad vive con la menor de sus hijos que tiene 15 años.
El talento para la cocina, le permite hoy, a Margarita, sostenerse económicamente, ella y su hija. Todas las mañanas vende diversos platos a base de pescado (ceviche, chilcano y leche de tigre) en un kiosko cercano a su casa, por la buena sazón y el esmero con el que atiende a los comensales, ha visto crecer significativamente su clientela.Se levanta muy temprano en la mañana para preparar estos potajes, para esto, en la tarde del día anterior ya ha comprado los ingredientes, para ella su negocio, más que un trabajo, es una distracción, se siente satisfecha al final del día, por realizar un buen trabajo.
Margarita desea superarse cada día, y ayudar a su hija a que se conduzca por el camino, este es el motivo de su esfuerzo.
Solicita este préstamo, que invertirá para la mejora de su negocio, su deseo es arrendar un local amplio y convertirlo en una marisquería.
texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and she lives with her youngest daughter who is 15 years old. Her talent in the kitchen had supported her financially. Every morning she sells different sea food dishes (ceviche, chilcano and tiger milk) at a kiosk near by her home, because she is a great cook and her good service, her customers have increased considerably. She wakes up early in the morning to prepare the food and buys the ingredients the previous afternoon, for her this is more than work, is also pleasure and she feels satisfied at the end of the day after finishing a good job. Margarita wants to improve herself each day and guide her daughter on the right direction, this is her motivation. She is requesting the loan to invest it on improving her business, she wants to rent a bigger place and turn it into a sea food restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a bigger place and turn it into a sea food restaurant

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Mr. Sou L., 40, is married and is a father of one child. He and his wife work as tailors, sewing clothes in batch and then reselling them to a broker who normally comes to collect them. In 1998, he and his wife learnt tailoring skills from a tailor who lives close to his community, and a few months afterward, the couple started their own business. Presently, the tailoring business is doing well for their family and they can collectively make a gross daily income of around US$15.

With the ambition of going ahead and expanding his business, Mr. Sou L. and his wife would like to purchase more sewing machines to both accelerate their tailoring works and provide rental income.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en: Hosiyat, a mother of 3 kids, has an old small store where she sells consumer products and foodstuffs. She buys her goods in another city which is far from her town. She goes for goods every week. Her family members also help her at the store. Her products are popular in her town for being cheap. That’s why she has many constant clients. She wants to take a loan for repairing her old store and purchasing more goods to have more profit.

loans.use: For repairing her old store and purchasing more goods

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es: Yoni tiene 26 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijitos con quienes también vive. Se dedica a la agricultura, en especial a la siembra de maíz, palta y café, actividad que viene realizando  por más de 15 años. Le agrada dedicarse a la agricultura, dentro de ello le gusta la siembra de  maíz y palta,  además estos son rentables  en diversas temporadas, los mercados demandan gran cantidad de producción para trasladarla a los mercados. Lo difícil es la limpieza constante de sus terrenos y cuidarlos de los insectos que dañan los frutos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. La cantidad solicitada será invertida en la compra de  abonos  y semillas de  maíz.
texts.en:
Yoni is 26 years old, lives with her partner and has two small children who also live with her. She is dedicated to agriculture, particularly planting corn, avocado and coffee, an activity she has done for more than 15 years. She enjoys farming and likes planting corn and avocado, especially because they are profitable in different seasons, the markets demand a great quantity of production to be brought to them. The difficulty is constantly cleaning their lands and taking care of the insects that damage the fruit. This is her first loan with MFP. The amount she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and corn seed.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is not married. He lives with his mother. He has a car repair business. He has been in this business for 15 years. He likes cars and likes fixing them. His average income is 5,000 UAH per month. 

Anatoliy is a hard-working and very responsible person. The clients value his skills as well as his honesty. Thus, he has many repeat clients. 

Anatoliy needs to purchase a piece of equipment for his shop.  He would like to get a loan of 7,500 UAH. It will allow him to offer more services to his clients and to develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Kujoji

texts.en:
Kujoji T. is sixty-five years old. He is married and has four children. One if his children is a male and the rest are all females. He lives with his family in a town called Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. According to him, all of his children dropped out of school for no apparent reason, despite the fact that he was ready to sponsor them to the ultimate.

Kujoji owns a corn mill for commercial purposes in his community. Since he has a monopoly, all the people in his town come to him for such services. He mills corn for food vendors and all. Kujoji has been in business for over ten years. He has hired people who work for him. He says his son also works with him. He wants a loan so he can acquire more mills for other purpose such as for milling vegetables and other foodstuffs. It is his dream to expand his business by opening branches in neighboring communities.

loans.use: To buy more milling machines

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 40-year-old married man with three children, living in Harat Hreik in the Beirut suburbs. In 2003, he started a very innovative business, which is the manufacturing of recyclable paper bags. Today, Mohammad wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy a paper-bag pressing machine to improve his paper bags' quality.

loans.use: Buy a paper bag pressing machine

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en: Antoine is a 50-year-old married man with two children, living in A. Moualaka in the Bekaa valley. He has been a butcher for 30 years, a trade he learned from his father. Antoine wants to borrow $1,000 in order to buy a refrigerator to display his goods.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El Sr. Celso A. tiene 61 años de edad, el reside en la Aldea Caucara, el tiene 40 años de estar casado con la sra Concepcion Alvarado, y tiene una nieta la cual tiene 4 años de edad.
su negocio es la venta de productos de consumo popular y este negocio lo ha sostendo durante 10 años y gracias a su negocio ha podido salir adelante ya que el Huracan Mitch en el año 1998 le destruyo su casa, mas sin embargo ha podido salir adelante a pesar de los duro que fue esa experiencia.
el necesita el presstam para surtir su pulperia ya que quiere tener una mayor variedad de productos y asi tener mayores ventas.
el sueño de el es poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Celso A. is 61 years old and lives in Aldea Caucara. He is 40 years old, married to Mrs. Concepcion Alvarado, and has a 4 year old grandchild. His business is selling general merchandise and this business has supported him for 10 years. Thanks to this business he has been able to be successful as Hurricane Mitch destroyed his home in 1998, nevertheless he has been able to success in spite of this difficult experience. He needs a loan to stock his store as he wants to have a greater variety of products in order to have greater sales. His dream is to be able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, baked goods, refreshments, tortillas, beans, rice, butter, sugar, margarine, salsa, soup, crackers, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Mai thị Quế năm nay 67 tuổi, gia đình chị có bốn con đã trưởng thành . Chị là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 1994. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đang chăn nuôi và trồng trọt tại nhà. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu ổn định từ lương hưu của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của các con  vơi thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua thêm lợn, gà và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mai Thị Quế is 67 years old and has four grown children. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1994. Currently, she and her husband raise animals and grow crops on their own land. Each month, in addition to the income they earn from raising animals, her husband receives a steady retirement pension and their children provide some financial support. Their total income is 5,000,000 VND (288 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Quế hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1150 USD) to buy pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
NINFA R. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en el Jr pachitea nº 785. del distrito de Calleria, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 57 años de edad y su pareja es ganadero

Se inició en el negocio de venta de comida y gaseosas, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró gaseosas y golosinas.

Actualmente se dedica a al venta de productos de la Región, tiene la oportunidad de ir a las chacras y trae los diferentes productos para venderlos a sus vecinos.  Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más productos como frutas para abastecer su negocio.  También hará arreglos del local.

“Muchas veces tenemos oportunidades pero no sabemos aprovecharlas, sin embargo Manuela Ramos nos da la oportunidad de obtener créditos para aumentar nuestro capital y así contar con mas ingreso en la casa”.
texts.en:
NINFA R. C. belongs to the “LAS MARGARITAS” cooperative bank. She lives in the Calleria district of the city of Pucallpa, is 57 years old, and her partner is a rancher. She started in the business of selling food and soft drinks with her first loan of 300.00 soles, which she used to buy sodas and sweets/snacks. Currently, she dedicates herself to selling regional products. She has the opportunity to go to the farms and bring back different products to sell to her neighbors. With this loan of 2,200.00 soles she will buy more product, such as fruit, with which to supply her business. “Many times we have opportunities, but don’t know how to take advantage of them. Regardless, Manuela Ramos gives us a chance to obtain loans to augment our capital allowing us to increase the income we bring to our households.”

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy regional food products (fruits).

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Абдучалил Кароматов живет в районе Вахш. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдучалил занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более 10 лет. Это является главным источником дохода, для содержании семьи. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы купить семена пшеницы и подсолнуха. После благоприятного посева, собрать и продать. А на полученные деньги купить еще семян.
texts.en:
Abdujalil K. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 31 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Abdujalil works in agriculture. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. This is his main source of income for supporting his family. The client would like to get a loan from us in order to purchase seeds for wheat and sunflowers. After a good planting he will collect the harvest and sell it. He will use the received money to purchase more seeds.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es: Blanca Nidia C. A. tiene 42 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijas menores de edad y que aun van a la escuela, como es común, ella es una madre soltera, el negocio de Blanca es la venta de ropa, zapatos y una pequeña pulpería en su hogar, empezó con este negocio desde hace 8 años, empezó vendiendo ropa y zapatos en la calle de manera ambulante con una canasta, hasta que sus hijas de 11 y 12 años le dieron la idea de establecer una pulpería en su hogar de habitación, de esta  manera las pequeñas se comprometieron en atender la pulpería en el tiempo que no estuviesen en clases y asi su mama Blanca podría salir a vender los otros artículos, luego Blanca obtuvo muchos clientes a quienes les dio la dirección de su casa y no tener que caminar demasiado de esta manera sus hijas pueden entregarse por completo al estudio ahora que ya están por entrar a la universidad, su sueño es ampliar su negocio y establecer una miscelánea y su mas grande desafío es terminar de preparar a sus hijas y para lograr esto necesita mantener su negocio estable es por eso que necesita que se le otorgue un préstamo que le ayude a surtir su pulpería para abastecer todo el reparto en el cual vive.
texts.en:
Blanca Nidia C. A. is 42. She has two minor daughters who still go to school. As is common, she is a single mother. Blanca’s business is selling clothes and shoes. She also has a small mini market in her home. She started this business eight years ago. She started as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes from a basket. She did this until her eleven and twelve year old daughters gave her the idea to set up a mini market in their home. This way the little ones promised to tend the store when they were not in class. Then, their mother, Blanca, would be able to sell the other articles. Blanca then got many customers to whom she gave her home address. This way she does not have to walk too much, and her daughters can completely devote themselves to their studies. Her daughters will be entering the university. Her dream is to expand her business and open a general store. Her biggest challenge is to finish preparing her daughters. In order to do this she needs to keep her business stable. That is why she needs a loan. She needs help to stock her mini market in order to meet the demands of her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dinora Elena

texts.es:
La señora Dinora Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 22 y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Motivada por su espíritu joven y su energía emprendedora, iniciaron ella y su pareja su propio negocio  de servicio de vulcanizado de llantas , con un capital de S/. 300.00, su taller se encuentra ubicado en un local muy bien acondicionado, cuenta con clientes fijos y es ella quien  los atiende con su carisma y buen trato.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, esta satisfecha con lo que hace y con los ingresos que genera a diario, así se siente muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas a pagar en el Banco Comunal.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  una maquina compresora, una prensa y plancha y un esmeril de banco. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando repuestos y lubricantes, productos que también tiene agregado para satisfacer a sus clientes.

 Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su pareja y familia, por lo que reconoce y agradece el apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres, que quieren emprender su negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, así también salir adelante solas, sin depender de nadie.
texts.en:
Dinora Elena belongs to the "La Paz II" communal bank in the district of Tarapoto, Mariscal Cáceres Province in the state of San Martín. She is single, 22 years old and has 2 dependent children. Motivated by her young spirit and entrepeneurial energy, her husband and her started their own business vulcanizing tires with 300 Nuevos Soles in capital. The workshop is located in a well airconditioned location and they have regular clients that they take care of with charisma and very good treatment. Currently, she continues with the same business; she is satisfied with what she does and with the income that she earns daily. She is very responsible and punctual with the payments to the communal bank. With this loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles she will buy a compressor machine, a press, an iron and a bench grinder. Part of the money will be invested in the purchase of spart parts and lubricants, products that are used to satisfy her clients. She is very happy since despite the difficulties she faced, she, along with her family, were able to get ahead which is why she acknowledges and is grateful for the support that the Manuela Ramos organization provides to her and other women that want to start their own business and earn their own income to be able get ahead on their own without depending on anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for business

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: seynabou D. est une vendeuse de poissons qui habite dans la zone de camberene et est parente beneficiaire depuis 1998.elle capitalise une experience de plus de dix ans dans ce domaine.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs dans le but d'augmenter le niveau de son commerce  ceci etant du a son ouverture vers d'autres marches.
texts.en:
Seynabou D. is a fishmonger who lives in the Camberene area. She has been a recipient parent since 1998. She is capitalizing on over ten years of experience in this domain. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs with the goal of increasing her level of business, since she is opening into other markets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Martha Ryder

texts.es: Martha Ryder Ramírez R. tiene la edad de 35 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. Martha dio inicio a su negocio hace más de 3 años. Por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles, anteriormente Martha se dedicaba a brindar el servicio de costura, pero no pudo seguir manteniendo este negocio, además con lo que ganaba no era suficiente para mantener a sus hijos, es así que decide incursionar en esta actividad económica con el fin de obtener más ingresos. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pan y golosinas en general. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martha Ryder Ramírez R. is 35, married, and has two dependent children. Martha started her business over three years ago. In the beginning, it was very difficult. Martha previously worked as a seamstress. But, she could not maintain this business. Also, she did not earn enough to support her children. She decided to start a new economic activity to get more income. The loan is for working capital to buy juice, soft drinks, natural drinks, bread, and general sweets. Her biggest wish is for her children to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the Frelimo B borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 36 Years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 9 and 4 years.

Asunta started her own shop business selling rice,cooking oil,sugar 4 years ago.she works 12 hours a day and earn  monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shilling.

This is Asunta first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more sugar,rice.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Asunta hopes to save more money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  more sugar,cooking oil,rice

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander F. E. reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Alexander cuenta con 33 años de edad, se encuentra soltero y vive con su madre quien se dedica a la venta de carnes y su hermana soltera pero madre de tres hijos menores de edad. Alexander es el hombre de familia el apoyo para las dos mujeres del hogar su madre y hermana. Alexander se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras posee su carro con el cual se transporta a varios pueblos y colonias para ofrecer de sus productos. Alexander solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio con una gran cantidad de plátanos  ya que estos son muy demandados y obtendrá ganancias inmediatas.
texts.en:
Alexander F. E. lives in the town of Apopa in the department of La Libertad. Alexander is 33 years old, single and lives with his mother who sells meat and his single sister who has three young children. Alexander is the head of the household, supporting both his mother and his sister. Alexander sells fruits and vegetables from a cart that he takes to different neighborhoods to sell his products. Alexander is asking for a loan to purchase a large quantity of bananas since they are very popular and will generate immediate profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas for his business

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer trabajadora y muy activa, tiene 39 años y madre de un adolescente, es divorciada, se dedica a la decoración de ambientes para cumpleaños y todo tipo de agasajos, trabaja junto a su hermana en esta actividad, forma parte del Banco Comunal “Siete estrellas” desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo que recibió le permitió invertir en bebidas como gaseosa, refrescos.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000 soles invertirá en la compra de telas y algunos artículos que utiliza para la decorar. La meta de Sandra es tener un local bien implementado para poder ofrecer sus servicios de decoración y también traer de Lima artículos para regalos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hard-working, very lively woman of 39. She is divorced and the mother of a teenager. She works decorating places for birthday parties and all types of celebrations. Her sister works with her, and she has been a member of the community bank “Siete estrellas” (Seven Stars) for the past three years. The first loan that she received allowed her to invest in soft drinks, and carbonated beverages. With this loan of 1000 new soles ($350 US), she will purchase fabrics and other articles that she will use for decorating. Her goal is to have a well-stocked business location so that she can offer her decorating services and also bring gift items to sell from Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and articles for decorating.

loans.name: Benielyn

texts.en:
Benielyn works as a manicurist in her village in Addalam Jones, Isabela. She is married to Elison, a farmer.  They were gifted with four children: Jazzrel, 12 years old; Krisca, 10 years old; Mark Acon, 2 years old; and the youngest, Benson Jay, 6 months old.

Benielyn would like to buy a new manicure and pedicure kit that she can use in the business.  She usually offers home service by going house to house to offer her service.   With this, she is able to support their daily needs.  She is asking to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000 that she needs to buy a nipper, nail polish and other materials needed in her daily routine.

loans.use: To purchase a new manicure and pedicure kit

loans.name: Alice Muthoni

texts.en:
Alice Muthoni is 41 years old and married with three children. She has dairy cows which help her to supply milk to her customers in the Thamanda area. She has been running this business for three years and now makes monthly profit of approximately 25,000 Kenyan shillings. Alice wants to buy two more dairy cows in order to meet increased demand. She has never borrowed from another MFI. One day, she hopes to own a big dairy farm to supply milk to other areas.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: Buying two more dairy cows to produce milk to sell

loans.name: Sivutha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivutha S. lives in Preak Ta En village in Kandal province. She is a teacher in the local school. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are sellers while another is attending the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

Mrs. Sivutha S.’s husband, Mr. Cheng Mao, is a fisherman and he is also a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He is on the right in the photo.

For his plantation, Mr. Cheng Mao needs some money to buy rice seed, pesticides, and to pay for plowing the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Sivutha S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pesticides for her husband's rice field and to pay for plowing it

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Cette dame très dynamique exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. Elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local d’adawlato. La période des fêtes étant proche, elle veut gonfler son stock pour pouvoir mieux vendre et augmenter ses profits. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 40 pagnes HI-TARGET, 20 pagnes SUPER-WAX, 25 pagnes SOSO.
Elle est mariée, elle apporte une contribution financière à son foyer grâce à son commerce
texts.en:
This very dynamic lady runs a revenue-generating activity selling pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth). She runs her business at the local market in Adawlato. With the holiday season approaching, she wants to increase her stock to be able to sell more and increase her profits. She is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 40 Hi-Target pagnes, 20 Super-Wax pagnes, and 25 Soso pagnes. She is married, and contributes financially to her household thanks to her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth)

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher has a stall where he sells building materials at retail prices to his customers. He is a focused, hard worker. He is a LAPO client. LAPO, a Kiva partner, is committed to improving lives. 

He is 42 years old and married with four children. His wife sells sarongs to support the home. He hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Unidas En El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
Marisol cuenta con algo de nostalgia que fue su ex esposo la que la impulso a dedicarse a la cocina. El era barman en un restaurante y siempre observo que la comida que servían no era buena y  la gente no estaba contenta el  siempre decía  que su esposa cocinaba mejor, es así que  consigue que la contraten para un evento y ese fue el despegue para que se haga conocida, con su buena sazón y con la ayuda de su mama es que empieza en este negocio. Ella  misma preparo sus tarjetas personales ofreciendo sus servicios a toda persona que conocía, de esta manera ella misma se publicito y los resultados fueron buenos por que la empezaron a llamar de todos lados. La contratan para fiestas de cumpleaños, aniversarios, eventos etc.
En verano también  se ayuda por que recibe contratos de familias para sus casas de playa, por lo cual obtiene buenas ganancias, también  vende productos herbalife todas estos trabajos la ayudan a cubrir sus necesidades y la de sus 2 hijos por que ella es separada y  los mantiene sola, a Marisol le agrada mucho la cocina y se siente feliz. Para mas adelante ya esta pensando en poner su propio restaurante donde pueda atender a todos sus clientes, lo que ahora hace es eventual y ella quiere algo seguro y estable, sabe  que en este proyecto  recibirá la ayuda de sus hijos  y de EDAPROSPO la entidad con la que se siente agradecida por que ha logrado muchas cosas, su actual préstamo lo va a usar comprando productos de herbalife por que tiene muchos productos por entregar a sus clientas.


*La Señora Marisol F. Es la que viste polo plomo
texts.en:
Marisol explains nostalgically that her ex-husband helped her become a cook. He was the barman in a restaurant and he always noticed that the food they served wasn’t good and the people weren’t happy. He always said his wife cooked better and that’s how she got them to hire her for an event. That’s how it took off and she became known. She started in this business with her good seasoning and the help of her mother. She made her own personal cards offering her services to every person she knew. She advertised herself and the results were good because they began calling her from all over. They hire her for birthday parties, anniversaries, events, etc. In the summer she also helps herself because she gets contracts from families for their summer houses. She makes a good profit for this. She also sells Herbalife products. All these jobs help her cover her needs and those of her 2 children. She is separated and she supports them herself. Marisol likes cooking a lot and she feels happy. She is already thinking of opening her own restaurant in the future where she could wait on all her customers. What she is doing now is temporary. She wants something safe and stable. She knows that she’ll have her children’s and EDAPROSPO’s help con this project. She’s thankful for the organization because she has achieved a lot of things. She’ll use her current loan to buy Herbalife products because she has many products to deliver to her customers. *Mrs. Marisol F. is the one with the gray shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE HERBALIFE PRODUCTS

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sandra es cliente nueva, se dedica a la elaboracion de tarjetas de navidad y un sin fin de adornos utilizando goma eva, pintura, escarcha y cartulina, esta actividad no solo la realiza por la epoca de navidad sino tambien para fiestas infantiles y otros acontecimientos, en realidad esta actividad la realiza todo el año con distintas actividades.  Ademas dicta clases particulares en su domicilio donde enseña todo este tipo de trabajos manuales, para estar al dia en todo lo concerniente a su actividad trata siempre de estar al dia con nuevas tecnicas y diseños tratando siempre de tomar cursos de actualizacion. La cliente vive en casa familiar junto a sus dos pequeños niños y a su mama quien es dueña de la casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is a new client. She makes Christmas cards and a multitude of decorations using goma eva (Ethylene Vinyl Acetate glue), paint, glitter, construction paper. She doesn't just do these crafts during the Christmas season but also for children's parties and other events. Actually, this is a year-round activity for her. Besides, she teaches all kinds of crafts classes in her home. In order to be up-to-date on everything concerning her line of work she always strives to be current on new techniques and designs by taking training courses to stay current. She lives with her two small children and her mother, who owns their house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mr. Ya Y., 52, and his wife, Mrs. Man Son (pictured together), 51, live in a village along national road number one approximately 20km from Phnom Penh City. They have only one son who attends school. Besides his son, he also has his elderly mother living with him.  

Ya has been driving a motor taxi in Phnom Penh for four years. Mrs. Man Son has been running a grocery store in her village for 24 years. Ya is asking for his first loan of $800 to build a new shop and buy additional grocery items for his wife’s inventory.

loans.use: To build a new shop and buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy, de 32 años, vive en una casa alquilada al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijas, por quienes trabaja sin descanso.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro, este vehículo logró comprarlo con el dinero que fue ahorrando. Por ello, las ganancias del día son integras, sólo  invierte en gasolina y en alguna reparación de vez en cuando.
A Freddy le gusta mucho su actividad porque pasea por las calles de su ciudad y se distrae, pero lo que le desagrada es que debido a las múltiples reparaciones de agua y desagüe en las calles tiene dificultades para desplazarse. 
Para el futuro, tiene pensado comprar otro motocarro para alquilarlo y obtener ganancias adicionales.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Freddy tiene pensado destinar el dinero que solicita en el mantenimiento a su motocarro, además de tramitar su nueva licencia para seguir manejando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Freddy, 32, lives in a rented house with his wife and two daughters, for whom he works incessantly. For the past 2 years he has provided passenger transportation services. He managed to buy his vehicle with savings that he amassed gradually. Because of this, whatever profits he makes are all his; his only costs are gasoline and the occasional vehicle repair. Freddy likes his work very much because he can drive through the city's streets, which is a pleasant distraction for him. What he does not like so much is the several repair works being done to municipal water and drainage systems, which make travel through the city difficult. For the future, he plans to buy another vehicle to lease out in order to make additional income. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because he does not want to disappoint his fellow communal bank members. Freddy plans to use part of the funds for vehicle maintenance and part for his driver's licence renewal so that he can continue to drive problem-free.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle service and maintenance.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Mrs. Ren U. is a 29 year-old married woman who lives in Prey Run village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Art Eng, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. The couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Aside from farming, her husband is also a well digger but can earn only a little income to support his family. (Her husband is on the right of the picture.) Although they try to work hard, they still cannot earn enough money to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Ren U. is now requesting for 6,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy four piglets to breed. With this loan, Mrs. Ren U. hopes to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy four piglets.

loans.name: Juan Arturo

texts.es: El joven Juan Arturo C. T. vive con su mama, es un joven soltero pero muy trabajador, quien labora para una empresa de publicaciones e informaciones, además que trabaja para un negocio los fines de semana como ayudante, lo cual representa la persona responsable que es. El esta tramitando un crédito para la remodelación de la cocina de su casa como un regalo para su mama.
texts.en:
The young man Juan Arturo C. T. lives with his mother. He is single but very hard working. He works for a publishing and information business. In addition, he works for another business on the weekends as a helper. This shows what a responsible person he is. He is seeking a loan in order to remodel the kitchen in his house as a gift for his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling the kitchen in his house

loans.name: Lary's Group

texts.en:
Lary B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Lary is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lary has a retail business selling dry goods (rice). The main source of income for the business comes from selling her own harvested rice. Lary has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2004, Lary joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lary is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for rice production. This loan will be her seventeenth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy DVDs, a DVD player, and screen

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona J. is from the village of Kilambon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rona is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bazaroy

texts.ru: Тагайкулова Базарой проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 40 лет. Разведена, имеет 4 детей. Образование средне - специальное. Работает учительницей в средней школе. Одновременно занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Она в основном занимается покупкой и продажей крупно - рогатого скота. В этой области более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Bazaroy T. lives in the Yavan district. She is 40 years old, divorced and has 4 children. She has a secondary-specialized education and works as a teacher at a secondary school. Concurrently, Bazaroy is involved in animal husbandry. She breeds livestock at home. She is primarily involved in buying and selling cattle and has been in this business for over 20 years. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Rong

texts.en:
Mr. Rong S., 39, lives in Ta Skor village, Kandal province, where he works as a fisherman, while his wife, Mrs. Salim Young, earns income selling cakes. Through these activities, the couple is supporting five children, three of whom are attending a local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.
At the moment, Mr. S. is facing difficulties in his work, as the equipment he uses for fishing is too old and worn out. Mr. S. is therefore asking for a loan to be able to buy a new fishing net and fix his old fishing board. The rest of the loan will be used by his wife to buy more cakes for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of a fishing net and repair of a fishing board

loans.name: Kholbegim

texts.ru: Хайдарова Холбегим проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж, на заработках в России. Сама Холбегим имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Она продает фрукты на рынке. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
H. Kholbegim lives in the Shahrituz region. She's fifty-three years old, married and has five children. Her husband works in Russia. She has a high school education and has for over five years sold fruit on the market. She's asking for a loan to increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as zinc, sand, blocks and wood to fix the roof of his house.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 31 años, es una joven soltera muy emprendedora, vive en casa de sus padres. Marlene, se dedica diariamente a vender periódicos, revistas y dulces en general. Procura siempre colocar en orden para que sea vistoso y sea fácil la venta. Su kiosco se encuentra ubicado en el paradero de buses, favoreciéndole la venta por ser muy concurrida, este negocio le es rentable. Años atrás este puesto de periódicos era de su madre, en donde la ayudaba en el trabajo pero luego que falleciera, se hizo cargo del kiosco. Hoy se siente satisfecha por el trabajo que desempeña; ya han transcurrido 2 años y ahora su mayor prioridad es terminar de construir su casa para instalar una bodega en donde tiene la ilusión de vender productos comestibles, ya que por barrio donde vive hace falta este servicio. Es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que el crédito le será muy útil para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, adquirirá más revistas y accesorios para su negocio, de esa manera  abastecer su kiosco.
texts.en:
Marlene is 31 years of age and an enterprising young woman who lives at her parents' house. Every day she sells newspapers, magazines, and candy. Marlene always tries to arrange her products in a way that they can be seen and easily sold. Her kiosk is situated in a favorable location at a busy bus stop, thereby helping to make her business profitable. Years ago this newsstand belonged to her mother and Marlene helped with the work, but she took over after her passing. Today she is satisfied with her work. Two years have passed and now her greatest priority if finishing the construction of her house so that she can establish a store where she can sell groceries. Her neighborhood is lacking this type of service.

This is her first loan with MFP. Marlene knows the loan will be very useful in increasing her operating capital, so she commits to completing all of her payments on time. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more magazines and accessories for her business so that her kiosk remains well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase magazines & newpapers

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina nació en Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus hijos. Cristina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues siempre está trabajando y así es la única forma D. darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos. Cristina en el año 1974 abrió un pequeño puesto en el mercado central D. la ciudad D. Urubamba, donD. vendía abarrotes  y verduras. En el Año 1990 motivado por su esposo se arriesgo para vender carne en el mismo puesto D. venta y por el momento le va muy bien. Cristina también tiene un su domicilio una tienda D. abarrotes y un restaurante “El Descanso”. El restaurante  estuvo cerrado por varios meses pero ahora por el mes D. agosto abrirá D. nuevo y contratara una persona para que atienda el negocio. El motivo D. la reapertura es porque cerca D. su casa están haciendo una obra y los trabajadores necesitaran almuerzo. 
  
Con su próximo préstamo, Cristina espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básica. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para implementar el restaurante y comprar gaseosas e insumos.   

Cristina pertenece al banco comunal  “Señor D. Torrechayoc” y es socia fundadora. DesD. el año 1994 que se abrió el banco comunal, ella sigue participando y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado D. la ciudad D. Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in Urubamba, an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco where she currently lives with her husband and children. Cristina is an enterprising woman who is always working hard as she believes this is the only way to give her children a better quality of life. In 1974, Cristina opened a small stall in the central market of Urubamba where she sold groceries and vegetables. In 1990, motivated by her husband, she ventured into the sale of meat at the same market stall and for the moment, she is doing very well. Cristina also runs a grocery store from her home and a restaurant called “El Descanso”. The restaurant was closed for several months but it will re-open in August and she will hire someone to look after the business. The reason for re-opening the store is because they are doing construction work near her home and the workers will need lunch. With her next loan, Cristina hopes to receive S/. 1500 nuevos solos. For the moment, her restaurant is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would like to use the money from the loan to equip the restaurant and buy sodas and supplies. Cristina belongs to the “Señor D. Torrechayoc” communal bank which she herself founded in 1994. She continues to participate and the group is doing very well. The communal bank was named in honor of the patron saint of Urubamba in whom all the members have faith.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip the restaurant and purchase sodas and supplies.

loans.name: Reyhum

texts.en:
Reyhum D. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old and single. Reyhum owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, candies, noodles, canned goods and bread in the local community. Reyhum has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Reyhum joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reyhum is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Reyhum from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 2 Group

texts.en:
Yamiris is the coordinator of her group Caminando con Jesus 2 (Walking with Jesus). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have her own home. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying listening to music.

Yamiris is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 6 months, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear and silver jewelry. She will use the profits to buy some school supplies, and invest in her business. She dreams of having her own home, where they can live safely and comfortably, and to give her children a good education so that they can be professionals when they have grown up.  

This Esperanza associate began with us because she found in Esperanza a way to work and be at home, with great facilities and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear and silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Leonardo Enrique

texts.es:
Leonardo de 34 años, tiene una pequeña panadería en una parte de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Por la falta de oportunidades desde pequeño el comenzó a trabajar en una panadería y a ganar su propio dinero, cuando creció decidió que esa iba a ser su principal actividad económica. Compro un horno pequeño y comenzó hacer panes y venderlos por el sector. Ahora el hace panes y rosquitas rojas de harina (en la foto se las ve) para sus clientes desde las 08h00 hasta el anochecer. 

Para seguir con su negocio y que la producción de pan sea mas rápida el quiere comprar con el préstamo maquinas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que ahora es de caña.
texts.en:
Leonardo, age 34, has a small bakery in part of his house. He lives in a periurban zone called "Duran". This area is characterized by its distressed ecology. Due to lack of opportunities, he started working in a bakery at a young age to make his own income. When he grew up, he decided that this would be his main job. He bought a small oven and started to make bread and sell it throughout the area. He now makes breads and red donuts from flour (pictured in the photo) for his customers from 8:00 until nightfall. In order to continue with his business and speed up his production, he wants to purchase machines with his loan. In the future he wants to finish building his home, which is currently made of bamboo.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: machines

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie V. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 59 years old. Rosie is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Rosie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jane Adhiambo

texts.en:
Jane Ambok is 36 years old and a widow. Her husband died four years ago and she was left with the burden of taking care of their two children, now aged 15 and 12. They live in Migori town.

For the pst 13 years, Jane has had a business selling secondhand clothes. Her monthly income comes to 15,000.Kenyan shillings. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. Her desire is to see her business grow and she intends to use the money to help her buy five bales of used clothes to add to her stock. 

Her desire is to build her own house and cease from paying rent and living in rental houses.

loans.use: To buy five bales of clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks and more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Paix Plus Group

texts.en:
Paix Plus is a community bank of 19 owners of small businesses who selected Evelyne as chairwoman. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the microfinance institution (MFI) HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses. They organized themselves by affinity and proximity.

Evelyne earns a living by selling loaves of bread in her neighborhood located southwest of Kinshasa. She has more customers. She started her business in 2000 with a beginning capital of US$50. She has already received six loans from HOPE DRC and repaid them correctly. Her business brings in a profit of US$40 each week.  

Evelyne is planning with the next loan to purchase 40 boxes of loaves of bread to resell at a profit. Her ambition is to provide loaves of bread to more than a thousand customers in the medium term. 

She is 40 years old, married and the mother of six children between the ages of 4 and 11. She is also responsible for eight other children left in her care by relatives.

loans.use: To buy 40 boxes of loaves of bread to resell at profit

loans.name: Gladys Piedad

texts.es:
Gladys de 60 años, tiene una tienda de víveres de productos de primera necesidad. Vive en una zona periurbana en la perimetral de Guayaquil rodeada de un estero.

Cuando cumplió 50 años decidió tener su tienda en su casa para asegurar la vejez ya que es separada de su esposo. Tiene su tienda en la casa y trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta 21h00pm. Vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas, enlatados en su tienda de víveres. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, bebidas. 

En el futuro quiere agrandar mas su negocio y construir mejor su casa para asegurar su vejez y ayudarle a sus hijos con sus gastos.
texts.en:
Gladys, 60, has a grocery and basic need items store.  She lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil’s beltway that’s surrounded by a marsh.

When she turned 50 she decided to set up a store in her home to insure her old age because she’s separated from her husband.  She has her store in her house and she works from 8am until 9pm.  She sells rice, sugar, beverages and canned goods in her foodstuffs store.  She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and beverages.

In the future she’d like to enlarge the store and build her house better to insure her old age and help her children with their expenses.

loans.use: For rice and sugar.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur S. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son currently works and lives in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia, and the other three children all attend a local secondary school. His wife operates a construction decoration business which is seasonal.

Gantumur is a carpenter and produces a variety of wooden items out of his home according to his customer's specification. He started his business in 2005 and has since gained a lot of experience as a craftsman. In addition, he helps his wife's business during summer months to supplement his family income. Gantumur is a friendly and modest man and is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to purchase livestock at wholesale price.

loans.use: To purchase livestock at wholesale price.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 44 años, es una madre de familia amorosa y abnegada con sus hijos, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. La actividad a la que María se dedica, es el servicio domestico, es así que se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con los labores de su casa, para luego dirigirse a la casa de sus patrones en donde realiza el trabajo de limpieza, cocina, esta actividad empieza desde 10:00am hasta muy tarde. Gracias a este trabajo viene educando a su hijo, un joven muy inteligente y emprendedor que estudia.  Por ello María, no duda en escatimar todo su esfuerzo para ayudar a su hijo. Señala que le gusta lo que hace, ya lleva más de 6 años en esta labor y planea construir su casa con material noble, de esa manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas, para acceder a posteriores ayudas en el futuro. Con el crédito que solicita, es para  invertirlo en la educación de su hijo, ya que le falta un semestre para terminar.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and a loving and unselfish mother to her children.  She lives in her own house, in the company of her husband and their three children.  María is a domestic worker, so she gets up very early to do her own housework and then heads to her employers' house where she does the cleaning and cooking.  She starts her job at 10:00 a.m. and works until very late.  Thanks to this job, she has been able to educate her son, a very intelligent young man who is motivated in his studies.  María does not hesitate to put all of her efforts into helping her son. 

She indicates that she enjoys her work and has been doing it for six years.  She plans to build her house from sturdy materials in order to improve the quality of life for her and her son.

This is María's second loan through MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually so that she can access further assistance in the future.  She will use the requested loan to invest in her son's education, as he is one semester short of finishing.

loans.use: to invest in her son's education

loans.name: Columba

texts.en:
Columba S. lives in the town of Trinidad. She is 61 years old, married and makes a living by selling fish and other kinds of food, including rice and various local delicacies. The fish she sells is caught locally, and she works very hard to have a stable business and income. 

Columba joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenues made possible by this loan to continue expanding and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pescados y mariscos, la socia vende en el mercado el molino desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de mariscos y pescados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pescados y mariscos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the communal bank, El Molinito II. The bank is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco, Cusco department.

Graciela is a 41-year-old single mother of four. She divides her time between her daily activities and her work selling fish and shellfish at the El Molino market. She works from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm. This work allows her to provide for her children. Graciela would like to expand and improve her fish and shellfish business. She has requested the loan in order to buy fish and shellfish.

Graciela is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: She has requested the loan in order to purchase fish and shellfish.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
This is Modesto D., 43, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is a vendor who manages his household and business while helping out his family. As of the present time he is busy providing income for their everyday expenses.

Modesto sells fruits and vegetables. His main products are seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south, region of Luzon. Also in his product inventory are garlic and onions, tomatoes and other staples for simple recipes. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy additional fruits and vegetables to be incorporated into his current product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Modesto dreams of being able to see his business grow and mature. He also dreams of having his own children who will carry on his entrepreneurship spirit. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy additional fruits and vegetables to be incorporated into his current product inventory

loans.name: Wendy Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Wendy se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Anenecuilco, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por 4 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora María de Lourdes C. V. va a comprar con su préstamo garrafones de agua purificada para surtir su negocio, la señora Ma Magdalena F. M. va a comprar aretes y pulseras para surtir su negocio, la señora Ana María Méndez Hernández va a comprar sandalias, zapatillas, tenis, botas de caballero, huaraches para surtir su negocio, la señora Rosa F. Godínez va a comprar jitomate, cebolla, tomate, chiles, lechuga, frutas, para surtir su negocio, la señora  María de Lourdes C.  V. es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 42 años de edad estudio el 1er. año de primaria, ella vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos Miguel de 25 años de edad es casado y trabaja, Aurelia de 24 años de edad se fue a trabajar a los Estados Unidos y Martha Patricia de 23 años de edad se fue a trabajar a los Estados Unidos, ella tiene su negocio de molino de nixtamal venta de masa, garrafones de agua purificada y refrescos, la señora María de Lourdes solicito su préstamo para compra garrafones de agua purificada, maíz Y  refresco, su negocio se llama molino el rey, ella ofrece a sus clientes servicio de molina, venta de masa, garrafones de agua purificada y refrescos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar garrafones de agua purificada, maíz, y cajas de refrescos, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años como no había nadie quien vendiera porque era una colonia nueva ella comenzó a vender el agua purificada y refrescos y hace un año su marido le compro el molino para iniciar el negocio de venta de masa y moler nixtamal o chile para mole, su cuñado y su hijo le enseñaron a moler como ellos se dedican a trabajar en las tortillerías, arreglan las maquinas, su cuñado le consiguió el molino aunque sea pequeño, ella adquirió su negocio con lo que ahorraron un tiempo se fueron a trabajar a Cuernavaca y su esposo le dio la idea de vender, con el dinero que trabajaron compraron la mercancía, su negocio está en su casa y es muy importante porque va obteniendo dinerito para la comida, su esposo le ayuda en a surtir el negocia a traer las cosas, también muele y despacha, la parte favorita de
