su negocio es el molino moler y vender masa y está orgullosa de su molino muele bien, esta chiquito y bonito, sus cliente son sus vecinos que vive en su colonia, su negocio es popular por que esta chiquita la colonia y no hay otro molino por aquí, las ganancias de su negocio las va juntando para que si se descompone el molino de ahí tiene para las piezas, para pagar la luz, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio vender refrescos y los sábados y domingo vender pozole, tostadas, tacos dorados y poner una tiendita de abarrotes y lo piensa logar con el préstamo, con lo que le mande sus hijos y lo que le de su esposo, este negocio ha ayudado mucho a su familia para comer a veces le falla el trabajo a su esposo y de ahí agarra para las tortillas, huevo o algo imprevisto, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son aplanar su negocio y echarle piso, sus planes y esperanza son ver a sus nietos crecer y que tengan una mejor vida, que no sufran sus hijos y que estén bien de salud. La señora María de Lourdes está emocionada con este préstamo porque va a tener para invertir y también nerviosa porque a veces no tiene para pagar pero pimeramente Dios vamos a salir con el negocio y le vamos a echar ganas al trabajo, las mejorías que desea usted lograr par el futuro de sus hijos son dejarles algo, agrandar el negocio para que ellos lo sigan trabajando. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por confiar en nosotros y gracias porque vamos a tener para invertir en nuestros negocio y vamos a cumplirles y ojala y nos sigan ayudando”. Anenecuilco es pueblo tranquilo, pacifico se ven los cerros, aquí se encuentra la casa museo de Emiliano Zapata donde nació hay escritos, pertenencias que utilizaba y proyectan una película de la historia del general Emiliano Zapata su lema “La tierra es de quien la trabaja”
texts.en: This solidarity group is called "Wendy" and can be found in the community of Anenecuilco, Ayala, in Morelos state, Mexico. The group is made up of four women who know one another and are neighbors. They are: Ms. María de Lourdes C. V. - she will use her loan to buy jugs of purified water to stock her business; Ms. María Magdalena F. M. - she will buy earrings and bracelets to stock her business; Ms. Ana María Méndez Hernández - she will buy sandals, shoes, sneakers, and cowboy boots to stock her business; and Ms. Rosa F. Godínez - she will buy jitomates, onions, tomatoes, chilies, lettuce, and fruits to stock her business. Ms. María de Lourdes C. V. is 42 years old. She studied one year of primary school. She lives in a common-law marriage and has three sons: Miguel, 25, is married and works; Aurelia, 24, went to work in the United States; and Martha Patricia, 23, went to work in the United States. María has a business grinding nixtamal [dried corn] and selling dough, jugs of purified water, and soft drinks. She is requesting this loan to buy jugs of purified water, corn, and cases of soft drinks. Her business is called "Molina El Rey" ["The King's Mill"]. She offers her clients milling services and she sells jugs of purified water and soft drinks. She started her business 20 years ago because there wasn't anyone selling goods there, since it was a new settlement. She started by selling purified water and soft drinks, and a year ago, her husband bought the mill so they could start the business of selling dough and grinding nixtamal or chilies for mole [a traditional Mexican stew or soup]. Her brother-in-law and her son, who work in a tortilla factory fixing the machines, taught her how to use the mill. Her brother-in-law got the mill for her and although it is small, she was able to start her business with savings from a time when she had gone to Cuernavaca. It was her husband who gave her the idea to sell goods. They bought merchandise with money they had earned previously. The business is located in their house and it is important because it brings in money for food. María's husband helps her to stock her business and to bring things, as well as to grind and deliver the corn. Her favorite part of her business is milling and selling dough. She is proud that her mill grinds well, and it is small and pretty. Her customers are her neighbors. Her business is popular because their town is small and hers is the only mill. She keeps her earnings so that if the mill breaks she can buy parts, and she also uses them to pay for electricity. She is planning to expand her business by selling sodas, and on Saturdays and Sundays she will sell pozole, crispy tortillas, and tacos. She would also like to start a small grocery store and she thinks she will be able to achieve this with her loan. María's business, along with her husband's income and the money her children send, has helped her family to eat. Sometimes, when her husband is without work, he fetches the tortillas, eggs, or whatever else. María hopes to make the following improvements to her home: flatten the ground and install a floor. Her hopes and plans are to see her grandchildren grow up and for them to have a better life; and for her children to not suffer and to be in good health. María de Lourdes is excited about this loan because she will use it to invest. She is also nervous because sometimes she doesn't have enough money, but with God's help she is going to move forward with her business. The improvements she hopes to make in the future are as follows: to leave her children something, to expand her business, and for her children to keep working. The members of this group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you for having faith in us. Thank you because we will now invest in our businesses and we hope that you will continue supporting us." Anenecuilco is a calm, tranquil village with a view of the hills. It is home to the Emiliano Zapata Museum, since it is where he was born. It holds some of his writings and belongings that he used, and it shows a movie about the history of General Emiliano Zapata, whose motto was: “The land belongs to those who work it.”

loans.use: to buy jugs of purified water, corn, and cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. has operated a clothes-selling business for four years, and she works seven days a week. Fatuma sells her products from door to door. She also generates additional income by selling maize flour.

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothes to offer for sale. The main business challenges for Fatuma include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself.    

Fatuma and her husband own a home in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. They have five children, all of whom attend school. They also take care of some of their grandchildren. The family has access to electricity and to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es: José Mauricio A. de 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia en El Divisadero, departamento de Morazan, con su hijo que ya es mayor de edad y se dedica a crianza de ganado, su nuera, y su pequeño nieto. Durante toda su vida José ha trabajado para poder sacar adelante a su familia. A pesar que es un hombre ya bastante mayor no se cansa de luchar para poder ofrecer una mejor vida  a sus parientes. Don José se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra y Aluminio. Se traslada por diferentes zonas para poder comprar chatarra y luego la vende en el departamento de San Miguel. Él quiere aumentar su nivel de ventas y por ende sus ingresos, pero no cuenta con  los recursos necesarios para reinvertir en su negocio, es por esta razón que le solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito ya que de  esta manera, podría comprar mayor cantidad de chatarra para poder vender y aspirar a mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Mauricio A. is 50 years and lives in his own house with his son who is an adult.  They live in El Divisadero in the Department of Morazán.  He works raising cattle and cares for his daughter-in-law and his grandson.  Throughout his life, José has worked in order to get his family ahead.  Despite being an older man, he does not get tired of working to be able to offer his family members a better life.  José works buying and selling scrap metal and aluminum.  He travels to different areas to buy the scrap and then sells it in the Department of San Miguel.  He wants to increase his sales and income, but he does not have the necessary resources to reinvest in his business.  This is why he is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral, as it will allow him to buy a greater quantity of scrap and sell it to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and sell scrap metal

loans.name: Samandar

texts.ru: Samandar P. rodilsya v 1961 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Samandar v Absheron regione uje 7 let vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Samandar 8 let kak nachal rabotat taxistom. Ranshe on zanimalsya skotovodstvom i raznosil moloko kefiri v magazini na mashine. No potom on reshil stat taxistom tak kak na etoy rabote on uje mojet ludshe soderjat svoyu semyu. Samanda seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini. Tak kak yeqo mashina isportilas on ne mojet rabotat, yemu v skorom vremeni nujno pochinit yeyo chtobi vosstanovit rabotu.
texts.en: Samandar P. was born in 1961.  He is married and has three children.  Samander, his wife, and their children have been living in Absheron for seven years.  Samander has driven a taxi for eight years.  Before that, he worked as a herdsman and distributed milk and kefir to stores in his car.  Then he decided to become a taxi driver because he would be able to support his family better that way.  Samanda now needs 2300 AZN to buy parts to repair his car.  His car is broken down, and he cannot work.  He needs to repair his car quickly to return to work.

loans.use: kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya remonta mashini

loans.name: Nayua

texts.en: A. is 35 years old and married with six children. All of her children got to school. A. is currently in the charcoal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. In the future, A. hopes to buy a car with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vivi Group

texts.fr: VIVI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et qui vivent toutes dans la même localité à Davatin à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin). Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un troisième prêt. La présidente du groupe, Virginie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 07 Juillet 1968. Virginie est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Tonny et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à sa charge. Virginie s'est installée avec son mari et ses enfants ensemble à Davatin. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Virginie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Virginie vend des tissus, des sacs et des chaussures de façon ambulante et aussi par le système de distribution. Virginie mène cette activité depuis  huit ans et qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Virginie sollicite avec les autres membres de son groupe, un crédit.
texts.en: VIVI is a three-person group.  The members are friends and all live in the same area of Davatin in Cotonou (economic capital of Bénin).  In order to boost their businesses and to better meet customer demand, this group approached ALIDé to obtain a third loan.  Virginie, the president of the group (whose hand is raised in the photo), was born on July 7, 1968.  She is married to Tonny, a shopkeeper, and is the mother of three children.  All the children are in school and the couple is still financially responsible for two of them.  Virginie, her husband and children have settled in Davatin.  Together, the couple provides for the various household expenses.  Virginie attended school for only a very short time.  To provide for her needs, she sells fabric, bags and shoes door-to-door and also by the distribution system.  Virginie has operated this business for eight years and it provides income to help her provide for her needs.  Virginie is asking for a loan with the other members of her group so as to expand her business and to better respond to the every increasing demand of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy fabric, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria nació en la ciudad de Lares (Lares se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad del Cusco  del departamento del Cusco.). Ella tiene 54 años edad, vive en la ciudad de Calca, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.  
  
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la Señora Maria que se dedica a la venta de comestibles. Ella tiene un puesto de venta alquilado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad Calca. Ella trabaja desde las 5h30 hasta las 17h30 todos los días de la semana. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería así poder surtir y abastecer el puesto de venta. Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará arroz, azucar, fideos y tarros de leche. 
 
María es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Lares, two hours from the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. She is 54, lives in Calca and is married with three children. The city of Calca is known for its beautiful landscapes and its tourism, cattle and agriculture. 

We met Maria at one of her community bank meetings. She belongs to the bank 'Clorinda Matto de Turner' which is part of the Arariwa Association. Maria sells food from a rented stall in the Calca market. She works there from 5:30am to 5:30pm, seven days a week. She has been working in this field for ten years and due to the effort she puts into her work, it has been going very well for her. 

Maria has applied for a loan to purchase groceries to stock up her stall. She will use this loan of US$500 to increase her working capital and buy rice, sugar, pasta and tinned milk. 

Maria is a determined woman whose dream is to expand her business. She is very grateful to the Arariwa Association for providing women like herself with the opportunities to make their dreams reality.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, pasta and tinned milk

loans.name: Johnry

texts.en: Johnry is 23 years old and married.  They live in the Philippines. Johnry has a motorcycle, or habal-habal, that provides transportation services to commuters. He has had this business for two years. He is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Johnry is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Johnry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 30 years old and single. He is a farmer and tills his own land located in Banga, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice for 4 years. He earns about 4000 PHP per month from doing this farming. Joan also raises chickens to sell.

Joan has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase seeds, fertilizers and farm equipment. He hopes for his business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and farm equipment.

loans.name: Benediction Ii Group

texts.fr: BENEDICTION II est un groupement de quatorze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Françoise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Vincent. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Françoise et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Françoise a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Françoise est une couturière qui confectionne des tenues à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d’année. Parallèlement à cette activité, Françoise vend des produits vivriers (maïs, etc.). Françoise s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Françoise sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupement BENEDICTION II. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Benediction II is a 14-people group, whose members all reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Francoise (who is raising her hand in the picture) is 40 years old; she is married to a shopkeeper named Vincent. The couple has three children, who all go to school. In addition to their children, the couple supports another child. Francoise and her husband live together with their children and take care of them together. Francoise left school in middle school.
Francoise is a seamstress who has been sewing outfits from her home for about twenty years. She also sells produce (corn, etc.) She gets her supplies in Benin.
Looking for customer satisfaction, Francoise is requesting a first loan with the members of the Benediction II group. This loan will be used to better meet customers' expectations and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items and corn.

loans.name: Mario Oscar

texts.es: Mario Oscar  vive en casa alquilada junto a su esposa María y dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Mario es un hombre emprendedor y sobre todo trabajador. Se dedica a hacer publicidad móvil. Hace muchos años que empezó con este negocio y gracias a Dios los resultados han sido muy buenos. Él posee un carrito el cual usa para hacer su trabajo. Cuenta con muchos clientes fijos y lo prefieren por ser un hombre responsable, confiable y sobre todo por ofrecer calidad en su servicio. Quiere seguir manteniendo activo su negocio y seguir recibiendo los frutos D. mismo. Esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir especialmente en el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que por el uso necesita de nuevos repuestos para que pueda seguir funcionando y además porque quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de su trabajo. Y de esta forma  espera mejorar su calidad de vida con los resultados D. mismo.
texts.en:
Mario Oscar lives in a rented house with his wife María and two children who go to school.

Mario is an enterprising and above all hardworking man. He works in mobile publicity. He began this business many years ago, and thanks to God he has gotten very good results. He has a car that he uses to do his work. Mario has many steady customers, and they prefer him because he is a responsible, trustworthy man and above all because he offers high-quality service.

He wants to keep his business active and continue reaping the fruits of his work. This has led him to ask INTEGRAL for this loan to invest especially in maintenance on his vehicle, since due to use it needs new spare parts so it will keep working and also because he wants to offer better quality in his work. And in this way he hopes to improve his quality of life with the profit from his work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Hector Jose

texts.es:
Hector tiene 28 años de edad es casado y con tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, el trabaja diario como fontanero ya tiene varios años de trabajar de esa manera.
el visita las oficinas  de ceprodel para solicitar un prestamo para invertir en compra de mercaderia ya que su esposa tiene un puesto de venta de comida y estos son otros ingresos que ayudan a su hogar.
el esta agradecido con ceprodel ya que con este dinero el negocio de la familia saldra a delante.
texts.en:
Hector is 28 years old; he is married and has three school-aged children. Hector has worked as a plumber for many years. 

His wife owns a food stand, which also contributes to the family's income, and Hector is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to invest in ingredients. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for financing his family's business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Jhuven

texts.en:
Jhuven is 32 years old. He lives with his wife in his own home with his children. His home only has electricity. It is located in the Quirino province of Isabela. The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Jhuven's business is providing a public transport service, as he owns his own motorcycle. He works mornings and afternoons, transporting people who live in the small villages in the area. Sometimes he uses his motorcycle for delivering fish and vegetables. He has his own customer base and is able to cover his household expenses with the income that he makes.

Jhuven has requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos so he can do some maintenance work on his motorcycle and make some repairs to his home. Jhuven is very well known in his area because he is always looking out for his family's well-being with the goal of providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a tire and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Amigas De Espoir se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par “por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es médico. 

Nuestra amiga es una mujer que le gusta ser muy emprendedora y ganarse algo por su propia cuenta por lo cual se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local donde vende  repuestos y refacciones de motocicletas, allí las personas que tienen este tipo de vehículos pueden encontrar lo que necesitan para tener en buen estado sus motocicletas, ella lleva tres años en este negocio le ha ido muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar llantas y repuestos eléctricos para motocicletas. Lleva tres años  en el Banco y le gusta ya que con los créditos ella puede solventar ciertos gastos urgentes.
 
Sus sueños son seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Espoir” Communal Bank meets each 15 days in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known by the name of “Calceta the Unequaled” for the beauty of its women and because for its inhabitants, there is no city in the world more beautiful.

Martha lives here. She is 28 years old and maintains a common-law marriage from which 2 children have developed, aged 7 and 3. The older child studies in school. The husband is a doctor.

Martha is a woman who likes to be very enterprising and to earn something on her own account. For that reason, she is a merchant. She has a shop where she sells spares and replacement parts for motorcycles. Here people with these types of vehicles can find what they need to keep their motorcycles in good repair. Martha has been in this business for 3 years and it has gone well.

This new loan will be used to buy tires and electrical components for motorcycles. Martha has been a member of this bank for 3 years and she likes it, because with these loans she can take care of certain urgent costs.

Her dream is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy tires and electrical parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Ando Andrew

texts.es:
Ando, de 34 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de  Granada esta casado, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años respectivamente, el es dueño de un Gym, también trabaja como entrenador, también estudio un curso de contabilidad, pero actualmente trabaja en su gimnasio. El inicio este negocio con el apoyo de un amigo, que lo incentivo a crear su propio  ya que por su anterior trabajo en Managua permanecía fuera de su casa todo el día, y tenia que pagar a alguien para que le cuidara su negocio pero después el renuncio a su trabajo en Managua y se hizo cargo por completo de su gimnasio el cual se ha convertido en su medio de subsistencia. 
El solicito el préstamo para la compra de dos maquinas de hacer ejercicios, quiere unos bancos para pesas inclinadas y declinada. Con esta inversión podrá ofrecer  mejor infraestructura de maquinas para hacer ejercicios un poco mas modernas, atraer mas clientes. En sus planes futuros  le gustaría poner un kiosko donde pueda ofrecer batidos y bebidas.
texts.en: Ando, age 34 and from the city of Granada, is married and has two children, ages 7 and 3.  He's the owner of a gym and also works as a trainer.  He has taken an accounting course, but currently works in his gym.  He started this business with the support of a friend, who encouraged him to create his own, since in his previous job in Managua he stayed away from his home all day and had to pay someone to manage his business. Then later, he resigned from his job in Managua and took complete control of his business, which has become his means of subsistence.  He requested the loan to purchase two exercise machines - he wants some incline and decline benches.  With this investment, he will be able to provide better, more modern exercise equipment, attracting more customers.  In his future plans, he would like to put in a kiosk where he could offer smoothies and other beverages.

loans.use: to purchase two exercise machines - some incline and decline benches.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married with 5 children.  She is 54 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Wilma has been managing a piggery for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase pigs.
Wilma has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and hopes to expand her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Francisco Berti

texts.es:
Francisco de 65 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona es agrícola y  ganadera.

Francisco se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, actividad que viene realizando desde hace varios años, cuenta con su bicicleta donde reparte el pan que prepara a las diferentes tiendas de la zona donde vive y también ofrece algunos dulces a sus clientes,  tiene su propia clientela, últimamente su negocio a ido creciendo y han aumentado sus clientes, lo que le permite tener mayores ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su casa.  

Para seguir realizando sus actividades como hasta el momento a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y para la construcción de un horno artesanal, con la intensión de seguir elaborando pan, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y tener un poco más de comodidades para su hogar.  Francisco y su esposa han sabido salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, con la finalidad de alcanzar lo que se han propuesto para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, 65, lives with his family in his own house which has only electricity. It is located in the Paijan district which belongs to the La Libertad department. This is a farming and ranching region. 
Francisco makes his living by making and selling bread, which he has been doing for several years. He has a bicycle which he uses to distribute the bread he prepares to different stores in the area where he lives; he also offers some sweets to his customers. He has his own clientele. Lately his business has grown and the number of customers has increased, which permits him to have greater income to cover the daily necessities of his household. In order to continue his business as it has been going up until now, he believed it necessary to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase ingredients and to construct an artisanal stove. His intention is to continue making bread so that with the proceeds he will be able to repay the loan and have a few more comforts for his home. Francisco and his wife have known how to improve their lives through a great deal of effort and hard work, with the goal of achieving what they have proposed for their family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and to construct an artisanal stove to continue baking bread.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in the Paynesville area. She is married and her husband is a business man. For the past four years she has been selling chains and body spray in the local market. She make lots of profit that helps her to pay her house rent.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chains and body spray for her business. In the future she hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more chains and body spray for her business

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en: Thavy is married with six children. She is a 45 year-old farmer. Her children are still in school. She has been a farmer for 25 years. This is her third loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to plant rice paddy. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields to a good quality in order to sell at a better price, to have some savings and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and lives in Capatan, Tuguegarao City, with her spouse and three children. She has eight children but five of them have settled into marriage and live separately from them. She operates a small store to earn an income. She has been doing this for nearly 10 years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month.

She is asking for a loan to stock more grocery items in her store because nowadays she has many competitors in their village. She needs to improve her services rendered to her customers. She needs a loan amount of 13,000 PHP to buy bread, coffee, milk, sugar and eggs to sell in her store. 

In the future, Maria hopes to see her small store grow into a larger one. She wants to make consistent profits to provide for a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, coffee, milk, sugar and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La socia Miriam, continua con el negocio de reparacion de computadoras, venta de accesorios y repuestos para computadoras, tambien compran maquinas de segunda mano para repararlas y luego las venden ellos repotencian maquinas y hay clientes que compran de este tipo. La socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de accesorios, repuestos, y computadoras de seegunda mano para repotenciarlos y venderlos. La socia desea poder comprar en un futuro cercano maquinas, laptop, cpu nuevos y venderlos al por mayor a diversas empresas y seguir progresando.
texts.en: Miriam is continuing her business. She repairs computers; sells computer accessories and replacement parts; and also purchases computers second-hand to repair and sell. There are clients who purchase refurbished computers from her. She wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of accessories, replacement parts and second-computers to refurbish and resell. In the future, she wishes to continue progressing by purchasing computers, laptops, and new CPUs to sell to different businesses.

loans.use: to purchase accessories, replacement parts and second-hand computers to refurbish and sell.

loans.name: Bamtare Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 09/05/2011.IL est composé de 30 membres issus du même village.
Mme Hassatou,en position debout à l'extreme droite et levant la main, est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 44 ans, est mariée et s'occupe de 02 enfants.

Son activité est le petit commerce de condiments pour la cuisine (ail, poivre, oignon, sel etc) En plus de cela à ses heures perdues,elle fait du maraichage pour diversifier ses activités.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité,dufait qu'elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Son pret lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises (ail, poivre, oignon, sel etc)

Son objectif est  d'assurer la scolarité ,la nourriture et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on September 5, 2011.  It is made up of 30 members who live in the same village.
Mrs. Hassatou, standing to the extreme right with her hand raised, is the leader of the group.  She is 44 years old, married, and cares for two children.
She is involved in sales of condiments (garlic, pepper, onion, salt, etc).  In addition to this, in her free time, she sells products from her garden at the market in order to diversify her work. 
She has gained good experience in this line of work because she has been doing it for several years. 
Her loan will allow her to stock up on merchandise. 
Her goal is to assure education, food, and health care for her children.

loans.use: to buy garlic, pepper, onions, salt, and other condiments for resale

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 31-year-old married woman, mother of two children. She has been working as a hairdresser for eight years from her house. She is well known in the region, with her special prices and special customer care she provides.

Sahar is a hardworking woman. She took her house as her working place, just to stay with her children and take good care of her family at the same time.

Sahar is an Al Majmoua, Kiva partner, borrower for the second time. Her previous loan helped a lot in improving her family's living. This time Sahar is requesting a loan to expand her cosmetics and perfume selling sector and to do necessary maintenance to the working room she is using at home.

Sahar hopes to open a beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: To improve her business with special cosmetics & perfumes.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 43 years old and married with two children. She has been farming for the last 6 years, earning a monthly income of KES 6000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd in the amount of KES 5000. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides. With the anticipated profits, she will buy food for her children.

Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sochea is 34 years old and has four children. Sochea has been farming rice and selling Khmer noodle for 18 years. The current business earns her about 90,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Sochea has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely paid back her previous loan. Now she is leading her group to request a new loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda, is a married woman with five children; three adult and two dependents aged 20 and 18 years old. They live in a municipality of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines. For the past twenty years, this woman and her husband earn a living by running a farm where he grows rice plants. Aside from this, they also sell roasted pork known as “lechon”. It is very important for them that this business can last in time because it is the financial support for their family. With this, Veneranda is asking for a loan to buy pigs for their roasted pork business. She wants to improve their livelihood in the future so they could give good education to their children. She wants them to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is an enterprising, capable, and very hard-working woman. She lives in Monclova Coahuila and sells new clothes. She began her own business because her husband was unemployed. Her husband helped selling to friends and relatives. Their work allows their children go to school (2 are currently attending college and another one is working for a private company). It is very important to Alicia that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals. You can help Alicia provide for th education of her children. She needs $200.00 USD to buy merchandise in order to increase sales. During the Christmas season, she has almost already sold all of her products. She wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Support her!

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia es una mujer emprendedora, capaz y muy trabajadora; vive en Monclova Coahuila y trabaja en la venta de ropa nueva; ella inició su negocio porque su esposo no tenía trabajo, por esta razón Alicia decidió emprender su propio proyecto. Su esposo en ese tiempo le ayudaba a vender entre sus conocidos y familiares. Actualmente este trabajo les ha permitido ofrecer a sus hijos una educación ya que 2 de ellos se encuentran en estos momentos estudiando la universidad y el otro ya se encuentra trabajando para una empresa privada. Para Alicia es muy importante que sus hijos terminen su carrera y sean personas honestas y trabajadoras.

Tú puedes ayudar Alicia con la educación de sus hijos, ella requiere de $200 USD para comprar mercancía que le permitirá tener una mayor capacidad de ventas, debido a que estás próxima temporada navideña ya tiene vendido casi toda sus productos. Alicia busca la manera de seguir apoyando a sus hijos y solo desea trabajar para conseguirlo; ¡Apóyala!

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Catherine Njeri Mwangi intends to develop her land by purchasing organic manure and rent a plot for cultivation

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey H., 48 years old, is a mother of 4 children and a farmer. She sells crops and raises animals in her farm which brings some money to support her family. Her husband (pictured here, because Srey H. is unavailable) is a farmer and a traditional musician. He is a big help to the household with the US$10 he makes per day. One of their sons works at the construction, and a part of his salary helps in financing the family. The couple's other children are all students. Srey H. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase more animals to raise in her field. 
One day, she also hopes to own another piece of land for her inventory expansion.

loans.use: To purchse more seeds and animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For investment in automotive accessories

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon is a young man who is 32 years old. He lives with his wife and young who attends school. He began selling used clothing in the street. He was able to purchase the clothing from other vendors at a lower price, and then turn a small profit. He would also sell this clothing door-to-door, and as he did so, he realized that he could learn to tailor clothing himself. To perfect his skills, he traveled to the capitol. When he returned to his native city Pucallpa and with the help of his wife, he set up a modest shop where he began working doing what he enjoyed most. He was then able to partner with one of his aunts to open a clothing sales and tailoring stand in a commercial center located on a major avenue of the city. Thanks to his knowledge and experience tailoring clothes, his business has improved. Nevertheless, there are orders, which he falls behind on for lack of cloth and material. Because of this, Jhon is requesting a $200 loan, which he has agreed to repay in 6 months. He will use the money to purchase material and supplies to meet the demands of his business, so that he can reach his goal of having his own stand as soon as possible and meet the needs of his home.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhon es un joven de 32 años, vive con su esposa y un pequeño niño que está estudiando, él empezó vendiendo en la calle prendas que adquiría también de otros comerciantes a menor precio con el fin de tener una pequeña ganancia, también iba ofreciendo estas prendas caminando y tocando puertas, con el pasar del tiempo se dió cuenta que el podía aprender a confeccionar las ropas que vendía y para hacerlo tuvo que viajar a la capital a perfeccionar su idea. Cuando retornó a su ciudad natal Pucallpa puso un pequeño y modesto taller empezando a trabajar en lo que más le gusta con la ayuda de su esposa y lograron asociarse con una de sus tías para poner un stand de venta y confección de ropas en un centro comercial ubicado en una importante avenida de esta ciudad.Gracias a los conocimientos y experiencia en la confección de prendas de vestir, el negocio está mejorando sin embargo hay pedidos que son entregados con un leve retraso por falta de telas y materiales. Por esta razón se ve en la obligación de solicitar un préstamo de 200 dólares para ser devueltos en 6 meses con el fin de adquirir los materiales e insumos suficientes que demanda el negocio, resaltando que el objetivo de Jhon es tener en el más breve plazo un local propio para satisfacer efectivamente las necesidades de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of material and cloth for clothing manufacture

loans.name: Doris Margarita

texts.es:
Dora is a diligent mother who occupies herself by selling her products daily in the streets of Tarma. She sells door to door and offers products like detergents and Chinese medicines to other moms and women who keep house.

Although she is struggling with difficult circumstances due to her mother's poor health, she continues day to day with the sole purpose of covering their medical expenses and the general family expenses generated by her four sons. Nonetheless, she holds a small ray of light and hope in the fact that she and her husband work hard selling door to door each day in her city.

This loving mom wishes to increase her inventory in order to generate more business and income to cover her family's expenses. She would also like to save money in order to someday have a pretty house, which is currently just a dream of hers.

With your help she will be able to continue her responsibilities (as mother and daughter) and provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Dora, es una diligente madre de familia, que diariamente se ocupa de vertir sus productos en las calles de la ciudad de Tarma. Vende de manera ambulantemente, detergentes y medicamentos chinos para todas las reinas del hogar.

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias de salud por las que atraviesa su querida madre, sigue esforzándose con el objetivo de cubrir los gastos médicos y hospitalarios, y a esto se suma los gastos familiares que generan sus cuatro hijos varones.

Sin embargo ella tiene un rayito de luz y esperanza en el ingreso económico que le genera la venta de la mercadería que junto a su esposo oferta por las calles de su ciudad diariamente, además de los pedidos de sus vecinos.

Debido a que el momento por el que atraviesa su familia es muy preocupante, para esta amorosa madre; desea incrementar el número de sus artículos para obtener aún mayores ingresos y costear cada uno de los requerimientos de su querida familia. También desea ahorrar con el sueño de tener una hermosa casa que aún sólo mantiene en su mente.

Con vuestra importante colaboración , ella, podrá seguir cumpliendo con sus dos importantes papeles (hija y madre) para la plena satisfacción de las necesidades que le demanda su hogar.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase products for sale

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es:
Kelita belongs to the The Esmeraldas Communal Bank. She lives in the Human Settlement JJ. Munoz, the district Calleria, Ucayali department. She is 32 years of age, and is the mother of 2 children, who are still small and are dependent on her. Her husband is a car mechanic, but the income that he earns is not enough for the household expenses. So with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of S /. 300.00 ($ 100.00), Elizabeth decided to invest in the purchase of spare parts and accessories for cars..

She currently has a small post set up in her home and sells ladies', men's and children's clothing. Early in the mornings, she gets her children ready for school then goes out to sell clothing door to door. Then in the evenings, back at her home, she continues to sell clothing to customers who know good quality and good taste.

With this recent loan received from Manuela Ramos of S /. 1,200 ($ 402.00 approx.), which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy many items such as two dozen blouses, one dozen shirts and accessories for men, etc. Now that Christmas is approaching, she has many orders from her clients. Kelita is very happy to see that her business thrives because she feels this is a very important achievement for her. This has helped the welfare of her family and brought her economic stability which she had longed for, thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Kelita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano JJ. Muñoz, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos que aun son pequeños y depende mucho de ella. Su esposo es mecánico de motocarros, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Elizabeth, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00(US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la compra de repuestos y accesorios para motocarros. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, ubicado en su propia casa. Desde muy temprano alista a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela y luego sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, y en las tardes atiende en su casa a sus clientes que saben del buen gusto que tiene para las prendas de vestir. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.200 (US$ 402.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará medio ciento de polos, dos docenas de blusas, 1 docena de camisas para caballeros y accesorios de vestir ahora que se acerca las fiestas navideñas, ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos que le hicieron sus clientas. Kelita está muy contenta de ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, así alcanza el bienestar de su familia y la estabilidad económica que tanto anhelaba y ahora tiene gracias Subscribe a Manuela Ramos. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.200 (US$ 402.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará medio ciento de polos, dos docenas de blusas, 1 docena de camisas para caballeros y accesorios de vestir ahora que se acerca las fiestas navideñas, ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos que le hicieron sus clientas. Kelita está muy contenta de ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, así alcanza el bienestar de su familia y la estabilidad económica que tanto anhelaba y ahora tiene gracias a Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell in her business.  (Compra de prendas de vestir (ropa).)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị V., 48 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2002. She raises her children and takes care her parents by herself. Due to the hardship she has a worn look than women of same age. Her main income comes from basket weaving and a small animal husbandry business. She also tends a half acre rice paddy. The family’s economy seems better when she takes out loans from the Fund. She upgraded her straw roof hut to a tiled roof house recently. Her income is 80USD a month. She is taking out a loan of 325USD to recondition her cattle pen also to buy a calf with hope that she can sell later for a profit.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị V., 48 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2002. Hoàn cảnh gia đình chị rất khó khăn. Một mình chị nuôi con ăn học và bố mẹ già nên trông chị vất vả hơn so với những người cùng tuổi. Nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của chị V. từ đan thúng và chăn nuôi. Ngoài ra chị còn làm thêm 6 sào ruộng. Khi được vay vốn từ Quỹ Tình thương, chị đã biết tính toán làm ăn phát triển đồng vốn kinh tế gia đình có nhiều thay đổi. Từ ngôi nhà nhỏ chị sửa sang nâng cấp lên thành nhà ngói. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng hiện nay của chị V. là 80USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị quyết định vay 325USD để đầu tư sửa chữa chuồng trại và mua thêm con bê. Chị hi vọng sau vài tháng có thể bán được bê với giá cao hơn

loans.use: Repair cattle pen and buy a calf

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma T. lives in the village of Rogozen. She is married and has three kids. Her husband works in the capital city of Sofia. Vilma breeds a cow and now wants to buy another one.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en: Ilaha is a mother of 2 children. She lives in a small town called Khudat. She is a farmer who started farming 5 years ago. She is asking for $600 to help expand her farm so that she can be more profitable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Osbaldo

texts.es:
Osbaldo is the father of 2 children, 11 and 9, who are in school. He's long loved cars and motorcycles and he started a business buying and selling cars when he needed an income that would allow him to better support his family. He started it 7 years ago when he sold the family car for a good price and used the money to buy two cheaper cars that he later sold. He saw that this could be a good source of income with which he could provide for his family.

Osbaldo is now applying for a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to pay off a loan on a motorcycle that he bought. With your support, Osbaldo can continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Osbaldo es padre de 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años que son estudiantes. Inicio el negocio de compra-venta de autos dado su gusto por los automóviles y motocicletas, ya que requería tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera sacar adelante a su familia. Esto lo inicio hace 7 años cuando vendió el carro familiar a un buen precio y con este dinero compro otros dos de menor recio que después vendió y vio que de esto era una buena fuente de ingresos con la que podría cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para terminar de liquidar una motocicleta que adquirió. Con tu apoyo Osbaldo seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sam-Ath and her husband, Mr. San Touch were married in 1985 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. One son works with his father and other three children are in school. Their two daughters  also weave silk at home when they are free from their studies. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. C. Sam-Ath has been farming and raising cows for many years. She grows papayas, bananas, eggplant on the farm not so far from her house. Her husband runs boat service that runs goods such as vegetables from the island to Phnom Penh. Now his boat is broken and he needs money to repair it.

Mrs. C. Sam-Ath is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and to repair the boat.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to repair a boat.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn H. is a basket seller and farmer in Khnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Huor Hom, is a fisherman. They have eight children, two of whom are basket makers while three others transport soil to sell for income. The remaining three are enrolling in school. Although Mrs. Moeurn H.’s family members have different business activities, they are still in poor living conditions. So Mrs. Moeurn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy pigs for breeding in order to improve their conditions. Previously, Mrs. Moeurn H. obtained a loan to buy an "electric cow" to plow her rice, field as well as to hire it for a profit. Her husband is on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pigs for breeding

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en: Pelenatete L., 70, is married with 5 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the village and public people 5 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  This will be her first.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (approximately $83 USD).  SPBD loans are Pelenatete’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  This loan will be used for the business.  Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: Buy stocks for the shop

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoko A. was born in 1970 in Togo, a country that borders Benin. She's married to Mr. Jean SEMEK, a trained furniture maker. To help her husband with the family expenses, she sells staples and other products in a shop located near her home, so that her neighbors do not need to travel long distances to get these products. The daily revenue of her business amounts to $30 (12'000 XOF). To better meet customer demand, she wants to bolster her business, and to do so, she's seeking her second loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame A. Akoko est née vers 1970 au Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin. Elle est mariée à Monsieur SEME K Jean, menuisier de profession. Pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales, elle vend dans une boutique située non loin de son domicile, des produits vivriers et des produits de grande consommation avec un objectif de proximité pour ses voisins qui n'auront plus à faire de longue distance pour s'approvisionner. Pour donner entière satisfaction à sa clientèle qui lui permet de réaliser en moyenne un chiffre d'affaire journalier de 12000F CFA, elle désir renforcer son activité et vient solliciter pour la cause son deuxième crédit.

loans.use: To buy one sack of corn, 3 boxes of soap and 3 cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Khhuth

texts.en:
This is the second time that Mrs. Khhuth S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer in Trapaing Phnov Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she sells Kor fruit, which is used to make pillows in Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Prang Phalla, is employed by World Vision Organization.

Although Mrs. Khhuth S. and her husband both have an income, they sill cannot afford to build a new house so Mrs. Khhuth S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Khhuth S. is 41 years old and the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local school. Previously, Mrs. Khhuth S. borrowed $75 from AMK and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to build a new house for the household.

loans.name: Morayo

texts.en: Morayo sells tailoring materials in wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Morayo also has two deep freezers for selling drinks and water in wholesale and retail. Morayo is a LAPO client. She is 53 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Lagos with her family. She needs a loan of  850 USD to buy more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Katerin

texts.es: Katerin tiene 20 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, es soltera y vive en casa de unos familiares. Desde que termino la secundaria y no teniendo posibilidades para seguir estudios superiores, decidió dedicarse al comercio, es así que desde hace 4 años puso una librería, donde ofrece, cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc. El negocio va bien, justamente por la dedicación que le pone Katerin, abriendo desde las 8 de la mañana y quedándose hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, para poder alcanzar las ganancias deseadas. Lo más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer todo el día atendiendo su negocio, ya que tiene que dejar de lado otro tipo de actividades, pero pasando este pequeño inconveniente, a ella le agrada su trabajo porque es tranquilo y le permite ganar lo suficiente para su manutención. Katerin quiere ser una mujer independiente que no necesite de nadie para ser feliz y logrará todos sus objetivos. Con el dinero del préstamo implementará mejor su librería, y así abarcar la preferencia de los clientes, para en un futuro hacer que su librería sea las más grande y la que satisfaga las necesidades de todos.
texts.en:
Katerin is 20 years old. She is a native of the city of Juliaca. She is single and lives in the house of some relatives. Since she finished high school and did not have opportunities to continue with higher education, she decided to work. Therefore, four years ago she set up a book store, where she offers folders, pens, books, etc. The business is going well, precisely because of the dedication Katerin gives it, opening from 8 in the morning and staying until 9 or 10 in the evening to be able to earn the income she wants. The hardest part for her is to have to spend all day tending to her business, since she has to put off other activities. But in spite of this small inconvenience, she likes her work because it is laid-back and allows her to earn enough for her basic needs. Katerin wants to be an independent woman who does not need anyone to be happy and achieve all of her goals. With the money from the loan, she will stock her book store, and therefore meet the preferences of the clients, so that in the future she can make her store the biggest and satisfy the needs of everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her bookstore to meet the needs of her clients

loans.name: Ciria

texts.es: Ciria tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive acompañada de sus hijos, que ya son adultos y una nieta. Desde hace mucho tiempo se ha dedicado al venta de diversos productos, hace 12 años atrás ella tenia un kiosco y ahí vendía golosinas, café y pan, después se dedicó a la vender ropa usada en la calle en lo cual le fue muy bien, por ello hasta ahora realiza esa actividad, pero ahora también tiene una pequeña bodega en su propia casa desde hace 2 años, en lo que también le va muy bien, y le es muy rentable. Ahora tiene en mente incrementar más su bodega, para que cuando esté anciana se dedique solo a ella. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, viene pagando puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado incrementará la mercadería de su bodega, sobre todo en la línea de dulces.
texts.en:
Ciria is 55-years old and is a single mom who lives with her children. Her grand-daughter and adult children all live with her. For some time now she had dedicated herself to selling various products. Twelve years ago, she owned a kiosk and sold candy, coffee and bread and then decided to sell used clothes as a street vendor and it is going well. She currently performs this activity, but for the last 2-years she also runs a small shop out of her house and that too is going well and is very profitable. Now, Ciria has it in mind to expand the shop so that when she is old she will be solely dedicated to it. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she will pay her dues timely. With these funds she will increase her stock of merchandise for all types of candy.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Manija

texts.en:
S. Manija is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of three adorable children. Manija has a grocery store that she attends to herself, in additon to caring for her family and her home. She began her small business five years ago with financial support from her husband, who is a mechanic. She started her business to increase her large family’s income, and the business has been gradually growing ever since. 

In order to expand her business, she requests a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD). Manija is planning to spend the loan to buy more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of her goods. She promises to repay her loan within 8 months and thanks everybody who has decided to support her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Phom's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers contains five members. Mrs. Y., 24, has been selected to be group leader by the members. She has four children who are studying at the primary school. She earns a living selling fruit and vegetables in the Rolous Market, and she can make around $2 per day. She is married to Seoun, 51, who works as a rice farmer. The dry season is coming and Mr. Seoun needs to cultivate the rice crop that he relies on, using the cultivating machine for plowing the land, but unfortunately the machine has broken. Therefore, he talked with his wife and they have decided to ask for a loan to repair their broken machine and to buy fertilizers. 

The other four members of the group are S., P., S. and S.. S. is a grocery seller who is widowed. She needs a loan to purchase grocery inventory to sell. P. sells Khmer noodles and she requests a loan to enlarge her business. S. is a widowed farmer and she is applying a loan to buy fertilizer. S. sells desserts from home and she seeks a loan to supply her business. The borrowers all live in the Meanchey Commune of Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To repair their broken machine

loans.name: Diarga's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe  réunu de jeunes filles et garçons agés entre 20 et 30ans .ils habitent la ville de mbour.chaque semaine les membre du groupe de réunu pour discuter entre eux des questions de jeunesse mais aussi pour  mettre en place des projets.Actuellement ils ont unprojet d 'acheter du materiel de sonnorisation qu'ils vont loyer c'est pourquoi il sollicite un pret
texts.en:
This is a united group of young girls and boys, ages 20 to 30. They live in the city of Mbour. Each week, the group members gather to discuss among themselves youth-related questions but also to put projects into place. Currently, they have a project to buy sound equipment that they are going to rent out. This is why they are requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlen Argelia

texts.es: la joven Marlen R. tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para hacer los trabajos de la casa y luego abre su negocio a las 6am para atender a sus clientes, ella vive con la mama y tiene un niño de dos años, a ella le ha tocado criar sola a su hijo ya que su esposo tuvo que emigrar a los Estados Unidos para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, pero como que no ha sido posible que el les ayude. ella trabaja hace mas de 4 años en su pulperia. los sabados y domingos estudia en la Universidad, ella esta estuando una licenciatura en pedagogia. ella vive a 10 kilimetros de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Young Marlen R. has a small grocery store in her home. She gets up at 5:00 am to do housework and later opens her business at 6:00 am to attend to her customers. She lives with her mom and has a 2 year old son. She has the responsibility of raising her son alone since her husband had to emigrate to the United States to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life. But as it has not been possible for him to help them, she has worked for more than 4 years in her grocery store. On Saturdays and Sundays she studies at the University. She is studying for a teaching degree. She lives 10 kilometers from the city.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, coffee, churros, eggs, lard, bleach, soap, sauces, bread, soft drinks, cookies, milk

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Like most women who have their own small business, Irma R. works hard and takes her business very seriously. However, unlike most small business owners, Irma lives at Santa Teresa Women's Prison.

Since being incarcerated over 5 years ago, Irma has been participating in a pilot program that FAPE is running in the women’s prison. Irma attends all of the training sessions that FAPE delivers and has already completely paid off her first loan. She is also extremely proud to say that she has begun saving a small amount of money, something she never thought she could do.

Although this loan is small, Irma will use the money to purchase materials for her crafts. By buying in bulk she can save money and increase her profits. Irma is a very cheerful and enthusiastic person. However she admits that sometimes it can be a struggle to keep morale high. She dreams of the day when she will be released and have her freedom and the opportunity to expand her business in the outsiD. world.

********************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow. 
********************************************

Irma a pesar D. estar privada D. su libertad, continúa trabajando en su pequeño negocio D. elaboración y venta D. manualidades en la Cárcel D. Mujeres D. Guatemala, llamada “Santa Teresa”. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, que participa en todas las actividades D. capacitación que FAPE brinda a las mujeres D. la cárcel. Si préstamo aunque es muy pequeño, lo utilizara en la compra D. materiales, los cuales D. esta forma pueD. obtener a mejor precio y tener más ganancias en la venta D. los mismos. Irma sigue luchando por mantener su ánimo muy en alto, soñando el día que pueda salir D. la cárcel y tener su libertad, y allí seguir adelante por hacer más granD. su negocio.

loans.use: To buy materials in bulk for her crafts

loans.name: Greta Doris

texts.es:
La señora Greta pertenece al Banco Comunal “INDOAMERICA” vive en el jr Fizcarral nº 246, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 58 años de edad.

Desde hace varios años se dedica al alquiler de cuartos.  Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró golosinas para vender en su casa, y así generarse otros ingresos.

Hoy en día continúa con el negocio de la venta de golosinas y el negocio del alquiler de cuartos ha mejorado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales para mejorar los ambientes de sus cuartos.

“Me encuentro un poco mal de salud pero emocionalmente me siento fortalecida para vencer todas las dificultades y seguir adelante en bien de toda mi familia....... esto gracias a Manuela Ramos”.
texts.en:
Greta belongs to the INDOAMERICA Communal Bank. She is 58 years old and lives in Pucallpa.

She has rented out rooms for several years. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased sweets to sell from her home to generate additional income. Nowadays she continues to sell sweets and her room rental business has improved.

She will invest this loan of 3000 nuevos soles in the purchase of materials that will improve the ambiance in her rooms.

“I’m a little unwell but I feel emotionally strong to overcome difficulties and move forward for the good of my family…all thanks to Manuela Ramos.”

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for housing maintenance

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila S. is 54 years old. She has four children, three of them are married already and the other one is solely dependent on her. Her husband is a cassava farmer.

Leonila is known in their place as a reflexologist or locally known as a masahista. She provides body massage and all related services. This provides Leonila with another source of income. She's been with this kind of work for several years already, but she needed to look for another, more permanent way to gain money.

Leonila, joined the loan assistance program offered by HSPFI and decided to have a mini grocery store. The money will be used by her to buy items for her store. Leonila is looking forward for such a good opportunity. She is hoping for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: To purchase addtional items for her variety store

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 20-year-old man living in Saida El Kadimeh in southern Lebanon. He has been manufacturing pastry for the past two years. Today, Hani is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase his purchases.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Esperanza Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza Maruja V. Z. tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella  estudió Secundaria Incompleta,  tiene 1  hijo que dependen económicamente de ella.
Esperanza se dedica a brindar el servicio de Salón de Belleza, cuando inicio con Manuela Ramos no tenía el salón de belleza, se dedicaba a la venta de leña  y de la ganancia de la leña se dedico a estudiar cosmetología  e implementar su pequeño salón de belleza que ahora atiende en su domicilio.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Mujeres al Progreso, lo invirtió en la compra de leña y briquetas.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina de afeitar y un sillón para el salón de belleza.
Esperanza tiene como sueño continuar con su Salón de Belleza, estudiar y así perfeccionar para  crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Esperanza offers beauty salon services. When she started with Manuela Ramos, she did not have the beauty salon. She sold wood. With her earnings from selling wood she studied cosmetology and set up her small beauty salon, which is in her home. She used her first loan of 300 PEN from Banco Mujeres al Progreso to buy wood and briquettes. With the loan for 800 PEN she will buy an electric razor and a chair for her beauty salon. Esperanza’s dream is to continue with her beauty salon, study, and improve so that she can grow as an entrepeneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an electric razor and a chair for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells smoked fish. She started her fish sales two years ago in the community market where she lives. Mary buys her stock of fish from the fishmongers in Yeji, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty, good quality fish. Because of the quality, many customers buy from her stand. She has a strong customer base with customers traveling from the surrounding communities to buy her fish.

Mary is 54 years old. She is a married mother with eight children. Currently, two of her children are in school. She has requested a loan to increase her inventory of fish. She dreams of providing her children with a quality education. She feels this is possible through the proceeds of her business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked and dried fish

loans.name: María Celena Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Mirian M. quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La señora Gullermina A. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra ingredientes para la elaboración de comestibles, logrando así ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. 

La señora Myrian M. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comestible, logrando obtener mayor variedad que ofrecer a su clientela. 

La señora Exaltacion M. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esa mercaderías y así ofrecer mayor calidad, variedad a sus clientes. 

La señora Rocio C. se dedica a la venta de carbón, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esa mercadería, logrando ofrecer mayor  calidad de esa mercadería a sus clientes. 

La señora Cerafina A. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de  comestible, logrando ofrecer variedad y calidad de minutas a sus clientes. 

La señora Luci M. se dedica a la venta de prendas en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra de  esas mercedarias al por mayor ofreciendo buena calidad y variedad de prendas a su
 clientela. 


La señora Soledad G. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de esa mercaderías al por mayor ofreciendo calidad, variedad de frutas, verduras y buen precios a sus clientes. 


La señora Zunilda M. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías variadas ( panificados, lácteos, maíz, harina, azúcar, bebidas), logrando ofrecer calidad y variedad de mercaderías a su clientela. 


La señora Ángela A. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comestibles, logrando ofrecer mayor variedad munitas a sus clientes y  aumentar su ingreso. 


La señora Margarita Encina  se dedica a la venta de bijuoterie,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de artículos de bijuoterie (goma para cabello pinza de ceja, cabello, medias, hebillas, etc.) logrando de ese modo ofrecer una buena variedad de mercaderías a sus clientes. 


La señora Cristina C. posee una peluquería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, logrando de eso modo ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. 


La señora Angelina G. posee un copetín, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías en general (bebidas, lácteos, panificados, etc.) logrando ofrecer buena variedad de  productos y un buen servicio para sus clientes. 


La señora Sonia Domínguez se dedica en la venta C.D, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, ofreciendo  calidad y variedad de C.D a su clientela. 


La señora María Santacruz se dedica a la venta de lencería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas prendas en general, logrando ofrecer una buena variedad de prendas a sus clientes. 


La señora María A.  se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general, invirtió el  dinero en la compra de bebidas en general logrando obtener mayor variedad de bebidas que ofrecer a su clientela. 

La señora Vilma Cáceres se dedica a la costura, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, logrando ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. 

La señora Cristina López se dedica a la venta de carbón, invirtió el dinero compra de esas mercaderías, de ese modo lograr abastecer el pedido de sus clientes. 

La señora María M. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comestibles, logrando de esa manera mayor variedad de minutas que ofrecer a su clientela. 

La señora Sandra I. es cocinera, invirtió el dinero en la compra  de elementos de trabajo logrando eficiencia y calidad en su trabajo. 

La señora María Teresa A. se dedica a la venta de dulces de maní, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías logrando así ofrecer una buena variedad de dulces a su clientela. 

La señora Juana González se dedica a la venta de carbón, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, ofreciendo de esa manera un buen servicio a sus clientes. 

La señora Marlene T. se dedica a la costura, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, logrando de ese modo eficiencia y buen servicio a su clientela. 

La señora Patricia Vera se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, invirtió el dinero en la compra esas mercaderías, logrando de esa manera tener buena variedad de frutas y verduras que ofrecer a sus clientes. 

La señora Justa Benítez se decía a la venta de carbón, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esa mercadería, logrando ofrecer calidad    en esas mercaderías a su clientela.
texts.en:
The contact person for starting up this Committee was Señora Mirian M. who invited and organized her friends to participate in this program, Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (The Committee of Enterprising Women). Señora Gullermina A. sells food and will invest the money in the purchase of ingredients for food preparation so she will be able to provide greater variety to her customers. Señora Myrian M. also sells food and will invest the money in the purchase of ingredients for food preparation so she too will be able to provide greater variety to her customers. Señora Exaltación M. sells fruits and vegetables and will use her funds to buy this merchandise and thus be able to offer better quality and variety to her customers. Señora Rocio C. sells charcoal and will use her funds to buy this merchandise and thus be able to offer better quality and variety to her customers. Señora Cerafina A. sells food and will use the money to buy ingredients for food preparation so she will be able to offer a variety and quality of meals to her customers. Señora Luci M. sells clothing and will use her funds to buy this merchandise wholesale so she can offer a good quality and variety of clothing to her customers.
