Señora Soledad G. sells fruits and vegetables and will use the money to buy this merchandise wholesale so she can provide quality and a variety of fruits and vegetables at good prices to her customers. Señora Zunilda M. has a grocery store. She will use the funds to buy various merchandise (baked goods, milk products, corn meal, flour, sugar, beverages) so she can offer quality and a variety of merchandise to her customers. Señora Ángela A. sells food and will use the money to buy ingredients for food preparation so she will be able to provide greater variety of meals to her customers and increase her income. Señora Margarita Encina sells costume jewelry and will use the money to buy various items of jewelry (hair ties, eyebrow tweezers, bracelets, buckles) and in this way will be able to offer a good variety of merchandise to her customers. Señora Cristina C. has a hair salon and will use the money to buy items for her work so she can provide better service to her customers. Señora Angelina G. has a snack shop and will use the money to buy this kind of merchandise (beverages, milk products, baked goods) so she can provide a good variety of products and good service to her customers. Señora Sonia Domínguez sells CD's and will use the money to buy her merchandise at wholesale so she can provide quality and a variety of CD's to her customers. Señora María Santacruz sells lingerie and will use the money to buy this type of clothing so she can offer a good variety of garments to her customer. Señora María A. sells beverage and will use the money to buy more inventory so she can obtain a better variety of products to offer her customers. Señora Vilma Cáceres works as a seamstress and will use the money to buy items for her work so she can provide better service to her customers. Señora Cristina López sells charcoal and will use the money to buy this merchandise so she will be able to meet the demands of her customers. Señora María M. sells food and will use the money to buy ingredients for food preparation so she will have a better variety of meals to offer her clientele. Señora Sandra I. is a cook and will use the money to buy items so she can have more efficiency and quality in her work. Señora María Teresa A. sells peanut candy and will use the money to provide a good variety of sweets for her customers. Señora Juana González sells charcoal and will use the money to buy items for her work so she can provide good service to her customers. Señora Marlene T. is a seamstress and will use the money to buy items for her work so she can be efficient and provide good service to her customers. Señora Patricia Vera sells fruits and vegetables and will use the money to buy this merchandise so she can have a good variety of produce to offer her customers. Señora Justa Benítez sells charcoal and will use the money for inventory so she can provide quality merchandise to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, ingredients for preparing food, such as eggs, baked goods, vegetables, etc.  Merchandise for sale, such as fruits, vegetables, milk products, canned goods, yerba mate, oil, sugar, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika R. tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda por un crédito del gobierno. Pero solamente tiene construidos una recamara y son seis de familia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito para la construcción de un cuarto más a la casa y así  sus cuatro hijos tengan su propio espacio en la vivienda.
Doña Erika trabaja en limpieza de casa en diferentes partes, y su esposo el señor Julio Romero es empleado de una linia de trasportes en el departamento de mecánico eléctrico, estos son los ingresos que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte los destinaran para el pago de préstamo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Erika R. acquired her home a short time ago through a government loan. The house has only one bedroom for her family of six. She is requesting this loan to add another bedroom to the house so that her four children have their own space in it.

Mrs. Erika works cleaning houses and her husband Mr. Julio Romero works for a transportation company in the department of electrical mechanic. The income from their jobs covers their family’s expenses and part of it will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an additional bedroom in their house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth started selling fish four years ago. She takes delivery of fish from Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. With her very tasty and good quality fish, many customers buy from her stand. She is now fifty years old and is married with five children. Four of her children are currently in school in the community where they live. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of assorted fish to increase sales and income to support her children’s education and grow her business. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Eva Paulina

texts.es: La Señora Eva Paulina es originaria de la comunidad de Juchanep ella es casada de 20 años de edad hace cinco años inicio su propio negocio en la venta de ropa su lugar de venta en las calles del Municipio de Totonicapan  lugar que le autorizaron por el señor alcalde municipal, con los ingresos obtenidos ha mejorado su nivel de vida pero se requiere de un capital suficiente para poder competir ella necesita de un credito para surtir su mercaderia ya que se aproxima la fiesta del municipio de Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eva Paulina is from the community of Juchanep. She is 20 years old and married. Five years ago she started her own business selling clothes as a street vendor in Totonicapan as she was authorized by the municipal mayor. With her earnings she has been able to improve her standard of living but she needs enough capital to be able to compete. She needs a loan to stock her merchandize as the municipal holiday approaches the municipality of Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital.

loans.name: Mout's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Chong Kneas Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. Mout S., age 67, makes a living selling fresh fish in the market. She retails her fish that she buys in bulk on credit from her wholesale supplier or fishermen. She also return her income when she fish selling. Mout S. is a widowed woman and the good mother of two children; one of whom is married and has ready started new home, while other one drives a fish boat. Mout S. is taking out her loan to accumulate the quantity of fresh fish to sell to raise income. The other three borrowers who have jointly taking this loan as following:
C. will be used her loan to enlarge her selling fish business.
T. is looking for a loan to finish building her new house.
S., a fisherman, who is asking for a loan to buy more nets and traps.(S. was not available for a photo, so his wife is shown instead).

loans.use: To accumulate the quantity of fresh fish to sell to raise income

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells cereals to her customers in the Karinde shopping center. She has been in the business for the past nine years with a monthly profit of about 30000 Kenyan shillings. She wants to use the loan to buy more cereals to meet the demand of her customers and to increase her profits.  

She has never borrowed from another MFI before and was among the founders of her group in KADET.  She hopes to operate a large-scale grocery and cereals shop one day so as to have enough supplies for the area.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Restock her cereals shop (e.g. maize)

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda T. is from the village of Biray Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Rosenda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosenda harvests vegetables for sale in the local community. Rosenda has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plowing and buying fertilizer

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier d’Ahligo à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. C’est pour aider son mari dans la gestion du foyer qu’elle s’est lancée l’année dernière dans ce commerce. Elle vend du riz en gros et en détail, de l’huile d’arachide, des tomates en boîte, des sardines et bien d’autres produits. C’est pour élargir son commerce qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un nouveau congélateur pour se lancer dans la vente des produits frais comme la viande de poulet et de bœuf, 10 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz et divers produits indispensables.
texts.en:
This is a lady who became specialized in selling grocery items in her district of Ahligo in Lomé. She is married and the mother of three children.  To help her husband with managing the home, she embarked on this business last year.  She sells rice wholesale and retail, peanut oil, canned tomatoes, sardines, and many other goods.  To expand her commerce, she's requesting  a loan from WAGES to buy a new freezer to get started selling fresh items, such as chicken and beef, plus ten containers of oil, five sacks of rice, and a variety of indispensable items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A freezer, sacks of rice, and drums of oil

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L. is from the village of Walkway, Bonbon, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old, single, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling souvenir items, such as t-shirts, blouses, and other items, in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Evangeline joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Natividad es casada, tiene 54 años y 2 hijos, Natividad se dedica a la elaboración de panes, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Natividad necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Natividad es tener un horno propio y tener un Internet.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the Obreras communal bank. She is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is a baker. She bakes in a leased oven and sells her product in various regional markets. Natividad needs an 800 sol loan to purchase flour. Natividad's dream is to have her own oven and an Intenet access service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanry T. is a villager in Angk village in the Kandal province. She is 24 years old. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land for cultivating rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Pouv Ngoun, is a fisherman who can earn a little income to support his family. This family does not have enough money to support their rice field. Moreover, their rice field has infertile soil and it is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Chanry T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to pump water to support the field. 

She is the mother of a child who is too young to go to school or work. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel to pump water to support the field

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier tiene 41 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte para materiales de construcción. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, el es un hombre muy honrado vive muy feliz con su medio de vida. El financiamiento lo destinara para la compra de llantas usadas, diesel, lubricantes y baterías usadas porque no tiene el capital suficiente para  seguir adelante es por eso que necesita este financiamiento. El sueño de Francisco es obtener otro automóvil para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier is 41-years-old and he makes a living transporting building materials. He has had this business for over six years and is a very honorable man who is very happy with his livelihood. Francisco will use the loan to buy used tires, diesel fuel, lubricants, and used batteries. He needs the loan because he does not have the working capital to be able to continue on. Francisco dreams of having another automobile so that he can increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel, and batteries

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola sells groceries like laundry soap, bathing soap, toothbrushes and beverages. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She loves her business because of the opportunity to meet one-on-one with her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is a hard-working woman. She opens her stall daily to sell her goods. She is 31 years old and married with 2 children. Her children are making progress in school. Her husband is a teacher and he also supports their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en: Juliah is a 43 year old married lady with four children who attend school. She farms together with her husband. She has been involved in dairy farming and selling milk for eighteen years. She also earns a living from her rental houses. She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to improve her farming.  She has requested a loan of Kes.50,000 to boost her farming by buying dairy cattle. She hopes to improve her living standards in the future, and sees herself owning more plots and rental houses in ten years' time.

loans.use: To boost her business by buying dairy cattle.

loans.name: C2904 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Josiane is 35 years old and is married with two children who are 2 and 4 years old. She is the president of a group called Abisunganye which is commonly known in the business of selling clothes, mainly children’s clothes. The group has been in this business for about five years and the hours of their business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Josiane and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business through adding a variety of styles such as jeans and women’s clothes. They also plan to start selling children’s shoes as they seem to be highly in demand by a number of their customers in this area.

With this business expansion, this team will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow each member of the group to build a secure future for his/her children and maintain the sustainability of their business.

loans.use: To add a variety of styles such as jeans, women's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Nilda Mercedes

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 19 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo en el sector 9 de Octubre, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Piura, capital de la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de ropa y sandalias en su propio domicilio, también reparte su mercadería en base a pedidos que realizan sus vecinos y personas de diferentes zonas aledañas. El negocio le permite agenciarse de una fuente importante de ingresos económicos con los cuales ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia.

Nilda tiene muchos pedidos que cumplir, gracias a la promoción que le hacen sus propios clientes, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más prendas de vestir y sandalias para seguirlas ofreciendo a sus clientes.

Ella es una joven trabajadora y que siempre trata de salir adelante a través del trabajo en su negocio. Su más grande anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria, ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus clientes y conocidos que la consideran una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Nilda is 19 years old and lives with her husband in the "9 de Octubre" neighborhood, an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Piura, the capital of the region of the same name, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For 2 years she has been selling clothing and sandals from her home. In addition, she distributes her merchandise based on orders that she takes from her neighbors and from people who live in surrounding areas. The business allows her to procure an important source of income to help support her family. Nilda has many orders to fill, thanks to a sales promotion that she carried out with her customers. For this reason she is requesting for the first time a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of more garments and sandals to offer her customers. She is a hardworking youth who always tries to get ahead through her work in her business. Her greatest wish is to be able to grow as a businesswoman. She is very well known and appreciated by her customers and acquaintances, who consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy garments and sandals to expand her business

loans.name: Dinusha

texts.en:
Dinusha is a 29-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka with her husband and one daughter. Dinusha is an active lady. Her husband is a driver for the Ceylon Transport Board. 

Dinusha has an agricultural cultivation, producing local leaves that are sold for daily consumption and often eaten with rice and curry in Sri Lanka. She has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC which she will use to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for the cultivation. In addition to Dinusha and her family members working on the cultivation, they employ several other locals to help in running the business, which has now been in operation for 4 years. Eventually she hopes to expand her cultivation with high yards, and she hopes to continue to see success. Dinusha is known as a hard worker in her community and is hoping to develop her business further with this loan.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals for leaves and plants

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma J., 53 years old, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. She says that her 1.5 hectares of rice field can produce 130 sacks of rice. Norma has been engaged in farming for over 30 years now and she hopes for her business to grow.

In 2008, Norma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Norma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold R. is from Barangay Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. He is 33 years old. Harold is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Harold raises pigs for breeding. Harold has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Harold joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Harold is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Harold from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old and  married.  Josephine lives by selling a variety of goods in her shop.  These goods include cooking oil, foodstuffs like rice, beans, peas, and Irish potatoes. This is her fourth successful year in this business.  Josephine opens her shop from 7 am until 8 pm every day.

Josephine, after realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully and that the foodstuffs are highly demanded by a large number of people, is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Josephine will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodtuffs including rice, beans, peas, Irish potatoes, etc

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Даминова Мунира проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж работает в строительной компании. Сама Мунира имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает муку. В этой области более 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Munira D. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband works at a construction company. Munira has a secondary education and is involved in retail sales at a market. She primarily sells flour. She has been in this business for over 6 years. Munira is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La Señora Antonia vive en la casa de su hermana donde tiene su tiendita de barrio ella comenzó con este negocio porque su hermana la empujo a que realice alguna actividad  ya que la señora no tenia ingresos ya viendo eso su hermana le presto para que comenzara y poco a poco fue comprando cada día mas cositas para su tiendita la señora saco el crédito para poder comprar arroz, azúcar, fideo, refrescos, dulces, galletas y otros para surtir mas su tiendita ya que por donde vive tiene bastante demanda ahora ella esta feliz porque le dimos la oportunidad de darle el crédito y especialmente con kiva.
texts.en:
Antonia lives in her sister’s house where she has a small neighborhood grocery store. She started the business because her sister pushed her to get involved in something because she had no income. Seeing this, her sister made a loan to her so that she could start and gradually she bought more and more items for her store. She requested the loan to buy rice, sugar, pasta, beverages, candy, cookies and other items to stock her store because around where she lives there is a lot of demand. She is happy because we gave her this opportunity to have a loan especially with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, rice, sugar, beverages.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza hace 3 años y aprendió a tener una buena atención a sus clientes.
Juana es casada y tiene 4 hijos que ya viven fuera D. casa, Juana junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en su casa en donD. venden abarrotes en general, helados, actividad que realiza todos los días. Juana solicita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Juana sueña con tener lo necesario para vivir tranquila.
texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the community bank Bonanza for the past three years. She has learned good customer service skills. Juana is married and has four children who live outsiD. the home. Juana and her husband have a store in their home where they sell groceries and ice cream. They work every day. Juana is asking for a loan of 1050 soles, money she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil. Juana dreams of having what she needs to live peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Saophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Saophorn Y. was born in 1981 and is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bul Saut, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice which helps support the family.  

Additionally, they are duck breeders who can earn some money from selling eggs. Since her husband’s duck breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. To improve this business, Mrs. Saophorn Y. is asking for a loan to buy two hundred ducks. 

She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is two years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy two hundred ducks

loans.name: Basilia Yamilet

texts.es:
Basilia es una mujer dedicada  al trabajo, de oficio costurera  y venta de cosméticos, negocio el cual lo tiene en su casa, casada, siendo su esposo técnico de audio.
Anteriormente trabajaba en zona franca de operaria, el cual renuncia para comenzar hacer costura propia y lograr mejores ganancias, ya que en zona franca se trabaja mucho y el salario es bajo. 
Con los financiamientos que ha logrado en la institución ha aumentado la venta de productos Avon a si como hacer ropa nueva. El cual está contenta porque ha sido de mucho beneficios.
Hoy con este préstamo comprara telas variadas de colores, productos Avon y así seguir ofreciendo sus productos y lograr mejores venta.
Ya que ha sido de mucho beneficio el trabajar en casa y cuidar más de su esposo,  ya que no tiene hijo , y que espera a futuro ser madre.
texts.en:
Basilia is a lady dedicated to her works as a seamstress and saleswoman of cosmetics, business she manages from her home,she is married and her husband is an audio technician.

Previously she worked in the working zone, but she quit in order to set up her own workshop and increase profits as in the working zone work is much and salary is low.

With the loans from the institution she has increased her sales of Avon products as well as the business of new clothes. She is very happy with the many benefits.

With this loan she will buy material in a variety of colors and Avon products to continue offering her products and improve sales. It has been very beneficial working at home and taking care of her husband as she has no children but expects to be a mother in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material in a variety of colors and Avon products to increase sales and improve profits.

loans.name: Mariana Del Rocío

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Mariana tiene 29 años, está  separada y con tres hijos a su cargo su vida es muy difícil, a pesar de que sus padres le apoyan ya que viven en la casa de ellos, los gastos de alimentación y estudio de sus hijos son de ella.
 
Por esta razón es por lo que ella trabaja y se sacrifica, vende bisutería y artículos de belleza, sale a entregar todas las tardes, compra al por mayor en Portoviejo, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra semanalmente.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mas mercadería. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gustan los beneficios que ofrece la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es tener un  negocio grande para poder darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in Sequita parish, which is part of the prosperous canton of Manabita. The hardworking people of this area are dedicated and proud of their roots. The residents of Sequita are honest people who know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

Sra. Mariana is 29 years old and separated from her spouse. With three children to raise, her life is very difficult. Despite living at home with her parents and receiving their support, she must still cover the costs associated with feeding and educating her children.

For this reason, Mariana has worked and sacrificed by selling trinkets and beauty products. She travels every afternoon to deliver her products. Mariana buys in bulk in Portoviejo and then sells the products on credit, collecting payments on a weekly basis.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for several years and enjoys the benefits offered by Fundación ESPOIR.

Her dream is to have a large business so that she can provide the best for her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crèmes, cosmetics, perfumes, trinkets, and other items

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther L. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. Esther is married and has 7 school-aged children. Esther owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Esther is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Jenifa K. is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a chief. She has no children. She is currently in the business of selling bread.

Jenifa sells local Sudanese bread like lagemat, tamia, etc. She also sells tea in the local restaurants. 

Jenifa is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and bags of sugar. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a concrete restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Bring Amber Court To Unite Group 3-Jinja

texts.en:
38 year old W. Mudasiru is an "Amber Court Unite" group member. Most, if not all, of the group’s members carryout their business operations in the amber court market.  W.’s start up story reads like a page from the other members who are heading the other sub groups in the Amber Court Unite group. 

He started in his current fish sells business with savings from a modest silver fish sells enterprise. Prior to that he had tried his hand at agriculture. W. who is to all appearances a diligently focused man says his weekly business earnings sum up to 80,000 shillings. W. is happily married with 6 kids, 5 of whom attend school. With this loan he says he is going to purchase more fish for resell and the rest will go towards paying school fees for his kids.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish to resell and pay school fees for his kids

loans.name: Grace Nayianoi Ene

texts.en:
Grace Nayianoi Ene L. is 32 years old. She is married to Tonou L. and is a mother of four school-going children. Grace is a farmer and does the farming on her own piece of land, which she has been doing for the last fourteen years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to spend to prepare land for maize planting.  Maize is a plant that does well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to complete her house and expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Grace's dream is to do large scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To prepare land for maize planting

loans.name: Everline Ayuma

texts.en:
Everline Ayuma is a Kenyan entrepreneur from the county of Vihiga , an upcoming agricultural town in Western Kenya. She is married to Boaz who works with the government and they have four children  between 19 years and 7 years of age. 

Everline operates a retail shop at Chavavo location which is a suburb within the larger Vihiga town. She has successfully run this business for the last six years and she makes a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. She is taking her fourth loan from KADET Limited which she intends to use to buy more stock like rice and,sugar for her shop.She hopes to make more sales as we approach the festive season. She will use her profits to add more stock, repay her Kadet loan and pay school fees for her children.

Everline's hope is to become a wholesale business where she will be supplying to retailers within Chavavo. She also plans to buy a piece of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Kholiyor

texts.ru: Тураев Холиёр проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, занимается торговлей на рынке. Сам Холиёр арендует земельный участок, где засеивает пшеницу и выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян картошки, пшеницы и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Kholiyor T., 48, lives in the Shahritus region. He is married with 4 children. His wife sells goods at the market. Kholiyor rents a plot of land where he  sows wheat and grows vegetables for sale. Having done this work for over 10 years, Kholiyor is applying for a loan which would allow him to purchase mineral fertilizers, potatoes and wheat.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: La Fuente De Cristo 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Marcelo is the coordinator of his group, La fuerza de Cristo 1, 2, & 3 (The strenght of Christ). He makes his home in a simple structure with his wife and a child. He says that his most difficult challenge have been to develop his business.

Marcelo is excited to be taking his third loan with Esperanza, having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He has had his business for 5 years. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business to buy rice, flour and other foods.  He will use the profits to buy a vehicle that he needs to transport the goods to his business.

Marcelo's story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther E. is a thirty-eight-year-old woman.  She is married to Nasak, who is a businessman in Lodwar town.  Together they have two children.  They currently reside in Soweto in Lodwar town.

Esther runs a pharmacy in the same area.  She has been in this business for nine years and earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Esther's first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use it to buy different types of chemist drugs for her store.  With the income generated, she wants to reinvest back into her business by buying more stock. 

In the future, she wants to be financially stable, to sustain herself financially.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for pharmacy business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Teresa; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, la socia también trabaja en una empresa de transportes vendiendo boletos, la socia tiene el negocio de restaurant donde prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y verduras para el restaurant.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to El Molinito II Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Maria Teresa; she is 48 years old, married with four children. The member combines her daily activities with her restaurant. She also works for a transportation company selling tickets. The member has her restaurant where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She wants to grow and improve the restaurant. The member is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for cooking such as rice, meat, and vegetables for the restaurant.

The member is happy to get this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking such as rice, meat, and vegetables for the restaurant

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret M. has a restaurant, which she has had for over 10 years. She is 34 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more stock of food.  With the help of this loan, Gorret hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Gorret hopes to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of food

loans.name: Juan Andres

texts.es:
Desde hace 6 años Juan Andrés tiene su panadería donde sus padres también laboran; él aprendió esta labor gracias a un amigo que le ha enseñado todo lo relacionado con los productos de panificación.

El actualmente necesita comprar insumos y cambiar algunos de sus implementos para el trabajo ya que están desgastados por el uso. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y brindarles una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Andres and his parents have had their bakery for 6 years. He learned this trade from a friend who taught him all that he needed to know about making breads. 

He needs to acquire ingredients and to upgrade some kitchen implements that are worn out from use. His dream is to expand his business and to provide a wide variety of products to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Dixia Dinora

texts.es:
la joven Dixia tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la caserio el Obraje y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. tiene muchos clientes fijos que le compran todos los dias, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para empezar con la produccion del dia.
su producto lo reparte en varias casas y pulperias cercanas a su casa de habitacion.

Dixia es casada pero no tiene hijos y en sus tiempos libres cria gallinas.
su meta es hacer su negocio mas grande para que le genere mas ganancias.
su deseo es tener hijos y una bonita familia.
texts.en:
Young Dixia is 22 years old and lives in the hamlet of Obraje, where she is engaged in the production and sale of tortillas.  Her business is located in her home, and she has many regular customers who buy from her daily.  She gets up at 4 am every day to begin the day's production.  Her products are distributed to several houses and small stores near her home.

Dixie is married but has no children, and in her spare time she breeds chickens.  Her goal is to make her business bigger so that it will generate increased profits.  Her wish is to have children and a beautiful family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, lime and water

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Adrian; él tiene 53 años de edad y es viudo y tiene 4 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía como muñecas de tela,llamas,vicuñas entre otros mas el socio trabaja en este negocio ya un buen tiempo atrás, a la vez el socio trabaja como albañil en todo tipo de construcción que le solicitan ,el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia aunque sus hijos ya son mayores pero el igual sigue apoyándolos en lo que necesitan.

El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio de venta de artesanía.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Adrian belongs to the communal bank "Sol y Luna," located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Adrian is a 53 year-old widower who has 4 children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling handicrafts such as woven dolls, llamas, vicuñas, and other items.  Adrian has worked in this business for quite some time.  He also works as a bricklayer on all types of construction projects.  He is a person who is quite cheerful and has a strong desire to get ahead with his family.  Although his children are already grown, he continues to help them out when needed.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for his business selling handicrafts.

He is pleased to have this loan, and is committed to making all of his payments.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his business selling handicrafts

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old, married and has one child. He also cares for four people who share the home he lives in. For the last five years he has run a shop in Kyenjojo where he sells various beverages, and is applying for this loan to buy a refrigerator to help keep some of his beverages cool. He dreams of providing his child with a good education.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for a shop that sells beverages.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom goes to school. A. took out a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase modern tools and other equipment

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La señora Laura oriunda de la localidad de San Jose vive en la casa de sus padres, su actividad es la venta de refrigerios y sándwich en el colegio de la zona,  convive con el sr. José el cual es albañil tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Laura se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para elaborar sus sándwich y también para prepara el almuerzo para su familia, después sale a vender todo esto por la mañana, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Laura comprara refrigerador para poder conservar mejor sus alimentos, la Sra. Laura es una persona responsable y trabajadora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir adelante superándose.
texts.en: Señora Laura, a native of San Jose, lives in her parent's home.  She sells snacks and sandwiches in the school area.  She also lives with her partner Señor José who is a bricklayer.  They have three school age children.  Señora Laura gets up early in the morning to make her sandwiches and also, to prepare lunch for her family.  After that she leaves to make her morning sales.  With the loan Señora Laura will buy a refrigerator so that her foods will keep better.  Señora Laura is a responsible and hard-working person.  She is grateful to the institution for their financial support as it is providing her with a better quality of life and is helping her to continue to excel.

loans.use: purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Gemma has a restaurant and a business selling grocery products. She earns about 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Gemma has requested a loan to purchase ingredients for her restaurant business and purchase products for her mini-grocery store.

Gemma has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant and purchase products for her mini-grocery store

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 38, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. Chantha is a sugarcane juice seller, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 20 USD on food and 24 USD on the other necessary expenses. 

Chantha is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to improve her family farming. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Herma

texts.en:
Herma's main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 27 years old, is married, and has 2 grown children. She has had her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) monthly.

Herma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy piglets to raise and pig feed.

In the future, Herma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and pig feed.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old. He is married to Mary, who assists her husband in farming to earn more income for the family. Their children are aged 25, 23, 21, 19, and 17 years. He has been in farming for 26 years; his monthly income from the business is KES. 20,000.

He is requesting a loan of KES. 20,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to complete construction of his rental houses.This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

His hope and dream is to complete his rental houses and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods for his store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita sells assorted groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. She is 50 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. Teresita is married with three children. Each month, she earns 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items for her business.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve the general standard of living of her family with the income generated from her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries worth 25,000 Philippine pesos for her business.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Vallecito Vizcachani”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos, 6 de ellos son independientes.  Estudió hasta 3ro de educación primaria.
La señora trabaja desde hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela R., su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de comidas, nos cuenta que también se dedica a la venta de verduras.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.   400.00 nuevo soles, comprará verduras como zanahoria, cebollas, zapallos, repollos, toda clase de verduras.  En el negocio le ayuda su hija, su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad, en San Juan del Oro. 
Su deseo es mejorar el negocio de comidas y poner una tienda de abarrotes.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo con periodos cortos y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Natalia is a member of the “Vallecito Vizcachani” Communal Bank, which is located in the district and department of Puno.  She is 62 years old, and is married with seven children, six of whom are financially independent.  She studied up to the third level of primary education.

The Señora has been working with Movimiento Manuela R. for the last five years.  Her initial loan was for 300 New Soles, money which she invested in her business selling meals.  She tells us that she also works selling vegetables.

With this new loan of 400 New Soles, she will buy vegetables such as carrots, onions, pumpkins, cabbages, and all different kinds of vegetables.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Her husband works away from the city, in San Juan del Oro.

Her wish is to grow her business selling meals, and to have a grocery store.  What she likes about the Communal Bank is the ease of the short-term loans, and that she can make savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as carrots, onions, pumpkins, cabbages, and all different types of vegetables.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia tiene 42 años, es una madre soltera que con esfuerzo, coraje y sacrificio pudo sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que ahora tienen 23, 20 y 15 años y viven junto a ella en su casa propia que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Eulalia consiste en la venta de comida, por las mañana ella vende desayunos y al medio día almuerzos y por las noches asados y comida. Ella realizará este trabajo sola y espera le vaya bien ya que es nueva en esta actividad, tiene un espacio acondicionado en su casa para poder tener todas las comodidades para su trabajo, tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante y crecer en su negocio. A ella le gusta mucho cocinar y estar en contacto con la gente y eso es un factor determinante para que gane a sus clientes. Espera poder trabajar bien y así generar muchas ganancias en su hogar, mas adelante quisiera ella tener su restaurante formal y así poder hacer empresa en su distrito. Este será el primer crédito con la institución MFP, espera que los demás integrantes del grupo le ayuden a integrarse y a llevar el ritmo de trabajo que tienen y así no fallarles. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales como sillas, ingredientes e insumos para iniciar para la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 42 years old and a single mother. With effort, courage, and sacrifice, she was able to move forward with her three children who are now 23, 20, and 15 years of age. They live together in their own home which she was able to buy after much effort. Her work involves selling food. Eulalia sells breakfast in the mornings, lunches at noon, and barbecue and dinners in the evenings. She goes about her work alone and hopes to do well since she is new to this business. Eulalia has a space in her house that is equipped with all of the amenities for her work so that she can succeed and grow in her business. She enjoys cooking and having contact with people, which is a determining factor that helps her to attract customers. Eulalia hopes to do good work and generate plenty of income for her household. Going forward, she wants to have a formal restaurant so that she can have a business in her district.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Eulalia hopes that the other members of her group will help her feel welcome and show her their work routine so that she does not disappoint them. The amount she requested will be used to buy materials such as chairs, ingredients, and supplies so that she can start preparing food.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, ingredients, and supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Jeneth has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jeneth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jeneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lisbet Katherine

texts.es:
Lisbet de 21 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Castilla que pertenece  al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.
  
Desde hace 2 años Lisbet se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas), verduras, frutas y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su domicilio para su  comodidad, ya que puede atender a cualquier hora, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todas sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería (comestibles) para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio sea más grande y esté más surtido de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes;  con las ganancias podrá cubrir su préstamo y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Lisbet es una persona responsable, trabajadora y dedicada, con el objetivo de que su familia tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Lisbet is 21 years old. She lives with her family in her parents' house, which only has electricity. It is located in the department of Piura. This area is characterized by it farming and cattle ranching activity. 
  
For 2 years, Lisbet has sold groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, and candies) vegetables, fruits and beverages. She has set up her business in her house for convenience, since she can attend to it at any time. With the earnings from selling her products, she tries to cover all of the daily expenses for her home. 

To stock her business, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy a greater quantity of merchandise (edibles). Her only objective for the business is for it to be bigger and with a wider variety for he customers. With the earnings, she will be able to pay for the loan and improve her quality of life. Lisbet is a responsible, hardworking and dedicated person whose objective is for her family to have financial improvement.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to stock edible products at her store.

loans.name: Monicah Njeri

texts.en:
Monicah is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children aged 1 to 11 years. She describes herself as focused. 

Monicah operates a farming business where she sells farm produce, including maize, green vegetables and milk. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a rural area known as Kimende. She describes her biggest business challenge as financial constraints. 

Monicah will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to grow her business and deliver more milk to a dairy factory within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a vehicle to facilitate transportation while running her businesses.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ayoob

texts.en: Ayoob is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza. He owns his own barber shop. He hopes that through this loan, he would be able to buy machines for cutting hair and beauty products. And once he gets this loan, he would be able to expand his business since he will have everything he needs and it will be complete.

loans.use: buy machines for cutting hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Rogelio Jr.

texts.en:
Rogelio is single and he is 20 years old, residing at Calamba, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. 

Rogelio is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years. Each month, he earns 5,600 PHP doing this business. 

He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

Rogelio has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rogelio wants to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Lorenzo Saturnino

texts.es:
Lorenzo de 42 años, comenzó alquilando un carro para poder trabajar como taxista, con la ayuda de Dios pudo comprar un carro para poder trabajar para sí mismo. Trabajo todos los días de 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.

El único problema que presenta su trabajo es la delincuencia ya que su trabajo lo lleva a recorrer todos los sectores, anterior mente ya ha sido víctima de la delincuencia.

Esta felizmente casado y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 7, 5 años que estudian en escuela fiscal. Con el prestamo quiere mejorar su vivienda comprando cemento, arena, bloques. 
 
Su meta es poder terminar de pagar su vehículo y poder terminar de construir su vivienda para más comodidad.
texts.en:
42 year old Lorenzo began renting a car so he could work as a taxi driver. With the help of God, he was able to buy a car to do this work. He works everyday from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. 
The only problem with his work is the risk of crime as his work takes him to all neighborhoods and in the past he has been a victim of crime.
He is happily married and has 3 children aged 10, 7, and 5 who are all in school. He wants the loan to improve his house by buying cement, sand, and cinderblocks. 
His goals are to be able to finish paying for his vehicle and to finish building his house so it will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to improve his house by buying cement, sand, and cinderblocks.

loans.name: Nassif

texts.en: Nassif is 33 years old, single and has worked as a carpenter for the last 13 years. He opened his own business in 2004 and has done really well because he works hard and is highly respected by his customers. Because his business is growing, he has decided to apply for a loan to buy more of the tools and machines he needs to do high-quality, professional work. He also hopes to expand his business by making furniture as well as doors and closets. His goal for the future is to open a large manufacturing company which supplies products all over Lebanon.

loans.use: to buy more tools and machines for a carpentry business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 26-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Veronica who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged five. He has been in the farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 7,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Patrick will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a dairy cow. 

He hopes to open a retail shop for his wife which will improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur DRISSA  est âgé de 38 ans et vit avec ses 7 enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à DONGORONA, un des villages de la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
DRISSA n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école car il fut  vite exclu du système éducatif.  Alors il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à l’embouche (qui est une des activités de leur famille) et à l’achat stockage vente de céréales qu’il appris auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de quatre ans, Monsieur DRISSA jouit d’une grande renommée et est très sollicité à Ouelessebougou et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt il est à son deuxième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil) auprès des paysans producteurs qu’il gardera pendant au moins un mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
DRISSA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Drissa is 38 years old and lives with his seven children and his spouse in a traditional family in Dongorona, one of the villages of the city of Ouelessebougou, Kati prefecture, Koulikoro region.

Drissa did not have the chance to succeed in school because he was quickly excluded from the educational system. So he became interested in income-generating businesses notably in cattle fattening (which is one of his family's businesses) and in buying, storage and selling of cereals which he learned from his uncle. With four years experience, Drissa enjoys great fame and is very much in demand in Ouelessebougou and surrounding areas.

Due to the worry of satisfying his clearly growing clientèle, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid the first loan he is on his second individual loan which will serve to buy 4 tons of cereals (corn, bean, mil [African cereal]) from the farmers which he will keep for at least one month. He sells essentially wholesale to a clientèle consisting of resellers from the large cities such as Bamako.

Drissa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in his businesses.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es: La señora Asunta es cliente nueva de la institución ella es la mama de uno de nuestros clientes mas antiguos de la institución, la  señora Asunta vive en la ciudad de El Alto la señora asunta se dedica a la venta de coca (La hoja de coca (Erythroxylum Coca) es utilizada como planta medicinal desde hace siglos, especialmente en las culturas andinas), La Sra. Asunta Trae la coca por Takes(quintales) los cuales los trae de los yungas dos veces por semana los cuales los comercializa en el mercado de la coca el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de coca por mayor a persona que tiene licencia para la venta de coca, la Sra. Asunta es una persona muy trabajadora, se esfuerza mucho ya que el viaje a la localidad de los yungas es largo y por la carretera muy peligrosa por ser una camino muy accidentado, pero ella siempre fuerte, para salir adelante.
texts.en: Asunta is a new client of EMPRENDER.  She is the mother of one of EMPRENDER's most longstanding clients.  Asunta lives in the city of El Alto.  She has a business selling coca leaves.  Coca (Erythroxylum Coca) has been used as a medicinal plant for centuries, especially in the Andean culture.  Asunta brings the coca leaves by the quintal (46 kilograms).  She brings them through the Yungas, (subtropical valleys located in the foothills of the Andes), 2 days a week and sells them in the coca market.  The loan she is requesting is to purchase coca at wholesale from a person who has a license to sell coca.  Asunta is a very hardworking person who exerts herself a lot, since the trip from the Yungas is long and the road is very treacherous as it is known to have many fatal accidents.  But she stays strong so that she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy 46 kg sacks of coca leaves

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary bananas and sugar cane-growing region. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. She has four children and has been doing this work for three years. 

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “poultry keeping”. Her biggest challenge is “Diseases”. Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Babuni”.

Jackline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “Better services.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and replied, “Their services.”

Her highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Jackline replied, “it will avail water on the farm continuously,and thus production will increase and there will be more income.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jackline owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Leya

texts.en: Leya is 70 years old and deals in cocoa buying and selling. This is supplemented by cocoa growing, oil and tomato buying and selling for income generation. She is single mother  of one child both living in Bundibugyo Uganda, she started cocoa  selling 30 years back to raise income to support the family’s increasing demands. Her family desire is to buy more land and increase cocoa growing and she also has a business dream of establishing a bigger cocoa store and be able make bigger sales and profits. Her business is affected by unpredictable changes in weather and high transport costs hindering her returns. She is requesting for a loan to buy oil, tomatoes and cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy oil, tomatoes and cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura sells ice cream in her local neighborhood. She has been working as a saleswoman since she was a young girl. She started selling tortillas and stuffed potatoes from a cart after her mother passed away. Laura worked as a house cleaner in Venezuela for several years in order to pay for an operation her ill son needed. She is now back in Guayaquil and depends on her ice cream sales to feed her family. She is a single mother with 3 children, 2 of which are still dependents and go to school. She will invest the money in a new freezer so she may begin to sell products from her home as well as on the streets.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She will invest the money in a new freezer so she may begin to sell products from her home

loans.name: Danubia Lizeth

texts.en: Hello, my name is Danubia, and my primary activity is commerce. I have fabric sales business, and I deliver all orders to my clients’ homes in my community. I have been working at this job for several years, and it generates income so that I can cover my family’s expense. I am a single mother, and my children depend on me. Recently, the volume of sales has increased, but I do not have the capital to meet the existing demand.

loans.use: Purchase of solid, printed, embroidered, and silk fabrics, as well as fabrics for pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchase flour and oil, preparing and selling cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Necesita comprar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Juana Irene

texts.es:
Senora Juana is fifty-three years old and she was left a widow 23 years ago. Since then she has been working support herself and her two daughters. Juana started her own store selling fruits and other products at local fairs of different provinces and districts of the city in which she lives, Juliaca. It’s something she has been doing for a long time. The money has provided a profession for both her daughters, who now work to proviD. for the well being of their own families. Presently she has a small store in her brother-in-law’s house, the house that she also lives in. The store that she opened with her children is under her control and with the increase of requests and orders she hopes to increase the variety of products in order to continue increasing the level of satisfaction of her costumers. For that reason she needs a loan of $325 dollars, money that she will use to increase her stock of her small store. She also wishes to save sufficient money to finish the construction of her house and to relocate herself and her store so that she will be able to live comfortably in her own home. For this reason she is asking each one of your generous hearts for support. She wants to make her dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Juana D. 53 años D. edad, quedó viuda hace más D. 23 años, desD. entonces tuvo que trabajar sola y salir adelante junto a sus 2 hijos. Doña Juana empezó vendiendo abarrotes, frutas y otros productos en las ferias D. las distintos provincias y distritos D. la ciudad donD. radica, Juliaca, oficio al que se dedicó por muchos años y con el que pudo brindarles una profesión a sus dos hijos, que ahora trabajan para procurarles bienestar a sus propias familias. Actualmente tiene una pequeña bodeguita D. abarrotes, ubicado en el domicilio D. su cuñado, lugar donD. vive. El negocio que abrió con ayuda D. sus hijos está bajo su administración y con el incremento D. solicitudes y pedidos ahora desea aumentar la variedad D. sus productos para seguir incrementando la satisfacción D. sus clientes; por esa razón solicita un préstamo D. 325 dólares, dinero que utilizará para acrecentar el capital y mejorar el stock D. productos en su pequeña tienda.. Y su deseo más próximo es ahorrar lo suficiente para terminar D. construir su domicilio, a donD. desea trasladar su bodeguita para estar más cómoda y para esto recurre a cada uno D. los corazones generosos con el deseo D. convertir su anhelo en realidad.

loans.use: Juana wants a loan to increase the quantity and variety of products in her store. She wants attract new costumers to her store and to offer better service to existing and new customers.

loans.name: Arelis Pérez

texts.en: Arelis, 36, is married and has three children (two boys and a girl) and lives in Yamasa, Dominican Republic.  They attend public school.  Her husband is working as bartender in Santo Domingo, the capital.  For more than two years, Arelis has been running a small business within her house.  She sells clothes, shoes, slippers, trainers and sandals for women.  Bi-monthly, she goes to the capital to purchase the goods and resells in her community.  Sometimes, she sells door to door.  Her persistence and persuasive speaking abilities have earned her many loyal customers.  Now, Arelis is thinking about increasing her sales volume considerably and expanding her client base.  She needs a loan to buy of products in bulk so that she can reduce costs and increase profit.  She will use a part of the loan to buy a new showcase to put the products.

loans.use: The purchase off clothing and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Mrs. Huy N., 49, is married with six children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their piece of land growing cucumber and raising pigs, earning collectively around $2/day. Three of her children are currently enrolled in school and the rest are too young. This couple has recently requested for a loan to expand their livestock by adding more pigs and feed.

loans.use: To expand her livestock by adding more pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs.Bui Thi X., 26 years old, joined the Fund since 2004. Her family currently has 4 members: the parents and 2 children. Her husband, Mr. Pham Van Hung, is a builder. When she did not have children yet, she sold dried food in the market and earned income for her family. This activity is convenient for paying back the money weekly. However, since she had 2 children, she could not work far away from home and as a result, her income decreased. To be able to take care of her children and to earn income for the family, she discussed with her husband and decided to borrow 450 USD to rebuild the pigpen and invest in breeding pigs. Her husband also helps her to pay back the money weekly. Her family income is 120 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị X., 26 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004. Gia đình chị hiện nay gồm 4 người: 2 vợ chồng và 2 cháu. Chồng chị, anh Phạm Văn Hùng, là một thợ xây. Khi chưa có cháu nhỏ chị X. buôn bán hàng khô ở chợ cũng tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Công việc này cũng thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả hàng tuần. Từ khi sinh cháu chị không đi làm xa được nên nguồn thu nhập cũng hạn chế. Để vừa chăm sóc con vừa lao động tạo thu nhập cho gia đình bớt khó khăn, chị bàn với chồng xin vay 450USD để sửa chữa chuồng trại đầu tư nuôi lợn. Nguồn hoàn trả hàng tuần do anh hỗ trợ. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 120USD.

loans.use: Repair pigpen and buy pigs

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz is the mother of two children. She was born in 1958. The Hadjimatov family lives in the town of Khachmaz.. She started this business four years ago as a way of supporting her family. Mrs. H. requests a loan of $775 to buy a larger inventory of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of clothes for resale

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en: Arafa is a 64-year-old mother of five and a resident of Lumo area in Dar es Salaam city. She takes care of six grandchildren, all of them orphans. She has a charcoal store and a small shop alongside it, which she has operated for the past twenty years. She has been  with Youth Self Employment Foundation for the past eight years. She uses the profits from her businesses to take care of herself and her grandchildren. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is a relatively young woman, full of energy and with a lot of desire to work and begin new businesses. She has spent ten years working in her older sister's sewing and baking workshop. At the beginning she was not a part of the business until five years ago when she had the idea to implement a baking workhop into the textile sewing services. Due to this, the time that she spends in the workshop is greater. She is thankful to her sister for giving her this opportunity but she currently plans to open her own workshop in her home because being outside of her house all day impedes her from taking care of her 8 year old son. Aside from this, she also is thinking of becoming a distributor for gas for cooking. For all of this she countson the support of her husband, working as a bricklayer, is in charge of the home maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Irma es una mujer relativamente joven, llena de energía y de muchos ánimos para trabajar y emprender nuevos negocios. Ella actualmente lleva diez años trabajando en el taller de teñidos y confección de su hermana mayor. Al inicio no formaba parte de la empresa, hasta que hace cinco años ideo implementar el taller de confección con el servicio de tenidos de textiles también. A raíz de esto el tiempo que ocupa en el taller es mayor.
