Ella agradece a su hermana por darle esta oportunidad, pero actualmente ella planea abrir su propio taller en su casa en un tiempo, pues el estar fuera de su casa todo el día impide ocuparse de su pequeño hijo de ocho años. Muy aparte de ello también está pensando ser una distribuidora de gas de cocina. Para todo esto ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabajando como albañil se encarga del mantenimiento del hogar.

loans.use: Invest in her work to be able to become independent in a short period of time

loans.name: La Restauracion (Restoration) Group

texts.en:
Santiago is middle aged man who lives with his wife and four children in the farming town of Hato Mayor, in the Dominican Republic.  He has asked for this loan to buy used and new clothing for his small business; in his community there are no businesses that sell both new and used clothing, so demand is often higher than what he afford to supply.  This loan will allow him to buy a larger quantity of clothing, and consequently, earn more income.

His biggest challenge right now is to enjoy his health while he has it by walking, and taking time to enjoy being active, as well as being able to pay for his five children to continue studying.  He says his dream is to own his own house, own his own land plot to put his business on, and to one day in the near future have enough savings to buy his own vehicle or motorcycle.

On behalf of the entire team at Esperanza International, as well as Santiago and his entire group—we thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise so that he can better meet the demand of his clients.

loans.name: Sapasui's Group

texts.en:
This group from Fatausi was started in April 2008 when Sapasui T., the group leader, heard the talk-back about microloans on the radio and spread the news to her neighbors. Their primary businesses are growing and selling taro and operating canteens. They work hard and they expect to pay off their first loan and get their second one.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guaranT. one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, equipments, food, drinks and stock for their businesses.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: M. Nasiba is 46 years old. She is married and the loving mother of five children. Her husband is a journalist. Nasiba is a market vendor, and sells footwear and shoes. Nasiba delivers all of her goods with the help of her son. Nasiba strives to purchase quality items and provide them at a reasonable price to her customers, and works hard to ensure her clients are satisfied with their products. Her business is doing well, and her stable income is allowing her to provide her children with many opportunities and a strong education. Nasiba would like to expand the range of shoes she sells to her clients, and would like a loan of $1000. She would use the profits earned to support her family and continue financing her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchasing of the shoes for teenagers in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Aliye

texts.en:
Aliye M. is 25 years old and married with a three-year-old child. She has owned and run a small salon since 2007. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her business.

In the past, Aliye has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more stock for her salon business.

loans.use: To buy more items to improve her salon business.

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema baji is the wife of A. M., and she lives in an area of the city of Lahore known as Walton in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick, which she has lived in for the last 20 years. Moreover, she is the mother of three daughters, all of whom are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Haleema baji's husband is a painter by profession: he paints doors, walls of houses, and big buildings. In fact, he has been in this business for the last 15 years. Haleema baji, meanwhile, is a cook by profession, and she cooks in several houses. She is applying for a loan in order to buy tools (e.g., paint brushes and paints) for her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following group members: (1) Shamim baji, who seeks a loan to buy furniture for her clinic; (2) Parveen baji, who requests a loan to buy clothes to resell; and (3) Reeta R. baji, who is in need of a loan to buy materials (e.g., cosmetics and face polishes) for her parlor.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Importantly, the group members mutually guarantee each other's loans; thus, if one member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's painting business by purchasing paints and paint brushes

loans.name: Samiat

texts.en: A. is 45 years old and married with three children. She sells wrappers (sarong) and lace materials. She also sells gold earrings and necklaces. She has been in this business for a long time. She is seeking a loan of 850 USD to purchase more wrappers (sarong) and lace materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more sarong and lace materials to sell

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: El Sr. Marco A., hace 37 años que reside en la zona, cuenta con domicilio propio donde vivie con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su actividad es la agricultura, principalmente la producción de sésamo, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, cuenta con un tractor propio, con lo que realiza además los servicios de tractoreo en las pequeñas granjas de la zona. EL Sr. Marco es uno de los clientes mas antiguos con los que contamos actualmente, tiene ganas de seguir trabajando con la institución y de esa manera llegar a mejorar y crecer como agricultor, tiene 5 hectareas, las cuales destina para la crianza de ganado de tal manera que no le queda mucho espacio para la agricultura, por ello quisiera en un futuro próximo poder comprar una propiedad más grande.
texts.en:
Mr Marco A. has lived in the area for 37 years, in his own home that he lives in with his wife and two sons. He works in agriculture, principally in the production of sesame, as well as dedicating himself to the raising of cattle, relying on his own tractor, with which he also realizes tractor services in the little farms in the area. Mr Marco is one of our oldest clients, and has continued to earn work with the institution and in this manner has been able to improve and grow as an farmer. He has five hectares which are destined for raising livestock in such as way that he is not leaving much space for agriculture. For this reason he hopes to be able to purchase a larger property in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sesame seeds

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Along the national high way of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidetal lives Mrs. Marissa A. D.. She is  49 years old, married with 2 children.  Marissa and her husband operate a “CARENDERIA” (mini restaurant).  Her husband does farming but also cooks for their business.  The carenderia started in their home but they transfered it to a populous place that is more accessible to customers and travelers. They have been in business for fourteen years.
 
Marissa, a member in good standing of Hope Center,  is applying for a loan of $300 from Paglaum MPC for additonal capital for expansion and  to purchase kitchen utensils. .

Mrs. D. dreams of having her own restaurant someday, with the help of Pagalum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking materials and supplies to her Carenderia

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sita T., 30, is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Khokhana-Dobato. She opened her grocery shop 4 years ago to improve the living standard of her family. In her shop Mrs. T. sells rice, maize, snacks, cold drinks, etc. Now her family's living conditions are not so good because her husband, Mr. Buddha T., went to Dubai to earn money, but still he could not send any money to the family. So Mrs. T. has to fulfill all the needs of the family. She has to pay the fees for her children’s school as well. So she is facing economic problems.

To solve this problem, Mrs. T. is requesting Rs 10,000 loan to add some other varieties of grocery goods to her shop to increase her earnings. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 8 and her son is in primary school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for re-sale

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en:
Chhung L., 30, is married and lives in Siem Reap province. She grows rice and corn to earn a living and is able to make US$ 2.50 a day, while her husband has a business catching fish and re-selling them at the market to earn approximately US$ 2.50 a day as well.

This couple has three children and all of them are students. Mrs. Chhung L. is asking for a loan of US$ 350 to purchase a water pump in case her farm experiences difficulty with water.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Mariam N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with five children between the ages of 22 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. 

Mariam has been running a poultry business since 2007. It is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

She works at the business for six hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Mariam currently earns about US$200 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mariam thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purcahase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
Murodjon S. is married with two kids. Murodjon is a unique entrepreneur. He has been a market vendor for about 5 years. Over that time he has become very popular at the market and has many customers. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let her customers know the benefits of his products – he also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture.

Murodjon is seeking a loan of 800 USD to re-stock the merchandise in his store. We believe that Murodjon’s desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Santillán Sánchez tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Sandra se dedica a la venta de productos de chocolates, lo vende en su domicilio y en la curtiembre en donde labora su papa, además su producto es ofrecido en diversas tiendas del distrito, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de chocotejas, estas eran ofrecidas por cajas.
Con el crédito de 100 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio así como en materiales e ingredientes para las chocotejas.
Sandra tiene el gran sueño de poner una tienda para la venta de abarrotes y chocotejas, al interior de su distrito.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra Santillán Sánchez is 25 and lives in the district of Moche, the province of Trujillo, and the department of La Libertad. She studied through high school, and has 2 children who depend on her economically. Sandra sells chocolates in her home and in the tannery where her father works. Her product is also offered in various stores in the district, and she develops her business in her home. She received her first credit of 300 soles from the communal bank, "Luis Alberto Sánchez II" and invested it in ingredients to make chocolates, which she offers in boxes. With this credit of 100 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in implementing her business with materials and ingredients to make chocolates. Sandra has the big dream of starting a store to sell groceries and chocolates in the interior of her district.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement her business with materials and ingredients to make chocolates

loans.name: Félix Alberto

texts.es:
Felix P. es un caballero originario del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León donde se dedica a laborar arduamente para mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia que tanto necesita su apoyo.

Con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y hoy en día ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por medio de una reconstrucción que ha iniciado actualmente. Hoy en día él ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para así salir adelante brindándole mejores condiciones de vida a toda su familia
texts.en:
Felix P. is a gentleman originally from the municipality of Nagarote in the city of León, where he dedicates himself to working arduously to improve his standard of living and that of his family who greatly needs his support. With much sacrifice, he has managed to get ahead. Currently, he has started making improvements to his house through a construction effort he has initiated. He has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials, so he can move forward providing better living conditions for his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas C. is married with 7 dependents and received an education through Junior High School. Since 1980, Dorcas has worked as a trader selling cooked rice at Kissi in Elmina. While Dorcas works as a trader, her husband is employed as a businessman. She uses her income to pay for her family’s school fees and bills. Dorcas will use the loan to purchase more rice in bags, which she will then cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorcas plans to continue working on the house that she has started building.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bags to cook and sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina O. cooks and sells Sudanese local bread and is requesting a loan to open up a place to sell tea. She is 33 years old and married a soldier. They have five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a place to sell tea

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Hồ Trần Thị is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has two school-aged children. Hồ earns her living by owning and operating a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food items and daily-use products in the local community. Hồ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Hồ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Hồ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business premises.

Hồ is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Hồ plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lenny Love

texts.en: Lenny Love N. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 22 years old, married, and has two infant children. Lenny Love owns and operates a business running a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Lenny Love joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lenny Love is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is from Tambo Real, a rural community located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is forty-eight years old and married with five children.

Cirila makes dairy products at home from the milk that her cows produce. Every weekend she sells cheeses at the Huancaro market in Cusco for 2 to 3 soles (approximately 75 cents to $1). Right now the space she has to keep her cows is too small. She plans to use the loan to build an enclosed area in front of her house to comfortably hold them (the picture shows the land that will be developed). 

Cirila is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of fourteen members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa. They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members should anyone default.

loans.use: To build enclosed animal shelter for cows

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
Mercedez D. C. is a woman full of determination to rise above poverty. She is 63 years old but still the fire within her to get out of poverty is burning. She is widowed and the mother of six children: all of legal age already. She lives in Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

In 2007, she decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, hoping to access capital for her sari-sari store (general store). During her membership in ASHI, her performance has been noted to be very good. Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 pesos to pay for three sacks of rice among many other groceries for the store.

With the opportunity given to her by ASHI and Kiva, she believes that she is getting nearer to the fulfillment of her dreams. She wants to help her grandchildren with their school fees and also to save for their future, since she is getting old already.

loans.use: To pay for three  sacks of rice among many other groceries for a store

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is from the city of Quiindy. His own house is used for his business, selling products of prime necessity: breadmakers, meat of all kinds, etc. He is requesting credit for his operating capital, specifically to purchase merchandise to use in his business.

He is very grateful and pleased about the confidence that has been bestowed upon him, evident in the usefulness of the credit he received.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yesom Awurade Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty years old she is married and mother with five children. She has three of the children who are currently in school. She is a trader in palm nuts fruits. Palm nut fruits are used to produce almost all cooking oil in the country and beyond. She takes stock from the farmers and supply to the big companies for further production. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts to increase and to boost sales. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and finance her children’s education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yesom Awurade’ which literary means ‘We are serving God’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy calves to be fattened

loans.name: Nakazade A Muwonge Sarah Group

texts.en: M. Sarah is the president of Nakazadde A group loan. She is fifty years of age and a widow. She is blessed with six children and more so has one sibling who is going to school. She is a tailor and she has been operating her tailoring services since the year 1990. She is requesting for the loan to purchase more material clothing’s for making clothes; she makes good designing for sale that is dresses, shirts, suits, etc. She wishes to boost her business mostly that now she is targeting Christmas season where people buy more and more clothes for the festive season. Her future plan is to work very hard and construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more material clothing’s for making clothes; she makes good designing for sale.

loans.name: Jerida

texts.en:
Jerida is a 36 year-old married mother of six children who runs a grocery store in the Mathare slums of Nairobi. She has run this business for ten years and hopes to expand the business to earn a better income so she can move away from the slums. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy more Irish potatoes and tomatoes, and a tomato box. She describes herself as full of potential and ready to achieve. 

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes, tomatoes, and a tomato box.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Vending rice and at the same time operating a tricycle are the main sources of income for Editha and her family. Editha would like to develop her business to generate better income. She is able to generate a good income from her passenger tricycle and her rice businesses, but she still needs more capital to maintain her businesses.

Editha says that through her sacrifices and patience in her business, she is able to support her one child, who is named is Jam Matiecon and is four years old. She wanted to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders in order to develop and maintain the businesses that she manages. Editha is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP and she is hoping that it will be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital to develop and maintain her business

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: A. Gulchehra is a 47-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of five children. Gulchehra is a farmer. She has land where she plants crops like wheat, onions, carrots and rice. As a rule, Gulchehra and her son, who is also engaged in her farm business, grow sufficient crops for the consumption of the family and for selling. Today, in applying to IMON for the 3,000 Somoni loan, Gulchehra hopes to produce a rich yield that she will sell in the market at prices attractive to the population. She is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength in life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking Merchandise in a Shop

loans.name: Jejie

texts.en:
Jejie B. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Jejie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jejie owns & operates a business selling fish in the local community. Jejie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jejie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jejie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jejie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the primary needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 45 años,vive con su pareja Juan de 47 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos pero viven sólo con Mirco de 23 años, en su casa que es  propia.Desde hace 25 años se dedica a sembrar zanahoria, papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja y flor de gladiolos de diferentes colores, en las tierras que compró con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hermanos Jesús y Rubino, quienes en la actualidad todavía cultivan las chacras junto a ella, pese a los años se mantienen unidos; considera rentable su trabajo porque con las ganancias pudo construir su casa, brindarle una adecuada  calidad de vida a su familia; dentro de sus planes futuros, tiene pensado  aperturar una tienda de fertilizantes en la localidad donde vive ya que  estos insumos son muy cotizados entre sus vecinos, asimismo se dedicará también a la compra y venta de maquinaria pesada.Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP y desea continuar trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal  porque son personas bastante confiables y responsables.El dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de arveja, varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes  para sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and lives with her partner, Juan, age 47. The couple has 2 children, but they live with only one, Mirco, age 23, in a house that they own. For the past 25 years, Rosa has cultivated carrots, Peruvian potatoes, peas and gladiolus flowers of various colors, on land that she purchased with the help of her husband and her brothers Jesús and Rubino, who currently still cultivate the fields along with her. Although many years have passed, they remain united. Rosa considers her work to be worthwhile, because the profits from it have allowed her to build her house and provide an adequate standard of living for her family. Among her plans for the future, she is thinking about opening a fertilizer store in the community where she lives, since her neighbors buy a lot of these supplies. She would also like to buy and sell heavy machinery. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she would like to continue working with the members of her communal bank, because they are very trustworthy and responsible people. She will invest the funds from this loan in purchasing pea seeds and several sacks of organic compost and fertilizers for her cultivated fields.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, organic compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Kit

texts.en: Mrs. Kit R. lives in a medium-sized house from which she operates a small enterprise, selling different types of groceries to the neighbors. She is able to earn approximately $3.50 each day. For another source of income, her husband works as a local chef for wedding parties. Kit has three teenage children who are students in the local public school. She proposes to improve her grocery sale business in order to accrue additional income; thus, she requested a loan of $600 to accumulate more inventory to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis Felipe G. es un Sr. de 59 años de edad quien, labora como Vigilante en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.

 El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos   crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc,  perlines, y mano de obra para el techo de su casa de habitación  por lo que anteriormente el techo de su casa se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba.
Luis dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha venido mejorando ahora es mas segura y mi familia vive en mejores condiciones que antes.
texts.en:
Luis Felipe is 59 years old and works as a security guard in the National University of Nicaragua. He is married and has three school-aged children. He has been working with CEPRODEL for the past two years and has used the money from two previous loans to improve his home. He requested this loan in order to buy building materials, such as zinc metal sheeting, and to pay for labor to install a new roof, as the old one was in bad shape and leaked during the winter. Luis says that he appreciates the loans he has received through CEPRODEL. He has been able to improve his home and his family is now more secure and lives under better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof in his home

loans.name: Bozor

texts.en:
N. Bozor is a 50-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. 

Bozor has been running the business of raising and selling cattle. He has 27 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Bozor has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. 

Now Bozor wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So he applied for a loan of $2500 USD. Bozor thanks all lenders for their support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Jose” esta representado por la señora Paola y conformado por 10 miembors, D. las cuales 7 son mujeres y 3 son hombres  este grupo se caracteriza porque se conocen bastante y son muy unidos. Pola tiene un hijo y actualmente vive en alquiler tiene un negocio D. venta D. edredones entregando al por mayor en mercados y tiendas su expectativa es crecer poco a poco y ampliar mas su negocio para manutener a su hijo ya que ella es madre y padre para el. El resto del grupo tiene diferentes actividades ya que la mayoría venD. comida, repostería y algunos socios son taxistas, mecánicos y chaperos. La competencia en los negocios es bastante amplia pero ellos siguen adelante ya que cuentan con bastan te experiencia en sus negocios. El crédito actual es para capital D. operaciones, las cuales las socias invierten en compra D. mercadería  o herramientas para sus talleres o insumos para sus puestos D. comida obteniendo así mejores ganancias para el sustento D. sus hogares. El banco tiene bastante experiencia ya que no es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito D. nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The group “San Jose” is represented by la señora Paola and consists of 10 members, of whom 7 are women and 3 are men. The group is notable because the members know each other well and are very unified. Paola has a son and currently rents her dwelling. She sells comforters at wholesale in markets and stores. She expects to grow little by little and expand her business and support her son. She has to be both mother and father to him. The rest of the group has various activities. The majority sell food or pastries; some are taxi drivers, mechanics and do auto body work. The competition in these businesses is stiff, but the members can rely on long experience in their work. This loan is for working capital, which the members will invest in merchandise or tools for their shops or ingredients for their food stands; in this way, they will make more money for household expenses. The bank has substantial experience with this group: this is not the first time they have applied for a loan from our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oscar's Group

texts.en:
Oscar M. is from the village of Bolinao.  He is 60 years old and the leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Oscar M.'s Group.

Oscar is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Oscar owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Oscar has been in business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI to purchase additional products to sell.  Oscar is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Oscar from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. 
-----------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en: Bashiran sells embroidered shawls (a garment for head and shoulders) to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She has been in this business for seven years and is making much progress in her business. She is 38 years old and married. Her husband operates a cloth shop in the cloth market and he also supports their home. She is requesting a loan to purchase embroidered shawls to sell.

loans.use: To purchase embroidered shawls to sell

loans.name: Indalecia

texts.es: Indalecia es una abnegada mujer D. 62 años, vive en su casa propia a lado D. su esposo Leonardo D. 65 años y sus hijos que son mayores e independientes. Hace más D. 5 años se dedica a la venta D. productos energéticos D. una reconocida marca, ofreciendo familiares y amigos. En un inicio empezó con la venta D. jugos, preparando solo por pedido, aunque sigo realizando este trabajo, pero esta vez lo complementa con al venta D. productos Herbalife. DesD. entonces, Indalecia ofrece este producto, manifestando todos los beneficios que tiene así como recomendando al cliente cual es el más adecuado a su necesidad. Para ella disfruta mucho D. este trabajo y D. las ganancias que obtiene lo deriva para su propia manutención, además el sueldo D. su esposo, ayuda con los ahorros futuros y dejarles más adelante como una herencias a sus hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser tan puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, servirá para abastecer D. más productos para venderlos en estas próximas fechas del día D. la madre, pues ella cree que no hay mejor regalo que mejorar la salud.
texts.en:
Indalecia is a selfless woman who is 62 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband Leonardo, 65, and their children who are adult and independent. She has been selling a well-known brand of energy products for more than 5 years to friends and acquaintances. At first she started selling juices, preparing them only to order. Although she continues with this business, she now also sells Herbalife products. Indalecia now offers these products, demonstrating all of the benefits they proviD. and recommending the products most suited to the needs of each customer. She enjoys this work very much. With the earnings she gets from the business she can support herself and, along with the salary of her husband, help to save for the future so that they can leave an inheritance for their children. This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges to be on time with her payments. With the loan she requests she will restock her business with more products, so that she can sell them for the upcoming Mother's Day, because she believes that there is no better gift than one that improves one's health.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: energy products

loans.name: Gull Begam Husin Group

texts.en: A. Manan is the group leader of Gull Begam H. group. He is 54 years old, married, and has six children who are all in school. He wants to take a loan for his vegetable-selling business and his shop. A. Manan is busy working seven days of the week. He dreams of making progress in his business and being successful. He has full familiarity with this business because he worked with his father from childhood. He is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, which are in demand a lot in the market. He is glad that through this process he can improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Oeurn San Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has thirteen people who live in Mkak village in Kandal province. Mrs. Oeurn S. is a village bank president, selected by the other members, who will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Oeurn S. is a driver who owns a car. She transports employees in order to earn some money to support her family. But now she has a problem because she did not have enough money to maintain her car from early month until the end of the month. So to improve this business, Mrs. Oeurn S. is asking for a loan to buy gasoline. She is widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ploughing; purchase of grain and seeds

loans.name: Hanifaan Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan bibi lives in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She doesn’t have any children. She spends her time doing domestic chores and cooking food for her husband. Her husband’s family praises her good nature and caring behavior towards them.  

Her husband's name is S. and he runs a scrap business in the market. He has six years of experience in this business. He has a little stock in his shop which becomes a reason for losing customers day by day. 

Therefore, Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s scrap business.  She is hopeful that her husband will be able to re-establish his business and get back his customers, too.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Olga Virginia

texts.es: Doña Olga Menchú tiene con 26 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Delantales típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Máquinas, habita junto a su  hijo y conjuntamente con su esposo, se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 4 años de laborar  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Tzamatzam, ha tenido éxito en lo que realiza, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con el objetivo de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo, y mejorar su condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Olga Menchú is 26 years old, and she is married. She is a seamstress, and she makes typical aprons for women. She has a shop with two machines. She lives with her son and her husband. They work in the same occupation, and they have two employees. She has worked in her house, which is in the Tzamatzam settlement, for four years. She has had success in what she does. However, her financial situation does not suffice for her to be able to increase her capital. That is the reason she went to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. The loan is to buy raw material in order to be able to increase her sales. She also hopes to be able to get her son ahead and to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials like cement, sand, and gravel to improve her home

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan T. V. was born in 1977 and is married with two children who are going to school. Her husband is a carpenter and she sells shoes in the market where she has a shoe shop.

Since 2007, Loan T. V. has participated in SEDA and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: To expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Ker

texts.es: Ker, de 66 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su hijo mayor de edad y juntos habitan una amplia morada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Este simpático caballero se dedica a la preparación de comida típica de la selva peruana en su restaurante, ubicado en el interior de su vivienda. Dice que aprendió desde muy joven a preparar estos deliciosos potajes de la selva del Perú, ya que ahí fue donde nació, y luego le ha transmitido sus conocimientos culinarios a su hijo, quien le ayuda en la atención del negocio. Recuerda como debió migrar a la ciudad, pues allá en su tierra no le iba muy bien, entonces decidió venir y ahora no se arrepiente, pues aunque extraña su tierra, en el negocio le va muy bien, pues las ganancias son regulares y junto con su hijo esta saliendo adelante. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar más su negocio, para ofrecer mayor cantidad de platillos a sus comensales. Es el cuarto  crédito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Ker tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes que necesita para continuar preparando sus platillos de la selva.
texts.en:
Ker, 66, lives in his own house with his oldest son. They have an ample abode in a crowded neighborhood in the north of the city. This likable gentleman prepares typical dishes from the Peruvian jungle in his restaurant located inside his home. He says he learned how to prepare these delicious dishes from the Peruvian jungle, which is where he was born, while still very young. He has since transmitted his culinary knowledge to his son who helps him tend the business. He recalls how he had to migrate to the city because in his place of origin he wasn’t doing too well. He decided to come to the city and he does not regret it because, although he misses his homeland, he does well with his business because profits are steady and he and his son are getting ahead. Because he’s quite an enterprising man he plans to expand his business later on in order to offer a wider variety of dishes to his diners. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because he’s very grateful to all those how funded the loan that will allow him to continue in business. Ker plans to use the requested funds to buy quantities of the ingredients he needs to continue to prepare his dishes from the jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare his typical stews.

loans.name: Kaem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kaem S. is 47 years old and lives in Tnaot Chum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She also sells tamarind door-to-door. 

She is a widow with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are farmers. Although she tries to work a lot, she can earn very little money to support her family. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Kaem S. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Beth Muthoni

texts.en:
Beth has been selling used clothes in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is 29 years old and married to Joseph Guthonda. They have one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

In the future, Beth is planning to diversify and move into real estate.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Liliette Ines

texts.es: Liliette, tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija, de 4 años de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, generalmente vende los fines de semana y viaja entre semana para comprar mercadería a Managua.  Ella dio inicio con este negocio desde hace 3 años, fue su mama la que le enseño lo relativo al negocio de comercio, ya que ella vendía ropa y comerciaba en el mercado. Ella solicito este crédito con el objetivo de comprar más mercadea, para aprovechar la época de estos últimos meses, desea comprar desde ahorita ya que los precios no han incrementado tanto. Su sueño es llegar a comprar un tramo en el mercado, para vender más. Aduce, el crédito le ayudara a obtener más utilidades y ella confía ganarse los clientes a los cuales les distribuirá sus productos.
texts.en: Liliette is 27 years old, married and has one 4 year-old daughter. She sells general merchandise, which is distributed on an itinerant basis. She usually sells on weekends and travels during the week to buy goods in Managua. She started this business 3 years ago. Her mother taught her regarding the trading business, since she sold clothing and traded in the market. She requests this loan in order to buy more goods to take advantage of this selling season in these last few months. She wants to buy wholesale goods immediately as prices have not increased much. Her dream is to buy a stretch on the market to sell more. She argues that the loan will allow her to obtain more profits as she hopes to win customers who will distribute her products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Clodilte

texts.es:
Clotilde tiene 58 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. Clotilde es divorciada, tiene tres hijos y es profesora.

 Ya son varios años que se dedica a enseñar.  Clotilde desprende una imagen de una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Clotilde espera recibir S/. 2500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea construir su casa y va comprar materiales como por ejemplo, cemento, clavos, puertas, ventanas y muchas cosas más. 

Clotilde pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 58 years old and lives in the town of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is a captivating town dating back to Incan times, built on top of the ancient Incan town. Clotilde is divorced, she is a professor and has three children.

She has been teaching for many years already. Clotilde is the very image of a hard-working and responsible woman. With her next loan of 2500 PEN, Clotilde would like to have her house built, and she will buy materials such as cement, nails, doors, windows and many other items.

Clotilde is a member of the Mosoc Killa Communal Bank, and she is thankful for the opportunity she is being given through this loan; at the same time she commits to complying with her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, nails, doors and windows.

loans.name: Banungi Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean-Pierre is the leader of the Community Bank named “Banungi Plus”, which consists of 16 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Jean-Pierre sells pairs of shoes, slippers, etc. for women at the market located east of Kinshasa. He started his business in 2009. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. He has already received six MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. The loans he has received have helped him support his family.   He makes $80 profit each week. 

Jean-Pierre intends with the next loan to purchase more pairs of shoes needed by his customers and generate additional profits. His ambition is to someday open a shoe shop in his area. He is 52 years old, married, and is the father of six children whose ages vary between 8 and 16. Three of them attend school. He also takes care of his nephew.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mirasol owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, convenience foods, canned goods and instant noodles in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Mirasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages and convenience foods. This loan will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, such as beverages and convenience foods

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca.

His name is Anselmo C.  P. and he is 57 years old.  Anselmo is married and has three children.  He is dedicated to the sale of clothes and also works as a tailor.  He is planning to invest his loan in his tailoring and clothes sale businesses.  He also works as an regional advisor to Pisac in the area of cleaning.

loans.use: To invest in a clothing and tailoring business

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan P., 31, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a tailor, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a member of the military, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 55 on other necessary expenses. Phan is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more fabrics to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to expand the business

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai S. is a villager who lives in Tuol Krang village in Kandal province. She is 30 years old, and a mother of two children: one attends a local school and the other is four years old and not in school yet.
Mrs. Thai S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice for a living. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also works as a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Tort Sokly (pictured with her), is a recycling seller, from which he earns a small income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for cultivating rice

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee G. is from the village of San Vicente,  Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old. Haidee is single. To make a living, Haidee owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, "pancit" (a noodle dish), shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Haidee has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Haidee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haidee has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional products to sell. Haidee is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Haidee from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Las Guadalupes De San Jose Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Las Guadalupes D. San José” denominado así porque todas las mujeres que lo integran son muy devotas D. L. virgen D. Guadalupe y porque todas pertenecen a L. población D. San José del Progreso. San José del Progreso llamado así en honor al padre D. Jesucristo, posteriormente se le añadió el apellido D. “Progreso” en virtud D. que en épocas pasadas existió un gran auge económico en el municipio a causa D. los excedentes agrícolas que eran extraídos en L. región. Esta población está situada en el Municipio D. VilL. D. Tututepec D. Melchor Ocampo (en el Estado D. Oaxaca). Las principales actividades económicas D. esta población son L. Agricultura y Ganaderia. Este  es el primer grupo que L. Fundacion forma en esta localidad y esta conformado por 11 mujeres con diferentes actividades economicas.
L. representante D. este grupo es L. señora EsteL. E. M. D. 32 años D. edad, estudio hasta L. preparatoria, quien vive en unión libre con el señor Gerardo Sanabia M. quien es operador D. escavadoras ambos tienen 4 hijos: Tania D. 13 años, EsteL. D. 10 años, Gerardo D. 8 años y Luis D. 3 años, Tania estudia L. Secundaria, EsteL. y Gerardo L. Primaria. L. Señora EsteL. solicito el préstamo para L. compra D. calzado y compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales; ya que elL. se dedica en L. mañana a L. venta D. calzado por catalogos y en L. tarD. a L. venta D. tamales. EsteL. dice que le ah ido muy bien en sus negocios ya que tiene varios clientes, para vender sus productos los ofrece D. casa en casa.
L. señora Paulina Gazga López es integrante del grupo elL. tiene 59 años vive en unión libre con el señor Sebastian H. Zaguilan  D. oficio campesino ambos tienen 9 hijos  todos ya están casados solo tienen a una nieta a su cargo, Paulina es campesina se dedica a L. cosecha D. limones, papayas, chicozapote, maíz, frijol, entre otros, elL. comenta que L. cosecha que mas se venD. es el limón ya que en población existe una fabrica que procesa estos productos para hacer diferentes derivados es por lo cual elL. tiene ventas todo el año ya que su cosecha se los venD. a los dueños D. L. fabrica. ElL. solicito el préstamo para comprar liquido para fumigar sus tierras D. igual manera para comprar agua para el riego D. sus cosechas, es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que elL. y su esposo cosechan diferentes productos para venderlos, elL. sueña con engrandecer mas sus cosechas y que D. igual manera todas sus cosechas estén libres D. plagas ya que esta actividad es el sustento D. su familia. D. las ganancias que obtiene D. su negocio es para mantener a su familia y sobre todo a su nieta quien quedo a su cargo desD. que era una recién nacida.
ElL. esta contenta por pertenecer a L. Fundacion y que le hayan otorgado el préstamo  y agradece L. confianza que han depositado en ellas.
Las mujeres que integran este grupo son las siguientes: 
Paulina G. L.: D. 59 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. semillas y venta D. frutas.
Emiliana M. M.: D. 56 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. ropa para L. venta.
Maria Cleofas C. X: D. 58 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. pescados y mariscos para L. venta. 
Elva P. R.: D. 60 años D. edad se dedica a al compra D. insumos para L. venta D. antojitos, tamales y tacos.
Jesus H. H.: D. 46 años D. edad se dedica a al compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales.
EsteL. E. M.: D. 32 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. calzado y compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales.
Cristina C. H.: D. 61 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. antojitos.
Florinda H. D. L. R.: D. 73 años D. edad se dedica  a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. D. tortillas y antojitos. 
Gumercinda C. C.: D. 37 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales y antojitos.
Maria Remedios C. C.: D. 28 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. antojitos.
Clemencia C. A.: D. 22 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales y compra D. pescado y limón para L. venta.
texts.en:
The Las Guadalupes D. San José group is named this way because all of the women who make up the group are very devoted to the Virgin of Guadalupe.  Also, they all live in San José del Progreso.  San José del Progresso is named in honor of the father of Jesus Christ.  The name Progreso was added later because in the past there existed a great period of economic growth in the municipality because of the abundant agricultural production in the region. 

This town is in the VilL. D. Tutuepec D. Melchor Ocampo municipality (in the state of Oaxaca).  The town’s principal economic activities are farming and raising livestock.  This is the first group that the Fundación formed in this area.  It is comprised of 11 women with different business activities.

EsteL. E. M., age 32, is the representative of the group.  She attended school until high school.  She is in a common-law marriage with Gerardo Sanabia M., an excavations operator.  They have four children.  Tania is 13, EsteL. is 10, Gerardo is 8, and Luis is 3.  Tania attends high school, and EsteL. and Gerardo are in elementary school.

EsteL. requested the loan to buy footwear and to buy supplies to make and sell tamales.  In the morning she works selling shoes by catalogs.  In the afternoon she sells tamales.  EsteL. says that her businesses have gone very well for her.  She has various customers.  She sells her products door to door.

Paulina Gazga López is a member of the group.  She is 59 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Sebastian H. Zaguilan, a farmer.  They have nine children; all of them are married.  They only have one granddaughter under their care.  

Paulina is a farmer, and she grows lemons, papayas, “chio zapote” (an exotic tropical fruit), corn, and beans, among others.  She says that she sells lemons the most because there is a factory in the area that processes these products to make different lemon derivatives.  That is why she has sales all year round; she sells her harvest to the factory owners. She requested the loan to buy liquid to fumigate her land and to buy water to irrigate her crops.  

She is a very hard-working woman.  She and her husband grow different crops to sell.  She dreams of increasing her crops and that her crops are free from pests because this business activity feeds her family.  The earnings from her business are to support her family, especially her granddaughter.  Her granddaughter has been under her care since she was a newborn. 

She is happy to belong to the Fundación and that they have granted the loan.  She is grateful for the trust that they have shown in the members.

The following are the women who make up this group:

Paulina G. L., age 59, buys seeds and sells fruit

Emiliana M. M., age 56, buys clothing to sell 

Maria Cleofas C. X, age 58, buys fish and seafood to sell 

Elva P. R., age 60 buys supplies to sell snacks, tamales, and tacos

Jesus H. H., age 46, buys supplies to make and sell tamales 

EsteL. E. M., age 32, buys footwear and supplies to make and sell tamales 

Cristina C. H., age 61, buy supplies to make and sell snacks 

Florinda H. D. L. R., age 73, buys supplies to make and sell tortillas and snacks 

Gumercinda C. C., age 37, buy supplies to make and sell tamales and snacks

Maria Remedios C. C., age 28, buy supplies to make and sell snacks 

Clemencia C. A., age 22, buys supplies to make and sell tamales - also buy seafood and lemon to sell

loans.use: To buy footwear and supplies to make and sell tamales

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Monsefú, una zona comercial y turística conocida como capital de las Flores que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 3 años, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a su esposo  en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Carmen desea adquirir más productos y así ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido. Para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 29, is married and lives with her husband and their two children in the Monsefú district, a commercial and tourist area known as the capital of Las Flores in Lambayeque Province, forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 3 years, she has been engaged in the catalog sales of cosmetics. She sells these products to her neighbors and friends. Every day, she strives to gain more customers since the more orders the business obtains the greater her income. The business helps her to meet her personal expenses and support her husband in sustaining the family economy.

Carmen wishes to acquire more cosmetic products and, thus, enlarge her business by installing a cosmetics shop in her home. This will allow her customers to have products at hand, and they will not have to wait until the end of the month for their orders to arrive. This is why she needs to acquire more products, and, in order to achieve her objective, she decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles.

loans.use: to acquire more products so that she can enlarge her business by selling them out of her home.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
Desde hace 11 años, José Luis E. A. ha venido desarrollando diferentes fórmulas de cremas y aceites a base de hierbas naturales, con el paso del tiempo ha mejorado no sólo sus fórmulas sino también la presentación de producto, pues espera en el futuro ser una marca reconocida en el mercado. 

Actualmente, Luis necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos insumos, empaques y etiquetas con el fin de realizar el trámite del registro sanitario, necesario para comercializar sus productos.
texts.en:
For the last 11 years, José Luis E. A. has been developing different formulas for creams and oils based on natural herbs.  As time’s gone by he’s improved not only his formulas but also the presentation of his products; he hopes to become a well-known market brand in the future.

Luis needs a loan to buy some ingredients, containers and labels in order to process his health permits which are needed in order to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, containers and labels.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, forty, is married with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.

Janet has been dealing in produce for twenty years. She started with 200,000 UGX and now has three million UGX. She is requesting a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell. Her problem is high employee turnover.

In the future she intends to set up her own food store.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: 0410015- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
"Cảnh N. Thị (139) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Cảnh is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 0410015- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường (0410015- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường).


Cảnh is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Cảnh operates a family member's business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Cảnh has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Cảnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Cảnh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Cảnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. thị Chuông (29) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  Lê Thị Thuỷ (34) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  P. thị Liên (138) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


4.  N. Thị Nghĩa (115) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


5.  T. Thị Hoa (117) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


6.  Lê Thị Hạnh (62) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Cảnh N. Thị (139) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Cảnh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0410015- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường (0410015- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Cảnh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Cảnh kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2007, Cảnh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Cảnh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. thị Chuông (29) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  Lê Thị Thuỷ (34) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  P. thị Liên (138) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  N. Thị Nghĩa (115) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  T. Thị Hoa (117) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  Lê Thị Hạnh (62) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
