Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 11 years. He is 36 years old and married to Jane. They have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET  Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and plough the land before planting.

In the future, Jonah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Eliu

texts.es: Eliu, de 51años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nancy de 45 años y su querida hija menor Lila de 17 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Gracias al trabajo de Eliu las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa están más seguras, su labor como Vigilante ha hecho que sea una persona muy querida por los vecinos, ya que conocen los peligros a los que está expuesto por las noches y el valor que tiene para afrontarlas. Aunque le va muy bien en este trabajo, el sueldo que percibe no le alcanza para brindarle a su familia una vida digna, es por eso que ha decidido poner una tienda de abarrotes, la cual administrará su esposa y espera que con este nuevo ingreso, las cosas en su hogar mejoren. Se siente muy feliz en su trabajo, ya que le es muy gratificante saber que gracias a su labor, las personas pueden dormir tranquilas. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer toda la noche muy al tanto de las cosas que suceden en esta ciudad. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, planea comprar productos para surtir su tienda, ya que desea mejorar su stock.
texts.en:
Eliu, 51, is a very gracious, hard working man living in his own house with his wife, Nancy, 45, and their beloved youngest daughter, Lila, 17, for whom he wants to provide a better future.

Thanks to Eliu’s work the streets of the city of Pucallpa are safer.  His work as a Watchman has made him very well-liked by the neighbors who are aware of the perils he’s exposed to during the night and of his courage in facing them.  Although he does very well in this job the salary he earns isn’t sufficient to provide his family with a proper life.  Because of this, he’s decided to open a grocery store that his wife will run and he hopes that this new income will improve things at home.  He feels very happy at work because it’s gratifying to know that thanks to his work people can sleep peacefully.  He’s been in this occupation for three years and considers the most difficult part having to spend all night being very watchful of everything that goes on in the city.

This is his fifth loan with MFP.  He knows that he must make his payments on time and is willing to do so because he wants to access future loans.   He will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy merchandise to stock his store because he wants to improve his stock inventory.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with two children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Lydia raises and breeds livestock, specifically goats and cows. She has been doing this just this year. She has requested a loan to purchase a cow for breeding.

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for breeding

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has two children.

Rahman opened a poultry store in 2009. He has a long experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a  chicken-cleaning machine and to renovate his store. He is aiming to earn more profits to help improve his living situation.

loans.use: To buy a  chicken-cleaning machine and to renovate his store.

loans.name: Eminaga

texts.en:
Eminaga is 55 years old and married with three children. He sells mobile phones and accessories.
For the past 10 years, Eminaga has supported his family through his efforts. Through the years, he has tried various types of activities and finally, four years ago, he started his business selling cellphones. He believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family.

He is very polite and the items he sells are always good quality. Currently, his business is doing well, but Eminaga needs to increase his stock of goods in order to serve the demands of his clientele. With this purpose in mind, Eminaga has requested 1,000 AZN. He is grateful to all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase new types of mobile phones

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 23-year-old farmer. She is married to John who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children. She has been in farming with an income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family needs.
 
She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope is to purchase a piece of land and construct rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Claudia Cordelia

texts.es: Claudia Cordelia se dedica a una actividad a un cafetín. Tiene 18 años de tener este negocio. Claudia inicio cuando fue despedida de su trabajo y empezó a vender solo fresco fue poco a poco que logro crecer con su actividad, Aduce la señora que ha logrado progresar aun más, ya que siempre ha invertido los créditos para lo que solicita. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pan, golosinas, refrescos, café, leche entre otros. Su sueño ahora es condicionar el local y hacerlo más grande.
texts.en: Claudia Cordelia has been running a coffee shop for 18 years.  She began her business when she was laid off from her job and started selling only refreshments.  Little by little she was able to expand and feels this was largely due to the loans she invested in it.  The loan she is requesting now is to buy bread, sweets, softdrinks, coffee and milk, among other items.  He dream is to make improvements in the location and make it larger.

loans.use: To buy bread, sweets, softdrinks, coffee, and milk among other items.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is married with three children. Marlyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marlyn is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan for 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase one chainsaw. 

Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve the general living standards of her family from the income of her business.

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad, casada con Andrés de 43 años con quien tiene 1 hijo. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari.Desde hace varios años atrás, Ana viene dedicándose al negocio de venta de abarrotes en general.  Fue simplemente porque en su barrio no existía una tienda así, y sin pensarlo dos veces lo puso en marcha. Desde luego que viene obteniendo buenas ganancias económicas con respecto a los años anteriores. Generalmente su horario de mayor venta es a partir de las 5:00 de la mañana hasta las 8: 00 de la mañana, ya que recibe una cantidad considerable de clientes, en donde sus hijos los facilita en atender a sus clientes de manera rápida. Normalmente los producto que Ella expende, son de primera necesidad para el hogar, es por ello que se siente contenta y satisfecha por lo que viene realizando; su punto de venta lo realiza en el primer piso de su propia casa, a un precio módico. Sus planes a futuro es la de incrementar mas productos y surtirlas con la finalidad de obtener mejores ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete una vez más en realizar puntualmente  el pago de sus cuotas.Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea incrementar más productos.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete una vez más en realizar puntualmente  el pago de sus cuotas.Ana es tan responsable en su banco comunal tal igual que sus compañeros de su banco comunal.Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea comprar más productos para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Ana, 39, is married to Andres, 43, and they have one child.  They live in their own home located in the Pichari district.  For a number of years, Ana has been selling groceries.  In her neighborhood there was no grocery store, so without thinking about it twice she decided to start up her own store.  Ever since, she has been getting better earnings each year.  Usually her best selling hours are from 5am until 8am, since during this time she receives a large quantity of customers; during these hours her children help her to attend to her customers quickly.  Normally the products that she sells are staples for the home, and because of this she feels content and satisfied with the work that she is doing.  She makes her sales from the first floor of her own house, at a reasonable price.  In the future, she plans to stock her store with a greater number of products with the goal of increasing her income, so that she can provide for her family's well-being.  This is her second loan with MFP, and so she is committed once again to making all of her payments on time.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles, she wants to buy more products for her store.  Ana is very responsible in her communal bank, as well as with the members of her bank.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested she wants to buy more products for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en:
The Mekar Sandat group is a group of village women who all have piggeries. They have joined this group to get funding and training from MUK. 

Ni Made is married with one child still in elementary school. She is using part of the loan to buy four pigs that will be fattened for five months. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy pig feed. 

Ni Made wants to spend 5,000 rupees on her kitchen and 100,000 rupees to pay for electricity and water. Although her business is still small, Ni Made hopes it can support her children's education by paying for books and other school supplies in addition to kitchen tools.

loans.use: to buy four pigs

loans.name: Mandiri 2 Group

texts.en:
Rini is 33 years old and married with two children. She is pictured on the far left of the photo. She has been selling clothes from her house and going door to door for the past five years. She is using the loan to increase her inventory and hopefully expand her business to generate enough income to someday open a clothing store in front of her house. 

As her education was only through high school, it is important to her that her children stay in school, and her income helps pay for school fees. She hopes that this loan will improve the well-being of her family. 

Some of the other group members will use their loans for selling snacks and a special Indonesian rice dish (nasi uduk).

loans.use: to pay for more clothes to resell to customers on credit

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: La señora María Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de gorditas de harina y de maíz, lo cual fue un beneficio para ella porque su casa se ubica en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad lo cual su negocio le ha estado funcionado desde que ella comenzó. Para María su mayor prioridad es arreglar su casa y seguir construyendo en la parte alta de su casa para que el negocio este en planta baja por que algunas veces se llena y la gente queda en pie comiendo. Lo cual quiere brindar a su clientela un mejor Servicio y de igual manera a su familia mayor comodidad por que en el crecimiento del negocio, se esta reduciendo el espacio de su vivienda. Para poder seguir con su proyecto necita comprar arena, varillas, cemento y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is a very hardworking woman. For 9 years she has sold flour and corn gorditas [like a thick tortilla, or pita]. Her house is located on a very busy street in the city so her business has been successful from the start. Maria's top priority is fixing her house and completing the second floor so that the business can be on the first floor - sometimes it gets very busy and people have to eat while standing. She wants to give her customers better service and at the same time give her family greater comfort - as the business grows, their living space is getting smaller. In order to complete her project she will need to buy sand, rebar and cement and hire laborers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais dois ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 2ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ningem. 

É criadora de frangos dedica-se ao agro-negocio ha mais de 1 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em grupo na Helvetas de Moçambique,no montante de 2.000.00mt, para investir no negocio e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu décimo TERCEIRO emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende aplicar no seu agro-negocio para aumentar o nível de productividade. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 1.500.00mt, 2.000.00mt, 3.000.00mt, 4.610.00mt, 5.501.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 8.365.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 12.254.00mt, 19.733.00mt, e 23.058.00mt, para a mesma actividade.

No futuro sonha em iniciar o seu proprio negocio, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, two of which still attend school. She completed second grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and she doesn't support anyone else.
She raises poultry. She has been in the agricultural business for over one year and earns an income of about 3.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had group loans with Helvetas in Mozambique, in the amount of 2.000mt. She used it to invest in her business and she was able to pay it back without difficulties.
She first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her 13th loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use for her agricultural business in order to increase the level of productivity. The first loans were for 1.500mt, 2.000mt, 3.000mt, 4.610mt, 5.501mt, 6.000mt, 6.000mt, 8.365mt, 12.000mt, 12.254mt, 19.733mt and 23.058mt, for the same purpose.
In the future she dreams of starting her own business. She will request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and to prepare the land for producing vegetables.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 53 years old and married to Harrison. Together they have six children, aged 30, 28, 26, 22 and 18 years old. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 13 years. She gets a monthly income of 84,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the farming businesses.

This is her third loan term with KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase a chaff cutter for help in feeding her dairy cattle.

With the anticipated profit, she will purchase a piece of land to expand her mixed farming. Her dream is to add more dairy cattle on her farm and raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 47 years old and is married with three adult children. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past four years, Norma has owned and operated a business where she makes and sells a variety of baked goods in the local community. She earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month and has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. 

Norma is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to invest in the expansion of her business by purchasing the raw ingredients she needs to prepare her baked goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Crisosta

texts.es:
Crisosta tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Crisosta nació en la ciudad de Acomayo y  ahora radica en la ciudad del Cusco. En la ciudad del Cusco Crisosta desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas.   

Crisosta se dedica a la venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurante donde sirve desayuno, almuerzo y cena pero el local es alquilado. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
Crisosta pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Crisosta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Crisosta, 45, is married and has three children.  Crisosta was born in the city of Acomayo and now lives in Cusco. It is in Cusco that she carries out her work and daily activities.

Crisosta has a restaurant, where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner, but she rents the site.  She has been running the place for a year now, and everything is going well, thanks to the care she devotes to her work.
  
Crisosta is a member of the “Ñahupacman Purisun” community bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association of Cusco.  At the moment, she needs a loan to buy ingredients, such as sacks of rice and sugar.

Crisosta is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as sacks of rice and sugar, for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bahati Shg Group

texts.en:
Byron is the facilitator of the Bahati SHG group. Byron and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Byron takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Byron had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Byron was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Byron and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Byron will educate his children and use the rest of the cash for domestic use.

In 2012, the members of Bahati SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Byron is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juana De Dios

texts.es:
Juana, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ganado, esta labor inicia muy temprano, para iniciar con la comida del ganado, y así sucesivamente realiza las labores todos los días, este negocio y ocupación nace por la necesidad de querer tener una fuente de ingreso desde su hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de comida para cerdo y ganado, ya que quiere disponer de varia cantidad para alimentar los animales por más tiempo, su aspiración es mejorar cada día, crecer con el ganado y poder comercializar a buen precio dichos animales.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her husband and two children.  She raises pigs and cattle.  She starts her work very early beginning with feeding the cattle.  She does this work successively every day.  The business and the occupation arose from the need she had to have a source of income for her household.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed for pigs and cattle because she wants to have a good amount on hand for a long time.  Her goal is to improve every day, to grow with the cattle to be able to sell them for good prices.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more bananas and ingredients for her food vending.

Felixberta has been in this business for 13 years, and also earns additional income from a variety store.

In the future, Felixberta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and ingredients for her food vending.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia, who is a 41-year-old woman, is a mother of two sons. Her husband has had an internet cafe for four years with low income, so he decided to expand his cafe by purchasing more computers to be used by his customers. This way, he will increase the number of customers and so increase his income. However, the amount of money he has isn't enough to buy the computers, so his wife Alia decided to help and get a loan from FATEN for $1,500. When Alia gets the loan, she will enable her husband to expand the internet cafe which is the only source of income for the family to purchase additional computers. This will increase the number of customers who will come and use these computers and so his income will increase positively to provide better living conditions for his family. Alia is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed in the internet cafe.

loans.use: To purchase a number of computers for her husband's internet cafe.

loans.name: Alfonce

texts.en:
Alfonce is 60 years old and married, with seven children whose ages range from 15 years to 30 years old. He describes himself as focused. 

Alfonce operates a retail open air business where he sells posts. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in his village area and his primary customers are repeat and new. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from customers. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more posts. His business goal is to expand his post selling business within five years.

loans.use: To buy more posts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Dinah, 28 years old, is a quiet and hardworking woman. She has a 7-year-old son and a 9-year-old daughter who both attend school. Dinah makes a living working for a daily wage raising young animals. This loan will be invested to purchase pigs. Dinah aspires to continue raising her pigs in order to sell them and then to use the profits to cover educational and other expenses for her children. She and the group members thank Kiva lenders as well as UGAFODE for the financial services advanced to them, and they look forward to many more.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida  owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, eggs, assorted canned goods, firewood and toiletries. She is married and has three children, whom two are still attending school. Her husband has an income that could able to defray the family's expenses.


She is asking for a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store such as beverages, soft drinks and assorted goods. This will enable her to do bulk purchases to fill those  that were missing in her inventory. 
Thus, slowly her income will improve and she will be able to provide her children with healthy food. 

With her previous loan, Zenaida was able to repaid it back successfully, and now she is requesting a new loan to continue expand her business to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store such as beverages, soft drinks and assorted good

loans.name: Suitupe

texts.en:
Suitupe is married with four children.

She lives in the village of Sataoa which is located on the south coast of Upolu by a mangrove conservation area.

Her plantation grows taro, tamu, bananas and vegetables which she sells two times a week at the market in Apia.

She is pictured here at the weekly repayment meeting in the village

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser, weed killer and farming equipment

loans.name: Fanny  Yaniret

texts.en:
My name is Fanny Yaniret. I run a used clothing business located in the center of my community called La Favorita (The Favorite). It generates income to help me cover family expenses and improve our quality of life. Currently demand is increasing, seeing that the cost of new clothes is higher and the majority of people opt to buy used clothes. I need to add more supplies to my business so I can offer a wider variety and better prices to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

Mi nombre es Fanny Yaniret, soy comerciante cuento con negocio de venta de ropa usada, llamado La Favorita, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de esa forma mejorar nuestro nivel de vida. actualmente la demanda a crecido en vista que el costo de la ropa nueva es mayor la mayoria de las personas optan por comprar ropa usada, actualmente necesito sutir mas mi negocio y asi ofrecer mayor varedad y mejores precios a mis cliente.

loans.use: Buy a load of mixed clothing (pants, children's clothes, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood and corn.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mr. Um B. is a widower and a father of 4 school-aged children. He is 42 years old and lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To support his entire family, Mr. B. works as a landlord, building different rooms and renting them to the people in his community, where he can typically earn up to $10 each day. His expenditures are mostly  for his children’s school fee and health care. Eventually, B. hopes a loan will help him to build more  rooms to meet his clients' needs as well as maximizing his family’s savings.

loans.use: To build more different rooms to meet his clients' need.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives by herself with her two small children. She is not married, and she supports both children by herself. She currently has a papelería (stationery store) and a centro de comunicaciónes (cyber cafe). This is the first loan she is soliciting from Kiva through Esperanza.

Julia plans to sell the papelería, where she sells basic notebooks, pencils, school supplies, etc., and concentrate on the cyber cafe (centro de comunicaciónes). In the communication center, Julia has set up five calling booths for people to make international calls, an open space where she plans to put the computer terminals, and she also sells cell phones and calling cards for both Orange and Claro, the two main telecommunications companies here. Her long term goals are to open up three franchises of her communication centers.

Challenges she faces/overcomes: Julia says it is extremely hard to be a woman and own a technology-oriented business. When men come into her store and see that she is activating new cell phones, or fixing network connection problems, they don’t treat her as respectfully as they would a man, and they often challenge the quality of her work. In spite of these challenges she likes her job and finds the challenge stimulating. She has been successful with these two businesses for several years and is excited to take her business to the next level with this loan.

loans.use: To add on computers and internet access so that people in the local community have a chat room (centro de chateo)

loans.name: Elizabeth Gladys

texts.es:
Elizabeth, from the time she was a very young girl dreamed of working sowing crops on her mother's land and spreading the word of God. That dream is now realized and thanks to her hard work and dedication she can enjoy her crops without neglecting the duty that she chose. She has so far been able to increase the amount of her crops, but now launched a new project that is very difficult to do without your help - to open a shop in her home to cover her home's expenses so that so that she can preach God's word to highly populated areas nearby. Her purpose is so that her beloved family can sustain their expenses while she is gone. To this end it has been suggested that she sow more seeds, and bring better products to the local market at a very good price. Help a struggling woman continue sowing her products and the word of God, and help her have a store which will enable her to continue helping others.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, desde muy niña soñó con trabajar sembrando en las tierras de su madre y llevando la palabra de Dios, sueño que ahora se consolidó y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación puede disfrutar de sus cosechas sin descuidar el deber que decidió escoger. Ella hasta ahora ha podido incrementar la cantidad de sus cosechas, pero ahora se suscitó un nuevo proyecto que es muy difícil de realizar sin vuestra ayuda, el aperturar una tienda en su casa para solventar los gastos de su hogar, para que ella pueda marcharse a predicar la palabra de Dios a poblados muy lejanos.Su propósito es dejarla muy bien surtida para que su querida familia pueda sustentar sus gastos mientras ella se encuentra ausente. Y para este fin se ha propuesto esta temporada sembrar más productos con mejores semillas a fin de comercializarlos a muy buen precio en el mercado local para concretar su sueño. Apoyemos a una mujer que lucha para seguir sembrando sus productos y la palabra de Dios y tener esa tienda que le ayudará a ayudar

loans.use: To buy seeds to improve the planting and harvesting of her small plot of farm land. (Compra de semillas para mejorar la siembra y cosecha de su pequeña parcela de cultivo.)

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: I am married and a mother of two daughters. My daughters are small and do not attend school at the present. I would like to see my children attend and finish school so that they have a bright future. I operate a bangles business and my husband runs a general store. He sells all types of daily items including pulses, candies, soft drinks and milk etc. We need a loan for our store to expand its range of stock and therefore to increase our income. Please lend us $750 for this purpose.

loans.use: Expand general store

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed K. is 38 years old and married with five children. He sells clothes in Makeni town and has been doing the same business for many years on a very small scale.

However with his previous loans from SMT, he increased his stock and income. Mohamed is happy with the loan scheme and is planning to continue with the program until he builds enough capital to diversify his business. The business is his only source of income and he would like a loan of $700 for its expansion.

loans.use: Mr. Kamara would like to continue to increase his business capital by slowly expanding his business

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Malika M., 38, lives in Tursun-Zoda, Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. Malika is a cattle farmer. She plans to use this loan to purchase young bulls to be raised and then profitably resold in the summer. Malika plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мадрахимова Малика, проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возрат 38 лет , замужем имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее , специальности не имеет. Планирует получить кредит для приобретения бычков. После чего бычки будут откармливаться и продаваться дороже , летом. Этот вид деятельности поможет ее семье, и развитию фермерской деятельности данной местности. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Paulette, 46 years old and married, has been a member of the Grand Yoff Diabir village bank in Ziguinchor for the last six and a half years. She is a good customer who honors her commitments. Paulette buys flour, sugar, monkey’s bread (baobab fruit), and other ingredients to make cookies and ice cream which she sells. This income allows her to provide for the needs of her family and to improve her business methods. She is seeking a 14th loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single repayment.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulette, 46 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Grand Yoff Diabir à Ziguinchor depuis six ans et demie.Elle est une bonne cliente qui respecte ses engagements.Paulette achète de la farine, du sucre, du pain de singe (fruit du baobab) et autres ingrédients pour faire des biscuits et des crèmes glacées qu'elle vend.Ces revenus lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'améliorer les moyens utilisés pour son activité.Elle sollicite un 14ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make cookies and ice cream

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 30 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 9 months and 7 years. Amina owns a small retail shop, which she started in 2001. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Elba Aurelia

texts.en:
Elba Aurelia is thirty-six years old, and she and her husband have two daughters and two sons, all in school. Elba is an experienced entrepreneur. She's been selling clothes since she was a teenager. Currently, she owns and operates a small shop which she started a couple of years ago in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal.

Elba sells silver jewelry, jeans, blouses, perfumes, beauty suplies, and the like. The entrepreneur explains that she also keeps some stock at home, and people go there to buy when the store is closed.

Elba Aurelia will use her loan to remodel the store and diversify her stock. The entrepreneur hopes that her business will allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, jeans, and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Erkinboy

texts.en: Erkinboy K. is 42 years old, married and has six children. He began working with MicroInvest earlier this year, and has shown himself to be a reliable and hard-working client who knows how to use his loans. Mr. K. and his brother raise livestock and are known locally for having a good flock of rams and one milk cow. In order to raise more livestock, Mr. K. wants to buy a pedigreed bull, and has applied to Kiva for a loan to make this possible. He will repay the loan in six months, and is committed to grow the size of his herd.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mr. Phalla P., 52, and his wife, Mrs. Viti Chhorn, 48, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have five children, one son and four daughters. Two of their children have full time employment. One daughter is a Khmer traditional dancer. One daughter is married, and the youngest one is in school.

Mr. Phalla has been a mason since 1983. He does his work in the village and a near by province, while his wife stay at home take care of the children. The couple is repairing their house and Phalla is requesting a loan of $1000 to finish the project.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru:
Sirojiddin H. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 34 years old, is married, and has four children. For the past eight years, he has worked in the service industry. He has a car wash. He plans to take out a loan to buy hoses and vacuum cleaners. This is necessary to improve the quality this service. He plans to pay off the loan in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Хайдаров Сироджиддин житель города Яван .Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже восемь лет как он работает в сфере услуг. Имеет мойку . Планирует получить кредит для приобретения шлангов , пылесосов. Это необходима для улучшения качества обслуживания. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary supplies

loans.name: Livestock And Making Clothes Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Nội, sinh năm 1970 (Ms 17090059 ). Cô Nội làm nghề bán hàng ăn sang(bán xôi, bánh mì, bún, phở). Ngoài công việc quên thuộc và đều đặn vào mỗi buổi sang, cô còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà và làm nông nghiệp. Chồng cô hàng ngày cũng phụ giúp cô làm các công việc đó. Vợ chồng cô có hai con đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập của gia đình cô khá ổn định, khoảng 200.000 vnđ / ngày. Cô tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh Minh với mức vay: 5.300.000 vnđ  để đầu tư hàng bán và mua thức ăn cho gia súc. Trong nhóm cô còn có:
Nguyễn Thị Lý, sinh năm 1973(Ms 17090055), mức vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để mua vải làm may tại nhà. Ngoài nghề thợ may, chị còn tăng gia sản xuất. Thu nhập bình quân khoảng 150.000 vnđ/ ngày.
Lê Thị Phượng, sinh năm 1970 (Ms 17090056 ), mức vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Chồng chị là công nhân có thu nhập ổn định, hai con chị còn nhỏ. Thu nhập binh quân của gia đình chị khoảng 100.000 vnđ/ tháng.
Nguyễn Thị Mai, sinh năm 1953 (Ms 17090055 ), mức vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư vốn đi chợ buôn bán hoa. Chồng chị đã mất, con trai chị làm thợ mộc thu nhập bình quân khoảng 150.000 vnđ / tháng.
Nguyễn Thị Quang, sinh năm 1957 (Ms 17090058 ), mức vay: 5.300.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Hai vợ chồng chị thu nhập khoảng 100.000 vnđ / ngày. Chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm, bản thân chị bán hàng giải khát, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noi Thi N. was born in 1970. She sells breakfast foods (sticky rice, sandwiches, noodles, beef noodle soup). Besides the familiar and routine work she does every morning, she also raises pigs, chicken, and farms. Her husband also helps her everyday with those jobs. The couple has two children who are school age. Their average family income is relatively stable, about 200,000 VND per day. She joined the Binh Minh fund with the initial amount of 5,300,000 VND to invest in her breakfast business and to buy feed for her animals. Her group also includes:

Ly Thi N., born in 1973, borrowing 4,876,000 VND to buy fabric for a clothing business at home. Besides her seamstress work, she also raises livestock. Her average daily income is 150,000 per day.

Mrs. Phuong Thi Le, born in 1970, is borrowing 4,786,000 VND to invest in livestock. Her husband is a factory worker with a stable income, and her two children are still small. The family's average income is 100,000 VND per month.

Mrs. Mai Thi N., born in 1953, is borrowing 4,876,000 VND to invest in retail sales of flowers. Her husband is deceased, and her son works as a wood carver with an income of 150,000 VND per month.

Mrs. Quang Thi N., born 1957, is borrowing 5,300,000 VND to invest in raising pigs and chicken. She and her husband bring in about 100,000 VND per day. Her husband works as a scooter taxi driver, she sells beverages and refreshments, and her two young children attend school.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock, fabric

loans.name: Ndeh

texts.en:
Ndeh P. is married and has six children. Since childhood, P. has been a very hard working man. The death of his two brothers made him to strain himself too much, because he was to continue the education of their children. He tried borrowing money from other financial institutions, but had problems of repaying due to high interest rates. 

With this burden on him, he went to GHAPE, where he could borrow money to invest and care for the children's education and needs. Motivated by his ambitions as a farmer, he joined GHAPE in order to borrow money and also benefit from their numerous trainings on techniques of loan usage and management. He has taken loans seven times and repaid without any problems. 

With the profit from this loan he will be able to maintain himself and the family. He will use this loan to buy farm supplies, including piglets, chicks, seedlings, and a water pump. He plans to repay the loan in 24 months, with the first repayment four months after disbursement.

loans.use: Buy farm supplies

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina P. D. B. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. She is married with four adult children. Dina has a grocery store in her house, where she works daily with the help of her daughter.

With her loan of 2000 soles she will invest into her grocery store by purchasing items such as soda, sugar, bread, oil and cookies. She is currently saving to travel.

loans.use: With her loan of 2000 soles she will invest into her grocery store by purchasing items such as soda, sugar, bread, oil and cookies

loans.name: Bahrillo

texts.en:
Bahrillo N. is a 44 year old man and loving father of three adorable children, one daughter and two sons. His daughter is a university student and his sons are schoolboys. This is the reason Bahrillo tries very hard to provide for all their needs while they are studying.

Bahrillo has been selling livestock and dairy products, together with his wife, as a primary business since 1996. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. At the same time, he is running a taxi driving business in his free time.

Bahrillo wants to buy two cows for 3000 Somoni ($900 USD). He wants to earn more income so he can provide his children with a good education and improve their lives. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Be an important part of the growth of Bahrillo’s business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Khalil has been selling computer accessories for eight years. He is asking for a loan of 1200 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a printer. This is  Khalil's first loan request.
When Khalil first started his business, he faced a lot of competition. Many other shops offered similar services, but he distinguished himself by his determination and good service. He also owes his success to the support of his friends. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a printer.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila B., a 32-year-old mother, grows rice on her farm. She has only one child, which means she feels like she has  big responsibility to her. 

She doesn’t care if she has to work all day: all the sweat, working the dirt, and feeling the heat of the sun is just to make sure that she has enough food for her family. She and her husband till the land, which her father-in-law owned. Together, they work hard to meet the needs of their family. 

She would like to own farm equipment like a thresher to minimize the expenses she has during harvest. She believes that if she had the equipment, sending her child to school would not be a problem.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI of Php 12,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides that she needs. In this way, she believes she would triple her yield and contribute well to the family income. Specifically, she will use the loan to sustain her farm.

CEVI helps Mila sustain her business. Through credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage services, all their clients will have the chance to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To purhase pesticides and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Deo's Group

texts.en:
Deo K. is the leader of his lending group and he is now seeking his 21st loan. He is a committed married man with a retail shop in his home town that is doing well, thanks to the loans that have provided him with the necessary capital for his business.

In his shop, Deo mostly sells the basics such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc., and stocking his goods in large quantities has helped him with making enough profits and savings. Deo needs another loan to help with stocking his shop with beans, maize, books, pens, and pencils since this is the season for making the greatest sales.

loans.use: Restock his retail shop with more products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells loaves of bread. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

Esther is 44 years old and married with six children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Maria es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Maria se dedica a L. siembra de flores variadas, las cuales los comercializa en diferentes florerías, además viaja a las ferias de donde compra cereales que vende en los mercados de L. ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra de insecticidas.
Maria sueña con que su hijo sea profesional e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. Maria is married, 37 years old, and has 1 child. Maria dedicates herself to planting assorted flowers, which she sells at different flower shops; she also travels to markets where she purchases grains that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Maria needs a loan of 800 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of insecticides. Maria dreams for her son become a professional, and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by MarieL. Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlyn D., 36 years old, is married and lives at Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She has 2 children. Her husband is a private employee. After joining Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, Kiva's partner, in February 2007, she learned that she must have alternative sources of income aside from that of her husband.

Paglaum members were taught entrepreneurial skills for them to use in their livelihood projects, and that’s why she opened a “sari-sari” (general) store. It only started with PHP 3,000 as initial capital. Until today, the store still exists.

Now, she is applying for PHP 14,900 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store. She will be happy enough if she sees all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sari-sari store

loans.name: Julian Antonio

texts.es: Don  Julian Antonio P. P. es originario de la aldea de ChiP. Hoy en dia el es tejedor el aprendio el arte en la epoca del guerra en Guatemala  cuando la tejeduria en Guatemala era muy reconocido internacionalmente su producto anteriormente los entregava en Guatemal. Chichicastenango y Panajachel hoy en dia este producto ha disminuido su nemanda en nuestro departamento. pero por la calidad de trabajo que el realiza tiene algunos clientes que le compra su producto hoy necesita de un credito porque tiene un pedido que entregar, ya que hoy es muy dificil de encontrar un tejedor de estas caracteristicas.
texts.en:
Don Julian Antonio P. P. is a native of the town ChiP. Hoy. He is a weaver who learned the art during the time of war in Guatemala when Guatamalan weaving was very well-known internationally. He used to sell his products in Chichicastenango and Panajachel. Now the demand for his products has decreased in this area. But because of the quality of work that he does, he has some customers who buy his products. He needs a credit because he has an order to fill, since it is very difficult to find a weaver with his skills.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng C. is 33 years old and is married to Mr. Thy who is aged 42. The couple now lives with five single children who are students.

They work selling fresh fish that they catch from Tunle Sap Lake. They get up in the dark to go fishing and hurry to bring their fish to sell in the local market.

Recently, the family can't catch as many fish as before due to the lack of fishing tools. Thus, Chheng C. is looking for a loan to purchase nets and traps to support their fishing activities.

loans.use: To purchase nets and traps for fishing

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra R. M. tiene 27 años de edad, ella es una madre soltera y tiene 2 niños los cuales están bajo su propio cuido, la mayor lucha que ha tenido que enfrentar como madre es la salud de su niña, ya que se le enferma constantemente, el negocio de Mayra es la venta de hornados, refrescos y tajadas de plátano, ella se desarrollo en este negocio desde los 13 años de edad cuando tenia que ayudarle a sus padres pues ellos eran muy pobres y toda la familia se dedicaba al trabajo, por lo que no pudo tener educación, pasado 3 años ella decidió establecer su propio negocio y de esta manera proporcionar un poco mas de ingresos a sus padres, luego cuando formo su hogar empezó a vender en los buses hasta que pudo conseguir un toldo el cual es puesto en una acera donde ella vende sus refrescos, hornados y tajadas de plátano, su mayor deseo es criar de la mejor manera a sus hijos proveyéndoles, una buena alimentación, educación que ella nunca tuvo y un negocio sólido que le permita dar a sus hijos las cosas materiales que ellos necesiten pues el amor ella ya se los da, actualmente Mayra tiene la necesidad de un financiamiento ya que ella comprara mercadería a su negocio para que este pueda seguir funcionando y lograr todas sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Mayra R. M. is 27 and is the single mother of 2 children under her care. The biggest fight she has had to face as a mother is the health of her daughter, since she is constantly sick. Mayra sells pork, beverages, and sliced plantains. She has been developing this business since she was 13, when she had to help her parents because they were very poor and the entire family worked. This is why she couldn't have an education. Three years ago, she decided to start her own business so she could contribute a little more income to her parents. When she started her own family, she started to sell her food on buses until she could obtain a stand on the street where she sells her beverages, pork, and sliced plantains. Her biggest dream is to raise her children in the best way possible, offering them good nutrition and the education she never received. A solid business would let her give her children the material things that they need. She already gives them love. Mayra needs financing so she can buy merchandise for her business so she can keep working and accomplish all of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is from the village of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old. Yolanda is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda sells animals. Her main source of income comes from buy and selling piglets in the local community. Yolanda has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase piglets to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase more piglets. This loan will be the fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. ---------------------------------------------- GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: Purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Floridalma Rosa

texts.es: La Señora Floridalma B. cuenta con 47 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Calzado”, habita junto  a su Esposo y hijos , ella lleva 15 años en la Artesanía en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas,  y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Floridalma B. is 47 years old, is married, and produces handicrafts; she produces footwear. She lives with her husband and children. She has spent 15 years producing handicrafts in her home, which is located in Caserío Xetinimit in the town of Nimasac, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, her clients’ demand is growing, but her economic conditions are not sufficient for her to be able to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, which she intends on using to buy more raw materials. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business (producing footwear)

loans.name: Huluka

texts.en:
Huluka is a member of the Twiga borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 26-year-old woman, is separated from her husband, and is the mother of two children aged 13 and 7 years.
 
A year ago, Huluka started her own business selling charcoal. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Huluka’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Huluka hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aminata Tiguidanké

texts.fr: Aminata Tiguidanké D. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est marié et mère de 06 enfants. Depuis six elle a ouvert une boutique à domicile où elle vend des produits divers. En moyenne, elle s'approvisionne en marchandises pour une valeur de 250000 francs CFA et réalise environs des bénéfices de 180000 francs CFA. Ces bénéfices lui serviront à aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Aminata Tiguidanké D. is a young woman, 36 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Six ___ ago, she opened a shop in her home, where she sells various goods. Usually, she stocks up with merchandise worth 250,000 francs CFA, and she realizes a profit of 180,000 francs. She uses these profits to help her husband in supporting the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her self-financing ability

loans.name: Douglas De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Douglas de Jesús de 35 años de edad, reside en Villa el Carmen en la capital de Managua,  casado y con UN hijo de 11 años de edad que estudia la primaria, sus planes es poder darles una mejor educación y poder mejorar la vivienda, el se desempeña  como responsable de adquisiciones  en la alcaldía, tiene siete meses de laborar en la alcaldía de villa el carmen, lo cual ha logrado estabilizarse, anteriormente era concejal propietario del gobierno pasado, también ha trabajado las tierras por once años y ha podido dar un mejor bienestar a su familia, con este crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para hacer, un corredor para estar con mejores comodidad y gozar de los esfuerzos de su trabajo. da las gracias a la institución por lograr mantener la esperanza a muchas familia de bajo recurso que con anhelo desean tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Señor Douglas de Jesús, age 35, resides in Villa el Carmen in the capital city of Managua with one son of 11 years of age who studies in primary school. His plan is to give him a better education and improve their livelihood. He carries out duties with responsibility for acquisitions in the city hall. He has been working in the city hall of Villa del Carmen for six months, during which he has succeeded in establishing himself. Previously he was a town councilor in a past government. He also worked the land for 11 years and has been able to improve the well-being of his family.

With this loan he wants to buy construction materials to build a hallway in order to live more comfortably and enjoy the fruits of his labor. He gives thanks to the lending institution for succeeding in maintaining the hopes of many families with few resources yearning to have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to build a hallway

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 28-year-old married mother of two school-going children. She lives with her husband who is a businessman.

Lilian has managed her secondhand clothes business for the last three years. She started this with an initial capital of Kshs 6,000 in 2006. Since then she has seen her business grow gradually. She buys clothes in bulk from one of the local markets in Kisumu and sells to her clients who are mostly women.

Lilian requires a loan of Kshs 15,000 to buy more stock in bulk.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en:
Shafoat, 37 years old, is very active and enterprising. She is married, and together they have two school-aged children. Shafoat says that, due to the scarcity of work, she decided to help her husband with the family’s finances. For the past 10 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of women's clothing in the market. The credits obtained through IMON International in the past helped her purchase more merchandise and augment her sales, which, in turn, created better revenue. Her friends admire her greatly, given that she is a dedicated mother and wife, in addition to being good at sales. Today, Shafoat seeks a new loan to be able to buy a lot of merchandise that her suppliers offered her at a good price; she wishes to take advantage of this opportunity. In this way, she can offer her wares at competitive prices without affecting her returns. More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON’s History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase working capital with the purpose of developing the business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old and is married to Edivencio, who works in a lumber company. They have been married for 23 years and they are blessed with two children: Jovelyn - 23 years old, a cashier, and John Lerry - 17 years old. They live in Sta. Cruz, Alicia, Isabela.

Marilyn has managed a retail store in their village for almost seventeen years and she can earn a weekly net income of PHP 1,000. She wishes to apply for a loan of PHP 11,000 from Kiva lenders that she can use for the improvement of her business.

Aside from selling basic commodities, Marilyn also sells cooked food in their village in order to have an additional income with which to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Ten

texts.en: Mr. Ten N. is a villager in Prey Run village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and food for breeding. He hopes that this loan will increase his income, which will improve the family’s living conditions. He has two children who are all working in Thailand as laborers. His wife and son are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets and food for breeding.

loans.name: Samakar Group

texts.en:
Here are Adama T., Ismail K. and Kadiatu K. of the Samakar group. They are businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone and they are seeking their first SMT/Kiva loan to invest in their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000 each, they will be able to increase their inventory and sales, and thereby obtain a better profit. Consequently, their standard of living will improve and they will be able to better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing as well as paying their school fees and medical bills. 

The leader of this group is Adama T. (who is on the left). Adama was born in the town of Magburaka about fifty years ago. She is a widow with six children. One of her children is already grown-up and the rest are attending primary or secondary schools. Adama has been a businesswoman since her childhood. She sells ground-nuts/peanuts, rice and beans; but selling ground-nuts is her main business. Adama will use this loan to buy bags of ground-nuts to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of gound-nuts

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
S. Riza is 46 years old and lives with her husband and son in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son is 15 years old and attends a local secondary school. Riza operates a clothing trading business at the local market in her town with the help of her husband. She imports a variety of clothing from China and transports them to her province to sell. Riza started her business in 2002 and has gained much experience in her trade over the years. Today, her business is growing faster than ever and is enabling her to improve her quality of life. She hopes to take advantage of this success and expand her business in the near future. She says, "All I want is to be able to save enough money to support my son." Riza is requesting a 3,400,000 tugrug (~2400 USD) loan to purchase clothing from China. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase clothing from China

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita P. is from the village of Mansabay Alto Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Margarita is married and has 8 adult children. Margarita owns & operates a business planting and harvesting coconut in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Margarita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Margarita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase coconut fertilizers.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Chak P., 36 years old, has been a tailor in the garment factory for many years and currently earns $120 a month which she uses to cover her family’s daily living expenses. Chak P. was married but has been divorced from her husband since her three kids were very young. All three of her children study at the primary school and are dependent on her. Chak P. faces possible health problems resulting from polluted water surrounding her house, and she requests a loan to purchase fill dirt to improve the condition of her property.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Terere Group 1, Mukono

texts.en:
(W. Dissan, who appears in the small photo is the leader of his group and the one that was interviewed for the story)

W. Dissan is a hard-working and devoted man and the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is married with seven children, six of whom go to school. He has a retail shop business that helps him in taking care of his family. Dissan is also a farmer, growing food both for home consumption and to sell and this helps him to have additional income. In the future, Dissan hopes to expand his shop further so that he can make more profits compared to the $26 that he makes every week, approximately. Dissan needs a loan that will help him to restock his shop with more goods and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To restock his shop and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. is 46 years old and lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a three-hectare field to cultivate rice. In the dry season, they do not have enough water to support their crop so Mrs. Chan S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and dig a well. Aside from being a farmer, her husband, Mr. Leap Krich, (on the right in the photo) owns a cart to deliver goods which helps add to the family's income. Mrs. Chan S. has a child who is cow breeder.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and dig a well

loans.name: Alikalie

texts.en:
Alikalie is married with two children and five dependents.  His wife is also a businesswoman.  He has been in business for about five years.  He owns a shop that is located by the Ferry Terminal in Freetown, where he sells drinks and provisions.  He spends most of his time in the shop, helped at times by his younger brother who stays with him.

Adikalie is seeking a loan to help him acquire more stock, thereby increasing his profit.  He hopes to use the proceeds from the loan to care for his family's daily needs. He also plans to expand his shop.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Fransisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Fransisco Javier C. R., tiene la edad de 393 años vive en el Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla es casado y su esposa es comerciante, y le apoya a los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 15 y 11 años de edad los dos estan estudiando y él labora como guarda de seguridad desde hace aproximadamente 15 meses.

Dentro de los problemas a los que se ha enfrentado, esta la falta de financiamiento para poder remodelar su vivienda la cual ya se encuentra bien avanzada tal y como lo muestra la foto, esto ha sido producto de su empeño diario, ahora él solicita un prestamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, y la culminacion del proyecto de reconstruccion, que aporte una ayuda económica y mejores condiciones de vida para la familia.
texts.en:
Fransisco Javier C. R. is 39 years old and lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla housing development. He is married and his wife is a merchant who helps him with the household expenses. They have 2 children, ages 15 and 11, who are both in school. He has worked as a security guard for about 15 months. Among the problems that he has faced is a lack of credit to be able to complete the renovation of his home, which, as you can see in the photo, is in the final stages due to his daily efforts. Now he requests a loan to buy construction materials. The completion of this construction project will help his family economically and will provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en: Naseem is a wife of R. A. lives in a city named Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Her husband has a business of vegetables. He sells vegetables on his cart by going to various places. His profession gives him earning approximately worth Pak Rs. 10,000 on monthly basis. Naseem also supports him by sewing clothes business. She utilizes her income to pay for the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to expand her husband’s vegetable selling business.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables for vegetable selling business

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has fO. people who live in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chan K. is the group leader who has been selected by all the group members. Mrs. Chan K. and her husband are farmers who own 0.70-hectare of land to grow vegetables to sell to support their family's living. They have two children, one of whom is attending a local school, while the other is a white wine-maker and besides this, he is a pig breeder also. In order to improve their child’s business, Mrs. Chan K. applied for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa C. is from the village of Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Teresa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is married and has two adult sons. She sells clothing at the local open market. Ludmila has been in this business for 10 years. Good variety and affordable prices attract many clients to her kiosk. Large experience helps her to choose the right goods that sell well. Ludmila is a very enthusiastic and happy person. She enjoys being in sales and dreams of opening a small shop in her town. Ludmila would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Dashiimaa

texts.en: Dashiimaa T. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger — a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Two of her children, ages 17 and 15, attend a local secondary school. Her 13 year-old daughter, Jalbaajav, attends a local primary school. They have been living in their current home for two years. Dashiimaa operates a trucking transportation business which she has done since 2009 and has quickly found success. Her business earnings have enabled her to purchase a plot of land with a yard for her family. Dashiimaa has good communication skills and has many plans for the future including building a house for her family. Dashiimaa is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to make repairs to her truck.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in Lunsar, a small town in Northern Sierra Leone. This school was established in 1960 to improve on the standard of education for the children of Lunsar and its surrounding village. This school is staffed by nine dedicated teachers and has 324 pupils. Out of the nine staff, four have applied for a loan of 3,900,000 leones from SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time. 

Staff from this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational area, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their salaries alone. With the help of a loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land or house-building materials; or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers repay their loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Abu Bakarr, 46, is the headmaster at the school and leader of this group. He has been a teacher for 20 years. He was born in Lunsar, is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. One of his children is still a baby and the other one is in secondary school. Abu Bakarr will use his loan to buy furniture such as chairs and a bed. He will use the remainder to meet other family expenses.

loans.use: To buy furniture such as chairs and a bed

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua S. is from the village of   Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Perpetua is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Perpetua owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Perpetua has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perpetua joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perpetua is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Perpetua from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr:
Madame Oulimata S. est une femme de 57 ans qui vit dans la localité  de Ouakam. Elle est mariée et mère  de 6 enfants. 
Madame S.  a démarré  son activité  de petit commerce en vendant des jus, de la glace, puis des produits en provenance de la Mauritanie. Actuellement elle a une expérience  de 4 ans dans le commerce de tissus, parfums, et fruits de mer pendant l’été. 
Elle est sociétaire  depuis 4 ans dans la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Ouakam et a déjà  rembourse 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs destine à renforcer son commerce de fruits de mer puisqu’on est en période d’été. 
Par conséquent  ce crédit  lui permettra de mieux développer  son commerce  pour mieux faire  face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
