Mrs. Oulimata S. is a 57 year old woman who lives in the town of Ouakam. She is married and the mother of 6 children. Mrs. S. started up her small business selling juices and ice cream, and then products from Mauritania. Most recently, she has been working for four years selling cloth, perfumes, and seafood during the summer. She has been a member of the l'U-IMCEC fund in Ouakam for 4 years and has already paid back 2 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 frs, meant to strengthen her seafood business since it is the summer period. Thus, this loan will allow her to expand her business and better meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growth of working capital funds.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora A. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 48 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Dioscora raises fish like "tilapya" and "heto" for sale. Dioscora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Dioscora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Dioscora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Ching M. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 65 years old. Ching is married. To make a living, Ching owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ching has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ching joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ching has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Ching is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Ching from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Julie Jane

texts.en:
Julie Jane N. is from the village of Kinura, in Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Julie Jane owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Julie Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Julie Jane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Julie Jane’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Choeun's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up a group loan located in Kampong Samnanh village, Kandal province. Mrs. Choeun B. who is 69 years old is the village bank president, having been selected by the members of this group loan. 

Choeun B. earns her living by renting out her house to someone for income. Her house is old and somewhat broken down. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to fix her house up. Choeun B. is a widow with five children: three are seamstresses in a garment factory and another is an electrician while the last one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To fix her house up (she rents it out)

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 26-year-old married man from Bint Jbeil and is the father of two children. Since 1995 he has worked in construction and specialized in setting and cleaning tile. Fouad is very organized in his work, ambitious and loyA.. Customers request him from distant villages because of his good word-of-mouth reputation. He is highly recommended, and he is skilled in his field of work.

Fouad is requesting his first loan from A. Majmoua in order to pay for his children’s school fees and supplements. He is working on expanding his business in order to achieve his goA., which is to have his children attend important universities.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Priscila Albina

texts.es:
Priscila de 20 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). 

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos. También vende en una vitrina que tiene en su casa perfumes desde $ 15.00 hasta $ 35.00 c/u, ropa a $ 12.00. maquillaje de $ 14.00 c/u.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y asegurar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Priscila is 20 years old and lives in the Las Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil. She sells products from Yanbal (a company which gives entrepreneurial women the chance to start out with independent sales). 

She does this work only so that she can help with the family's expenses. She starts work very early, offering her products to her neighbors and friends. She also sells them from a display case in her home. She sells perfumes ranging from $15.00 to $35.00 each, clothing at $12.00, and makeup sets at $14.00 each.  

With the loan, she wants to buy Yanbal products such as perfumes, creams and deodorants. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and make sure she can finish her studies.

loans.use: Maquillaje, ropa, perfumes

loans.name: Agnes Esi Essoun

texts.en: Agnes Esi Essoun K. sells gari (gari is made from cassava) in Abura. Agnes has not received any formal education. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of gari for sale. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari for sale

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en: Misheck is a 35-year-old businessman. He operates "Mukurinu Juakali," where he manufactures chip warmers, Juakali jikos (locally manufactured cookers) and chip choppers, among other products. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine and metallic sheets. He describes himself as hardworking and honest and hopes to provide a good life for his family. Through Faulu loans, his business has grown.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and metallic sheets

loans.name: Elise Patricia Anique

texts.fr:
Vendeuse de poisson salé au marché, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 8ans et elle  nourrit toute sa famille a avec  ses revenus
Le prêt passé a été comme une école pour elle, elle a appris beaucoup et remboursée sans problèmes.
Le prochain prêt sera là pour continuer ce qu’elle avait commencé à savoir .

Tous ces enseignements lui ont été bénéfiques, elle a amélioré sa manière de vendre, son comportement envers les clients.
Avec le  nouveau prêt qui vient, elle va augmentée son activité en achetant : Des cartons de poissons salés : thons, soles, morue et capitaine.
Avant le prêt passé, ses revenus journaliers étaient de 30000f, maintenant son revenu par jour est compris entre 40.000f et 60.000f.
Son but sera atteint, lorsqu’elle va être grossiste .
Pour ses enfants, elle se bat avec les moyens financiers qu’elle aura, elle veut continuer à les soutenir dans leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
This vendor sells fish in the market. She has been in this business for almost eight years and she feeds her whole family with her earnings. Her last loan was an education for her; she learned a lot and repaid the loan without problems. She will use the next loan in order to continue what she started with her previous loan. All of these lessons have been beneficial - they have improved the way she sells and her behavior towards her clients. 

With this new loan, she will grow her business by purchasing boxes of salted fish: tuna, sole, cod and Nile perch. Before her last loan, her daily earnings were 30,000 francs; now her income is between 40,000 francs and 60,000 francs a day. Her goal is to become the wholesaler. 

For her children, she struggles with the financial resources available, but she wants to continue to support them in their schooling.

loans.use: To purchase salted fish: like sole, cod, Nile perch (aka "capitaine") and tuna

loans.name: David Nguyai

texts.en:
David is 45 years old and married to Lydia Njeri, who helps in the farm that provides income for the family. They have four children who are dependent on them. David has been in the farming business for about two years with an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

This is his first loan with KADET LTD and he intends to use the loan to buy a dairy goat for income generation. He hopes to start a business of selling potatoes and vegetables wholesale in order to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Las Peques 1 Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA LAS PEQUES 1 PORQUE SON PERSONAS QUE DESDE SIEMPRE SE HAN DEDICADO A UN NEGOCIO EN ESPECÍFICO Y CON BASE EN GRANDES SACRIFICIOS HAN LOGRADO HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIOS. IDENTIFICARSE COMO PEQUES ES UNA MANERA DE RECONOCER SU ESFUERZO CON SENCILLES. ESTÁ UBICADO EN ATLACOMULCO ESTADO DE MÉXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORITA YOLANDA N. TIENE 35 AÑOS Y ES PASANTE EN LA LICENCIATURA DE ADMINISTRACIÓN NO PUDO CONCLUIR SU CARRERA POR MOTIVOS ECONÓMICOS. CUANDO DEJÓ LA UNIVESIDAD COMENZÓ SU NEGOCIO CON VENTA EN CATÁLOGOS, DESPUÉS CON AYUDA DE LOS CRÉDITOS EMPEZÓ A VENDER, PRINCIPALMENTE LENCERIA, EN UN LOCAL. EN SU NEGOCIO LLEVA 3 AÑOS Y VARIAS PERSONAS COMENTAN QUE LES GUSTA COMPRARLE PORQUE APARTE DEL BUEN SERVICO SIEMPRE TIENEN NOVEDADES, Y HACEN TODO LO POSIBLE Y HASTA LO IMPOSIBLE POR CONSEGUIR LOS MODELOS QUE SOLICITAN EN EL MENOR TIEMPO POSIBLE. ELLA SE SIENTE ORGULLOSA DE PODER AYUDAR A SU MAMÁ CUANDO LO NECESITA Y TAMBIÉN DE ESTAR AHORRANDO PARA TENER UN MEJOR FUTURO APLICANDO SUS CONOCIMIENTOS EN ADMINISTRACIÓN.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Las Peques 1' (Kids 1) because they are people who have always dedicated themselves to one specific business and through great sacrifice they have managed to grow their businesses.  To identify themselves as kids is a way of recognizing their effort simply.  The group is located in Atacomulco, in the State of Mexico and has 10 members.

Yolanda N. is 35 years old.  She did a degree course in business administration but couldn't complete her studies for economic reasons.  When she left university, she started her business making catalog sales.  Then, with the help of loans, she started to sell mainly lingerie from a business premises.  She has been in her business for 3 years and several people comment that they like to buy from her because she provides a good service and always has new products.  She does everything possible (and even impossible) to acquire the products they request in the least amount of time possible.  Yolanda feels proud that she can help her mom when she needs it and she is saving so that she can have a better future, applying her knowledge of business administration.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion G. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 52 years old. Presentacion is married. To make a living, Presentacion operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from catching and selling assorted fish to the market. 

Presentacion joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Presentacion has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Presentacion is requesting a new loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús V. M. de 39 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa y dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad. Manuel es una persona muy responsable, quien se dedica a la venta ambulante de verduras y frutas, las cuales comercializa en el pueblo de Sensuntepeque, en donde posee muchos clientes frecuentes. Manuel solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda incrementar la cantidad de productos que posee, así de esta manera atender a más clientes, y así mismo para aumentar la variedad de frutas y verduras. Manuel desea mucho salir adelante y poder contar con una vida mejor para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús V. M. is 39 years old and resides in Cojutepeque, which is in the Department of Cuscatlán. There he lives with his family, which consists of his wife and two children (ages 9 and 3). Manuel is a very responsible individual who sells vegetables and fruits as a traveling merchant in the town of Sensuntepeque where he has many repeat customers.

He is requesting a loan for Apoyo Integral so that he can increase his inventory of products. This will enable him to serve more customers and offer a greater variety of fruits and vegetables. Manuel wants very much to get ahead so that he and his family can have a better life.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables & fruits in bulk

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk T. is a 45-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with four kids. One is single and three are married. Three of her children are employed in different occupations, and they always share their income with Ouk T. to cover the daily expenses. Ouk T. was married but she has been divorced for years. She earns a living by growing rice crops on farmland which she inherited from her grandmother. In order to earn additional income, Ouk T. wishes to raise piglets to sell, but she doesn’t have enough funds to make it possible. This is why she is asking for a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada  Concepcion De Tambocucho Group

texts.en:
The rural community bank “Virgin of the Immaculate Conception” is in Tambocucho, where many people raise animals and work in agriculture. The group is in its 3rd loan cycle, and has 11 members with different businesses, such as selling goods such as animals, grains, and groceries, raising animals, and working in agriculture.

One of the bank's members, Maria, is married, and has 6 children aged 12 to 18 who are all in school. For 15 years she has had a business transporting cheese to sell in the markets in Ayacucho. She will be using her current loan of 200 PEN to buy more cheese from her community to sell in Ayacucho. She is grateful to FINCA Peru because they gave her loans and taught her to save, which has enabled her to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cheese to sell

loans.name: El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Varias señoras del barrio Julio Correa de la ciudad de Luque se juntaron y decidieron formar un nuevo grupo, después de que el comité "La Esperanza" del mismo barrio se disolvió.
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y está conformado por 17 integrantes quienes invierten en distintas actividades, todas del área de confección y costura.
La señora Exaltacion A. es la directora general del comité, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Decidió integrar este grupo para ampliar su negocio y también porque le gusta mucho trabajar con las demás integrantes y compartir con ellas.
La sra. Exaltacion invertiría el crédito en su taller de costura, comprando telas para aumentar la producción de ropas que luego vende a su clientela ya formada.
texts.en:
Several women from the Julio Correa suburb in the city of Luque joined together and decided to form a new group, after the "La Esperanza" comittee in the same neighborhood disbanded.
Currently the committee is in the fifith cycle of the "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras" program and is made up of 17 members who have invested in different businesses, all in the area of tailoring and dressmaking.
Exaltacion A. heads up the committee, she is married and has two children. She decided to become a member of this group to expand her business and also because she really likes to work with the other members and share with them.
Exaltacion will use the loan for her dressmaking workshop, buying fabric to increase the production of clothes which she will then sell to her pre-existing customers.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Birungi Group-Jinja

texts.en: For the past five years, 33-year-old Scovia K., a member of  B. Group, has been operating a second-hand clothing sales business. The happily married mother of four, who got start-up capital from her previous local brew sales business, earns 50,000 shillings per week and will use this loan to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson K. K. is 27 years old, married to Vivian, and they have one child. He does maize farming in Mosop in Eldoret, plus he does has a retail shop in the same area, and he has been doing this business for eleven years now. He gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be Samson's fourth loan from KADET LTD. He has repaid all other loan successfully, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs like maize seeds and fertilizer. With the income that he is going to get from sale of maize he will use the money to buy stock for his retail shop.

In future he wants to continue with farming and also educate his child.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is a 42-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and three kids. Kasem works in construction and has been specialized in cement work since 1998. He is a hard worker. His 15 years of experience give his contractors and other clients trust, since most of them are from Tyre and nearby villages. 

Kasem has a good reputation for his commitment to work. He works hard to provide his family with the best way of living. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy iron pillars necessary for his business to cover higher and wider areas in a safe way. Kasem hopes to expand his business in the future, through opening a small construction company that deals with everything that has to do with this domain.

loans.use: To buy new iron pillars necessary for his business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora  Marina Estrada Pérez, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, casada y tuvo siete hijos  quienes ya están casados.

    El préstamo que ella solicito es para invertirlo el préstamo en la  compra de ingrediente como son: harina, aceite, queso, huevo, entre otros para la elaboración de panes donde lleva treinta y un años  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos saca adelante   a sus hijos.

   Quien   la inspiro en esta actividad fue su cuñada quienes también se dedica va  a lo  mismo y con la ayuda de su esposo  quien trabaja en el campo lo platicaron para que así tengan ingresos de ambos.
 
    Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad y el préstamo siga trabajando para así  tener ahorros y más adelante pueda apoyarse.
texts.en: Marina lives in Coapilla, in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is married and has seven adult children.  Marina will use this credit to buy baking ingredients such as: flour, oil, cheese, eggs, and other items.  She has been baking bread for sale for over 30 years, and this is how she supported her children.  Marina was inspired in her business by her sister-in-law, who also runs a bakery, and by her husband, who works in agriculture to provide for the household.  Her greatest wish is to see this credit result in increased profits, savings and a better future.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como cemento, ladrillos, arena y herramientas para construir las casas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negoció la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Vicentina, 44, is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with selling construction materials such as cement, bricks, sand and tools to build houses.  Her working hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m.  Through her business she has been able to provide an income for her children.  She wants to expand her construction materials activity and has requested a loan to buy wholesale construction materials.

She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale constructin materials.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge is 32 years old, married man and has two young children. His wife works as a teacher and he has worked as a farmer for the last 10 years, growing rice and vegetables. He also runs a sari-sari (or variety) store to supplement his family's income. He is applying for this loan to buy 13 bags of fertilizer for his farm. In the future, Jorge hopes to become a successful independent businessman.

loans.use: to buy 13 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anabil

texts.en:
Anabil is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 6 children. 

Anabil has a shop that sells candies, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Anabil has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Anabil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer. 

She has been in this business of selling beans and rice for three years.she took loan from BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.she will use the profit for her business to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: she want more income to able her purchase more beans,rice for sale

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 3 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market. The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, su esposo trabaja con su carro haciendo servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, y la socia es ama de casa, ella cocina para sus hijos y esposo, la socia quiere mejorar en el servicio de taxi. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro, para comprar repuestos para su carro.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “MANOS JUNTAS” ´Hands Together`community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco.

Her name is Isabel. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with the transportation business. Her husband works with his car, offering taxi service on different streets in Cuzco. Isabel is a housewife who cooks for her children and husband. She wants to improve the taxi service. She is asking for the loan for car maintenance and to buy replacement parts.

Isabel is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her car and buy replacement parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Yovana; tiene 23 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia actualmente estudia en un instituto gastronomía, la socia es estudiante y también hace practicas en su área de tal modo que gana experiencia y también puede ahorrar el dinero que le pagan, la socia desea invertir su crédito en la apertura de su propio negocio, ella desea poner un pequeño negocio y aún no quiere decir que tipo de negocio abrirá por un asunto de cábala;pero tendra mucho que ver con la gastronomia, ella invertira en un negocio relacionado a la elaboración de platos. La socia solicita el préstamo parta aperturar su negocio de comidas.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

Yovana, 23, is the member.  She’s single and is currently studying at a gastronomy institute.  She’s a student and also carries out practical exercises in her area of study to gain experience and she’s able to save the money she’s paid for them.  She wants to use the loan to open a small business of her own but because of a Kabala-related issue she doesn’t want to say just yet what kind of business it will be. But the business will have something to do with gastronomy related to food making.  She’s asking for the loan to open her food business.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to open a business of her own.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en: Willy is 50 years old and is married with 6 children aged 9 to 23. He lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda.The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him and his desire is to see his children graduate. He is a teacher and has been teaching for 26 years. Willy needs the loan facility to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
At 38 years of age, Conchita is an business-minded and dedicated person to her business, a store where she sells all basic commodities and at the same time she sells some cosmetic products, shirts, sandals and bags as a source of additional income. She has had this business for nine years and she is happy because she has a lot of profit.The profit she generates from her business is used for their daily needs, the allowance of her eldest son, and payment for their electric bill.

Conchita enjoys her daily routine while her husband is also busy in cultivating their rice fields. She hopes to have more customers and gain greater income to have her store stocked with a great variety of items. Her goal is to improve her direct selling business so that she can have additional capital in maintaining her store.

Currently Conchita needs a loan amount of P20,000 to buy groceries to stock such as canned goods, oil, sugar, milk, junk foods, assorted biscuits and soft drinks  for her  home-based store.She hopes that she can obtain her requested loan amount. She believes that she could make her business grow and be profitable because of her hard work and patience in managing her store and direct selling business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, oil, sugar, milk, junk foods, assorted biscuits and soft drinks  for her  home-based store

loans.name: Ma. Lovella

texts.en:
Ma. Lovella is 36 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Ma. Lovella runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.
Ma. Lovella aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, age 59, has worked in house construction for 36 years. He supports himself and his wife Mueni through this business and makes a monthly profit of KES 12,000.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a group that is registered with the organization, and he is applying for his second loan. With the loan funds, he will buy wood blocks for building.

The anticipated profits will be applied to the family's basic needs and put into savings. In future, he hopes to grow his business and become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy wood blocks for building

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié père de cinq en fants.Il tient une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires en face de la route nationale qui traverse sa localité.Les revenus générés par sa boutique lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter du riz, de l'huile, du sucre et diverses denrées alimentaires.Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man and father of five children. He runs a small shop selling foodstuffs opposite the main road that runs through his locality. The income generated by his shop enables him to cover his personal expenses and those of his family. He requests a loan of 500000f to purchase rice, oil, sugar and various foodstuffs. His ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar and various foodstuffs.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
Fausto is a resident and a farmer in the Murang'a area of Central Kenya. He is 31 and married with one child, age 6 years. Fausto has been in farming for 10 years and currently produces coffee and milk for the local market.

Fausto has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him purchase poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He says he wants to spread his farming risks and likes the faster turnovers in the poultry business. He is looking forward to supplying the local market with both birds and eggs.

However, Fausto mentions the high cost of feed as the main challenge, but reiterates with available loans, farming has a better future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Guapa está iniciándose en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria, siempre dentro de un ambiente de respeto y ayuda mutua. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también hacen actividades en forma conjunta para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo.
La Sra Serafina, es divorciada, tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica a la confección de sabanas y fundas, mediante en cual puede mantener a su hijo y paliar los gastos que surgen el día a día. Comenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por hijo, pues quiere darle todo lo mejor para que no tenga que pasar por privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos, los cuales le será de mucha ayuda en su taller.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” women’s committee is starting the first cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women program.  They work as a team and in a mutually supportive way always in a spirit of mutual respect and support.  Besides the individual work of each one of them, they also conduct group fund-raising activities in order to have some group capital.

Serafina is divorced and has a son.  She manufactures sheets and pillowcases that allows her to support her son and alleviate costs that arise day to day.  She comments that all the sacrifice she makes is for her son because she wants to give him all the best so that he should not have to go through any privations.  She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies that will be of much help in her workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and more.

loans.name: Baheja

texts.en:
Baheja is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and four daughters. Her husband (pictured) is an employee of the Ministry of Education, and he earns a decent salary. 

Baheja has an internet cafe, and she wants to improve it by making some repairs such as painting, installing lights, etc. Also, she wants to increase the number of computers used by her customers in her cafe. However, the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for all this, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Baheja gets the loan, she will pay to improve the cafe's conditions by doing the necessary repairs and purchasing additional computers to increase her customers and her income. This will enable her to provide her family with better living conditions. Baheja is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead of her in the internet cafe.

loans.use: To make some repairs to her internet cafe and to purchase more computers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena se dedica a la producción venta de comida y queques. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos, como ser harina, frutas abrillantadas, pasas, nueces, almendras y azúcar, para aumentar su capital y por ende elevar el volumen de su producción y aprovechar la época de navidad para vender más queques y panetones. Elena  es casada y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa en alquiler  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Fátima  de la Ciudad de La Paz. Elena es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y esta es la primera vez que desea que su crédito se canalize a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Elena makes food and cakes.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients like flour, candied fruit, raisins, nuts, almonds and sugar to increase capital and thus increase production to take advantage of the Christmas season and sell more cakes and panettones.  Elena is married and has no children.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Fátima zone.  Elena has been an Impro client since 2008 and this is the first time she’s wanted her loan to be channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, nuts and almonds to make Christmas panettones.

loans.name: Leniya

texts.en:
Leniya is 49 years old and married. She has six children, age 8 to 26. Three of her children go to school. 

With the loan she will buy more sorghum. She expects to use the profits to buy iron sheets for her house. She would like to be a distributor of sorghum.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 50-year-old single woman with one child. She sells used clothes to earn a living and has been in this business for four years. Since Mildred joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya her business has grown. She hopes to have a stable business in the future. 
Mildred has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Damaris Nohemi

texts.es:
Damaris de 25 años de edad, labora como asesora pedagogica, es una joven emprendedora y muy trabajadora  su esposo es comerciante y ademas se desempeña como conductor, ambos son bien trabajadores y bien unidos, pues comparten con los gastos familares y los deberes crediticios.  

Solicita financiamiento para pagar curso de titulaciòn y pago del titulo de la carrera Licenciatura en Ingles.  Su sueño es culminar sus estudios universitarios para despues estudiar un post grado y asi ir profesionalizandose, siempre y cuando cuente con la ayuda de su esposo el cual siempre le apoya.  

Cabe señalar que Damaris anteriormente fue beneficiada con kiva para la construccion de una habitacion en su casa por lo que les esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que siempre brindan a las personas de escasos recursos, pues solo con los creditos es que podemos mejorar nuestras condiciones de vida y superarnos para que a nuestra familia tenga lo basico en la casa.
texts.en:
Damaris, 25, has worked for the Ministry of Education as a teaching assessor; she’s demonstrated responsibility and love for her daily work.  She’s a young hardworking, enterprising woman and her husband is a merchant who also works as a driver.  They are both very hardworking and united because they share household expenses and loan obligations.

She’s asking for a loan to pay her graduation and professional title costs for her Bachelor’s in English at Martín Lutero University.  Her dream is to complete her university training to then study a postgraduate course to increase her level of professionalism as long as she has her husband’s help who always supports her.

It’s worth mentioning that Damaris had a previous Kiva loan to build a room onto her house and she is very grateful for the opportunity they always give to people of scarce resources because it’s only with the loans that they can improve their living conditions and improve so that their families can have the basics at home.

loans.use: to pay for graduation and professional title costs.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 56 year old woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan who helps support 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase women's and children's clothing. She would like to expand her current project selling the items and open a shop. In the future she would like to purchase a home for her family. Iman prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her son.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Shemedy

texts.en:
Shemedy is 56 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Shemedy has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Shemedy requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Shemedy has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Shemedy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy household items for her shop in large quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lasai would like to buy different varieties of bead materials for her business.

loans.name: Erum

texts.en: Erum  is 40 years old, and is married with one boy. To supplement her husband’s income, Erum sells various snacks in front of her house at her small store. In a day Erum can earn  of $2 and eventually she can earn around $38 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income, therefore she can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Hojaoy

texts.ru:
Абдуллоева Хочиой -38 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж в России на заработки, дети учатся в школе. Она домохозяйка. Вот уже 15 лет занимается откормом крупнорогатого скота у себя дома. Клиентом «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, тогда она откармливала только пару телят. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода, так как все заботы о семье лежат на ее плечах. Благодаря поддержке «Микроинвест», она увеличила количество скота, купила дойную корову и запасла корм на несколько месяцев вперед. В будущем планирует увеличить количество крупнорогатого скота и расширить место для присмотра своих скотов.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Hojaoy A., 38 is married and has 3 children. Her husband went to Russia to seek employment there. Her kids are in school. In addition to taking care of the household, for the last 15 years, Hojaoy A. has been breeding cattle. In 2005, she became a client of MicroInvest. Then, her livestock consisted only of a pair of calves. The cattle farm is the main source of income for Hojaoy A.’s family. With help from MicroInvest, Hojaoy A. increased the size of her livestock, purchased a milk cow, and bought a few months-worth of cattle food. With this loan, she plans to increase her livestock and expand the size of her cattle farm.

loans.use: To increase total number of livestock

loans.name: Sutiyem

texts.id:
Although she is 65, that does not lowered Sutiyem to do business to increase family's income. Sutiyem lives in a hut made from woven bamboo walls and sand floor (no tiles). Sutiyem has a business of "Packed rice" (nasi bungkus). All of it was done with her children and in laws at home, since they all live in the same one house. Every packed rice was sold at Rp 1500 or Rp 2000 (16 or 22 cents) depending on customer's request. For every package she profits about Rp 200 (2 cents), each day she produce about 100 packages. So in one day she could profit about Rp20,000 (about $2.20). The Dinari loan, Sutiyem use to buy a rice warmer: Magic jar, so that her packed rice would still be warm, and her customers would be more satisfied. Besides that Sutiyem will buy other kitchen aplliances like stove, pots and wok. This will make her business more efficient, and could produce more.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun usia sudah cukup tua, yakni 65 tahun, tidak menyurutkan semangat Sutiyem untuk melakukan pekerjaan untuk menambah penghasilan keluarganya. Sutiyem tinggal dirumahnya yang terbuat dari dinding gede dan lantai tanah. Sutiyem mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Nasi Bungkus. Semua itu dikerjakannya dirumah bersama dengan anak dan menantunya karena mereka tinggal bersama dalam satu rumah. Setiap bungkus dijual Sutiyem dengan harga Rp. 1.500.- atau Rp. 2.000.- tergantung permintaan pelanggannya. Dalam setiap bungkusnya, Sutiyem bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 200.-, sedangkan dalam sehari Sutiyem bisa mejual nasi bungkus sebanyak 100 biji. Jadi dalam sehari, Sutiyem mampu mendapat keuntungan Rp. 20.000.- Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Sutiyem menggunakannya untuk membeli Magic Jar ( penghangat nasi ), sehingga nasi bungkus yang dijualnya tetap hangat dan pelanggannya dapat menikmatinya dengan lebih puas. Selain itu, Sutiyem juga membeli alat – alat dapur yang dapat menunjang usahanya seperti kompor, panci dan penggorengan. Hal itu dilakukannya supaya kinerja usahanya lebih cepat dan dapat memproduksi lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use:
To buy kitchen appliances that could support her business

Membeli peralatan dapur yang dapat menunjang kinerja usahanya

loans.name: Faanimo

texts.en: Faanimo came from a family of seven. She is 20 years of age and single. Her two brothers overseas help to support the family, but her family also runs a plantation as their main source of income. Having a large family and relying on the plantation were the reasons why Faanimo decided to join SPBD. She heard of SPBD through the village women; She joined so she could have something of her own. She chose to make pancakes because she is close to the village school and because the village people could buy from her anytime. This is Faanimo's first loan and she is very happy for the opportunity so she could develop her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancakes business

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sou S., 32, lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works as a farmer growing a wide variety of vegetables on her farmland, making around $2.30/day from selling her outputs to her customers at a market. Her husband works as a laborer and generally earns about $3.60 per day, while three of her children are enrolled in school and another one is too young to go to school yet.
Mrs. Sou S. hopes this loan will help her purchase seeds to expand her crops and the leftover of the money is to buy a water pump machine and to dig a well to help water the crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to expand her crops and the leftover of the money is to buy a water pump machine and to dig a well so that in the future her crops to water the crops.

loans.name: Olga's Group

texts.en:
Lucy, Lucinda, and Olga have been associates of the community bank “Virgen Maria” for the past several years. Lucy is 20 years old and single. She has been selling cheese from a cart for the past four years.

Lucinda is 38 and married with three children who are all students. She sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, beans, oil, and soap in the town of Vilcashuman. Once a week she takes her merchandise and sells it in another small town named Huamanga.

Olga is 36 and married with two children who are still in school. She sells grains and different types of flour in the Playa Grau market. She buys things such as cornmeal, wheat, and other regional flours in the town of Acosynchos to sell at the market in Ayacucho.

Their loans are for 1200, 600, and 1400 soles respectively (3 soles = $1). They will invest these in: buying milk in order to make yogurt; butter, toothpaste, soft drinks, beer, grains; buying a small stand; and generally continuing to develop their businesses.

They plan to use their savings to buy a piece of land; a freezer; and to buy a house.

Lucy, Lucinda, and Olga say that their bank has taught them about responsibility and punctuality. They have learned how to treat their families, to care for their health, and to save. Furthermore, they feel content with their community bank.

Lucy, Lucinda, and Olga dream of studying to be nurses, and of building a home.

loans.use: continuing to develop their individual businesses

loans.name: Mamayira Centre A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Madina N.. She is currently in the business of selling second hand clothes and is requesting a loan to increase the stock of clothes. Madina is 38 years old and is a widow. She has 8 children ranging from age 5 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Madina makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet basic needs. Madina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to increase stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Madina is joined in her small group by Madina N.. Madina N. has a business selling sweet potatoes and wants to add to her stock.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Pepenetik 3 Group

texts.es:
DOÑA ADELINA , 29 years old, is famous in his area for making elaborate traditional skirts. A large amount of thread is used for the multi-colored embroidery. These skirts are sold in the community to his neighbors. On some occasions her husband transports the skirts to the city to sell them to tourist shops. This work helps her to take care of her six children. With a loan, I would like to buy more different colored threads and fabrics to design elaborate traditional skirts.The other members of the group are Ofelia Vazquez P., who runs the store and Natalia G. R., the artisan.

This story has been translated by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

DOÑA ADELINA DE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES FAMOSA EN SU LOCALIDAD POR ELABORAR FALDAS CON EL BORDADO TRADICIONAL, AUNQUE SE LLEVE MUCHO HILO EL BORDADO TIENE QUE SER CON MUCHOS COLORES NOS COMPARTIO, ESTAS FALDAS SON VENDIDAS EN SU COMUNIDAD CON SUS VECINAS, EN ALGUNAS OCACIONES SU ESPOSO SE TRANSPORTA A LA CIUDAD MAS CERCANA PARA VENDERLAS A PERSONAS QUE BUSCAN MERCANCIA PARA TIENDAS TURISTICAS, ESTE TRABAJO LES AYUDA A MANTENER A SUS 6 HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR MUCHOS HILOS DE COLORES Y TELA PARA SEGUIR ELABORANDO SUS TRADICIONALES FALDAS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: OFELIA VAZQUEZ P. TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y NATALIA G. R. ES ARTESANA.

loans.use: To buy commodities (fabric, threads and colors)

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 29 years old and is married with 1 child, age 9. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 19. Fatuma is a food seller; she started her business in 2008. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
For the past seven years Maria Auxiliadora E. has worked selling food and drinks to her clients in her establishment in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. She is a very hard working woman who with time has been improving her economic condition and that of her family thanks to the great efforts she has made to improve her business.

Today, like all businesses, she needs to invest economic resources in the purchase of food ingredients as well as drinks, and for this reason she has confidently applied to Ceprodel to obtain the credit necessary that will allow her to obtain such items and continue carrying out her home-based sales.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Maria Auxiliadora E. desde hace siete años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de comida y bebidas en su establecimiento donde atiende a sus clientes en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. Es una dama muy esforzada que a través del tiempo ha venido mejorando su condición económica y la de su familia gracias a los grandes esfuerzos para mejorar el negocio.

Hoy en día como todo negocio, ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir recursos económicos en la compra de los ingredientes para la comida y además en la compra de las bebidas, por este motivo muy confiadamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita dicha adquisición y así continuar llevando a cabo sus ventas en su localidad de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of Food Ingredients

loans.name: Sothyma

texts.en: Mrs. Sothyma N. is a beefsteak seller in Andoung Snay Village in Kampong Chhnang. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is an accountant officer while the two others are attending school. Mrs. Sothyma N. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business. She is requesting a second loan to buy a piece of village land for re-sale at a profit. This will increase her income and help her family.

loans.use: To buy a part of village land for re-sell

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi A. is 32 years old, married, and a father of two children who are in school. He lives in Wome, a city about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been driving a motorcycle taxi for more than two years and wants to use this loan to buy a new motorcycle to improve his work conditions and to earn more money which will improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Komi A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Il habite à Wome, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis plus de 2 ans et désire par ce crédit acquérir une nouvelle moto pour améliorer les conditions de son travail et de gagner plus de sous qui permettra une amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his taxi business

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda bibi is the wife of M. A.. She has been living in Multan, Pakistan for the last one and a half years. Her husband makes and sells furniture. She is a housewife, but she sews clothes for her neighbors. Saeeda bibi collects good profits from this business. She has a son who is just 8 months old. Her husband's furniture business is also a profitable business. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wood to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nighat Seema baji wants a loan to buy more fruits to resell. Yasmeen baji wants a loan for her husband who makes and sells handmade items. She will use the loan to buy a molding machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Thi Lanh

texts.vi: Chị Lanh  tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1999. Trước đây kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp rất nhiều khó khăn  do sống ở vùng quê thu nhập chủ yếu dựa vào làm nông nghiệp.Khi tham gia vào quỹ anh chị mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau một thời gian vừa chăn nuôi vừa làm quen với công việc kinh doanh buôn bán anh chị đã vay thêm vốn để thu mua thóc về bán cho các đại lý và sát gạo bán cho người dân khi họ có nhu cầu.Hiện nay mức thu nhập  của gia đình anh chị từ buôn bán và chăn nuôi khoảng 3 triệu đồng/tháng. Hiện tại gia đình chị  không chỉ thu mua thóc mà còn thu mua lạc bán cho các đại lý trong tỉnh.Vì thế anh chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn thu mua lúa, lạc trong vụ mùa sắp tới
texts.en:
Mrs. Lanh has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1999. Before that, her family faced many financial problems as she lived in the rural area and relied mainly on farming. After joining the Fund, she borrowed loans to invest in rearing pigs. After a period of time raising livestock and getting used to doing business, she and her husband decided to obtain more loans to buy rice and resell to retailers. She also milled the rice to sell to villagers. Currently, her family's monthly income from rearing pigs is about 3,000,000VND (about 187.50USD). Now, her family also buys peanuts and resells to retailers in town. Therefore, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to purchase more rice and peanuts in the next season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is divorced. She has a grown daughter Yelena and little grandson Svyatoslav. Nina sells clothing in one of the local marketplaces in Melitopol. She is an experienced vendor who has worked in this sphere of trade for about 12 years. Currently, she has about $4000 in inventory. Her gross income is about $1600 a month. Net profit amounts to $400.

Nina is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan to diversify assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk before fall/winter season. She is determined to work hard and invest much energy in her enterprise as she wants to see it flourish and succeed as every focused entrepreneur. Nina is willing to stay on the run for she has many people she is responsible for – her daughter, little grandson and elderly father who is 90 now. Nina loves her pace of life and looks into the future with much optimism and enthusiasm. She is hoping to repay the current loan in 7 months.

loans.use: increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Nakoja

texts.en: Nakoja N. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through to junior high education. Nakoja sells yams at Atobiase near Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a commercial driver. Nakoja uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Nakoja will use the loan to increase the quantity of yams she sells to meet the increase in demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nakoja plans to increase her capital base to enable her to increase the quantity of yams she trades in.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of yams she sells to meet the increase in demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fabrics, threads and shoes.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est très travailleuse et exerce dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle habite le quartier d’Agoè mimamadou. Elle est très dynamique et s’approvisionne pour son activité dans les marchés de la place. Son commerce marche bien et elle demande son crédit pour augmenter son stock de produits d’alimentation générale.
 Elle est mariée, son époux est un transitaire, ils ont quatre (04) personnes à charge, avec ce commerce elle compte aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a hard-working woman who buys and sells foodstuffs, and lives in the Mimamadou neighborhood of Agoè. She is an energetic woman, and buys the supplies for her occupation at local markets. Her business is going well, and she is requesting this loan to increase her stock of foodstuffs in general. She is married to a freight forwarder. They have four dependents. Through her business, she intends to help her husband with their household's daily costs of living.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Chhin S. is a widowed farmer, living in the province of Siem Reap with her mother and three of her children. She grows and sells rice, and on average she makes about US$8 in revenue every day. However, it is not enough to support her family, so one of her children sends money from his construction work every month. She will use the loan to purchase rice and take off the husk, with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Hastiali

texts.en:
M. Hastiali is married with two children. Hastiali is a unique entrepreneur. He has been a market vendor for about 8 years. During that time he become very popular at the market and has many clients. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let his customers know the benefits of his products, he also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture. Hastiali is seeking a loan of $ 600 USD to increase the merchandise in his store. We believe that Hastiali’s desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and will encourage new customers to buy from him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher has a motorcycle that he uses to convey his passengers. He hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase one additional motorcycle. He is 36 years old, married with a child. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase a second motorcycle

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
el Sr. Jose C. tiene 37 años de edad el tiene unas vacas las cuales ordeña todos los dias y saca una buena cantidad de leche, con la leche que saca hace quesillo y cuajada, el distribuye su producto en varias comunidades ya tambien lo vende en su casa de habitacion, gracias a este negocio ha logrado comprar una motocicleta y con esto el distribuye su producto mas rapido y seguro, ahora el necesita comprar unas pastillas para hacer quesillo y cuajada, tambien necesita comprar unos tarros de hierro para depositar la leche ya que los que tiene no le sjustan para guardar toda la leche que saca en las mañanas.
el tiene 3 hijos que estan en la escuela.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose C. is 37 years old and has three children attending school. He has several cows, which he milks daily and they produce a good amount of milk. He makes cheese and curd and sells them in several communities and at his house. He bought a motorbike with the earnings, and now is able to distribute his products faster and safer. He needs to buy tablets used to make the cheese and curd, as well as to buy big containers to store the milk he gets when milking the cows in the morning.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tablets used to make cheese and curd and large containers to store milk

loans.name: Sakina Group

texts.en:
My name is Sakina and I am 29 years old. I have resided in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 20 years. I am an uneducated lady because my parents couldn’t pay for my education. My husband's name is M. Rafiq and he runs a garment business. I am the mother of two daughters. I want to send my daughters to school, and for this reason I sew clothes by taking orders from my neighbors and relatives.

My brother is also lives with us. He runs a fruit-selling business. He goes to different areas of Vehari on a cart and announces his products in a loud voice. He has been in this business for the past 7 years. I am applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to expand my brother’s fruit-selling business.

I’m the group leader of three other women from my locality. Iffat baji and Rashida baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Khadija baji wants a loan to buy flowers to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio M. tiene 28 años de edad y vive con su esposa la Sra Paola Irala de 28 años de edad.  Ellos viven en su casa propia.

Don Julio tiene un transporte escolar, lo cual adquirio gracias a un ahorro que pudo juntar trabajando como mozo en el exterior

En la actualidad cuenta con mas de 50 alumnos a quienes traslada todos los dias a sus respectivos colegios.

Son personas sacrificadas ya que tienen que levantarse a muy temprana hora de la mañana para recoger a los alumnos para trasladarle de una Ciudad a otra.

Empezaron a trabajar con la Fundacion Paraguaya en el año 2008, y comentan que gracias al apoyo recibido con los préstamos este año tienen mas clientes.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de cubiertas para su transporte escolar.
texts.en:
Julio M. lives with his wife, Mrs. Paola Irala. They are both 28, and they live in their own house. Julio has a vehicle for school transportation, which he acquired thanks to savings that he put together working as a waiter in the exterior. Now he has more than 50 students he transports every day to their respective schools. They are people who make lots of sacrifices because they have to get up very early in the morning to pick up all of the students to transport them to one city to another. They started working with the Fundación Paraguaya in 2008. Thanks to the support received from the loans this year, they have more customers. The loan is to buy tires for his school transportation vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza D. C. is the mother of 3 children. Presently, she is helping her husband prepare and save for the schooling of the children. She is currently engaged in making chorizo, longganisa (types of sausage), and snacks to sell to her neighbors in their village. Sometimes she  also sells dried fish on credit to her established customers. She is happy to know that HSPFI has micro-finance loans that can give her the opportunity to increase her income. She wants to access a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for chorizo and longganisa and dried fish

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma Yolanda es soltera, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ademas en sus tiempos libres hace trejidos tipicos.  Los cerdos ella los compra pequelos, losa laimentea y cuando los tiene de buen tamaño los vende, eso dura de 3 a 6 meses.  Siempre mantiene de varias edadedes, para poder vender mensualmente los cerdos, los cuales vende en su casa.  Su prestamo lo necesita para seguir invirtiendo en cerdos pequños y alimentos para ellos, sus planes son seguir creciendo en su negocio, mantenerse y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Irma Yolanda is a single woman who works as a breeder of pigs. Also, in her free time she weaves traditional garments. The pigs that she sells are small and when they grow to a good size, she sells them, usually after 3 to 6 months. She has pigs of various ages in order to sell them on a monthly basis, which she does from her house. The loan that she needs is to continue investing in small pigs and food for them. Her plans are to continue growing and maintaining her business, and also to continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business of breeding and selling of pigs

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en: Phoung L., 39, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with four of her children. She makes a living raising pigs and growing rice, and earns about $2.50 each day, while her husband makes $5 a day selling cashew nuts. Inflation has made prices soar lately in Cambodia, and Phoung L. realizes that she needs to expand the family businesses in order to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy cashew nuts for her husband to sell at the market. She sees this loan as a great economic opportunity, and believes that she can raise her standard of living through her careful use of the proceeds.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 26 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en la casa de unos familiares, quienes la apoyaron dándole un lugar donde quedarse. Tiene un pequeño hijo llamado Kevin de 4 años, a quien desea dar una buena vida. El restaurante de Luzmila está ubicado en una de las calles principales de la ciudad de Juliaca, el cual es muy concurrido debido a lo sabroso de la comida y a la variedad de platos que ofrece al público, lo cual ha logrado que el restaurante “La Estrella”, que es como se llama, sea uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta a Luzmila es atender a sus clientes y le gusta hacerlo bien, puesto que sabe que una buena atención hará que vuelvan pronto, lleva un año y medio cocinando para sus clientes y considera que lo más difícil para es atender al mismo tiempo a todas las personas que asisten a su restaurante. Para el futuro espera mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y así poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este es el sexto préstamo de Luzmila con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está segura de poder hacerlo, al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos. En su banco comunal siente que está realizando una buena labor y que le tienen mucho respeto por la puntualidad que demuestra. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados renovará sus utensilios de cocina y arreglará el ambiente de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a 26-year-old woman who is a very hardworking and loving mother. She lives with her relatives who help her out by giving her a place to stay. She has a small four-year-old son named Kevin to whom she wants to give a good life. Luzmila’s restaurant is located on one of Juliaca’s main avenues. Her restaurant does a lot of business because the food is tasty and because she serves a variety of dishes. This is why La Estrella is one of the city’s most well known restaurants. Luzmila loves taking good care of her customers because she knows that they will come back soon if they are treated well. She has been cooking for a year and a half and finds that the hardest part is taking care of everyone at the same time. She would like to improve her business’s infrastructure to provide her customer’s better service. This is Luzmila’s sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay her installments on time and is confident that she will be able to do so, as she has been able to in the past. She works well with her communal bank and is respected since she pays her loans back on time. She plans to update her kitchen utensils and fix up her restaurant with the 800 soles requested.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovación de sus utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Калкыз

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Султонкулова  Калкыз женщина в возрасте 44 лет замужем, имеет одного ребёнка. Она домохозяйка, но без дела не сидит.Калкыз имеет пять коров , которые в день дают по 7 литров молока. Также она имеет пятнадцать баранов. В день мониторинга Калкыз не было дома она была в отъезде в город за покупками. Поэтому на снимке её муж , который работает строителем на заказ. На полученный кредит Калкыз хочет закупить ещё несколько баранов и отремонтировать крышу сарая , где она содержит скот.

loans.use: откорм и продажа

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and some CD's to sell at his salon

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio M. G. de 46 años de edad reside en Santa Tecla en el departamento de La Libertad. Mauricio es padre soltero vive solamente con su hijas una gemelitas de 16 años de edad, estudiantes. Para Mauricio fue difícil cuidar de sus hijas ya que tenía que salir a trabajar para poder mantenerlas, pero con mucho esfuerzo y manos que siempre le ayudaron ahora eso solo es un recuerdo, hace once años Mauricio tuvo la idea de montar un negocio en su casa para poder estar siempre al cuidado de sus hijas y fue así, como se  inicio en la comida Buffet , ahora Mauricio ya estabilizo su negocio  y posee una cartera grande en clientes, el crédito que ahora solita es para compra de materia que le ayudara aumentar su producción al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mauricio M. G. is 46 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, which is in the district of La Libertad. He is a single father with 16 year old twin daughters, who are both students. Mauricio had found it difficult to care for his children and also leave for work in order to support them. However, with a lot of effort and assistance he received along the way, that thought is just a memory. Eleven years ago, Mauricio had the idea to establish a business at home so that he could always look after his daughters. He opened a food buffet and now has a wide range of customers.

Today he is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to help him increase his production as well as his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Saidat's Group

texts.en: N. Saidat is a 30 year old lady and a business lady in beverage selling. She started with a very small canteen 9 years ago and now has a large supply of drinks from Namawojjolo selling to customers on the Kampala – Jinja Highway. She is able to make 300,000/ as profits a month and these help to cater for her family needs and paying for the children’s school fees. She is a mother of 4 children all in primary school as she cares for other orphans. She has a plan of becoming a wholesale supplier to all the Namawojjolo market vendors. Saidat needs a loan to be able to buy more drinks like soda and mineral water for resale.

loans.use: Restocking her business with more sodas and mineral water.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus O. age 52 is married to Nicanor O. 57 years old. They were blessed with plenty of children Mhelanie 28 years old graduated the course of computer management, Norven 18 years old graduated a 2 year course of welder, Nhesy 16 years old now currently studying first year college, Nhikko 14 years old now in third year high school and Chasie 8 years old now in grade 2 in primary level.

Her husband work as a fisherman in their place, so main source of their income is came from fishing business. Their house is near the sea so it’s more comfortable for them to run this business. They run this business for 35 years now and when she joined in Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she use the loan that she received as additional capital for this business. Now in 2nd times of her loan she will use it for buying things needed in her business like different kind of fish net, accessories for the net and bamboo.

Venus makes promise to herself that they will do everything to make her business will continue to run and grow in the coming years because she is dreaming to have a big boat that they can use in their business for more income for them, in that way they can send all of her children to school until they become a degree holder.

loans.use: Will be use to buy different things needed in her fishing business

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Зариф Хайруллоев проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Зариф более 10 лет работает по специальности "механиком". Помимо этого он более 4 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
