Zarif H. lives in the Abdurahmon-Jomi region. He is 39 years old. He is married and has six children. Zarif has worked as a mechanic for more than ten years. As of four years ago he started doing animal husbandry. He feeds and sells cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Comodo Rogerio

texts.pt:
Cómodo N. nasceu em Inhassoro, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 56 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos de 18,16,14,12 e 4 anos de idade. Todos filhos vão a escola. Fez 9ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro da Matola Província de Maputo, sustenta apenas sua mãe.

Saiu de Inhassoro para Beira, na Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique a procura de emprego, trabalhou 2 anos como servente de Balcão, mais tarde entrou no serviço militar obrigatório. Completo os 2 anos de vida militar, em 1975 ingressa e é no Ministério do Interior, como polícia de protecção. Aufere um salário mensal de 11.882.59mt e poupa 1.200.00mt por mes na sua conta bancária.

Nunca solicitou empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o 2º crédito no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo passado foi do mesmo valor e também para a mesma actividade.

Compromete se pagar este empréstimo devidamente, para poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro para concluir a sua obra, assim como erguer um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Cómodo N. is from Inhassoro, Inhambe Province, in the southern part of Mozambique. He is 56, married and the father of six children ages 18, 16, 14, 12 and 4. They all go to shcool. He finished 9th grade himself, but couldn't keep studying because of his parents financial difficulties. He lives at his own house with the rest of his family and supports all of them plus his mother. He is a policeman and makes 11.882,00MT (U$410) a month, and saves 1.200,00MT (U$45) every month on hois savings account. This is his second loan in the amount of 20.000,00MT (U$700) which he'll use to buy construction supplies (cement, rocks, iron and others) to finish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies (cement, rock, sand and others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Maluno. She is 47 years old and married with children.

To make a living, Teresita sells vegetables in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for several years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting her first loan, for 4000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S., 49 years of age, has been earning a living by growing rice and vegetable on her own land, next to her house, in the village. She is married with six children: two grown children are already married and have been living separately, and the others are single, sewing workers in a factory. Pen S. was married years ago to Mr. Siem, age 50, who is a mobile worker building houses. Pen S. and her husband are facing difficulties with transportation to work and other places because they don’t have their own vehicle for traveling purposes. Pen S. is therefore applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her family’s transportation needs.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Bunthat

texts.en: Mr. Bunthat C. is a villager in York Bath village in Kandal province and he is 43 years old. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. In the rice field, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. His wife, Mrs.Chan Noeun Ya, is vegetable seller in the local market. Mr. Bunthat C. is a father of three children, all of whom are attending a local public school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice field.

loans.name: Emmaculada

texts.en:
Emmaculada M. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 33 years old. Emmaculada is married with children. Emmaculada owns & operates a transportation business in the local community. Emmaculada earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Emmaculada joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emmaculada has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Emmaculada is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair a vehicle used in her business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Emmaculada from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her transport business

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
Cecilia W. de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, vive en una casa de cemento. Es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos uno de 25 y otro de 8 años.

Hace ya 2 años empezó con la venta de plásticos cuando uno de sus familiares le incentivo vender a sus vecinos tarrinas, lavacaras, sillas etc.

Ahora ella tiene en casa su negocio en donde vende todo tipo de plásticos. Trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es salir a ofrecer sus productos con la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas, tarrinas, lavacaras para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener ya un local donde ofrecer mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Cecilia W. is 45 years old. She lives in the outskirts of the city on the Perimetral de Guayaquil. She lives in a cement house. She is a single mother of two children; one is 25 and the other is 8. Two years ago, she began to sell plastic products when a relative gave her an incentive to sell plastic containers, tubs, chairs, etc. She now has a business in her home where she sells all types of plastic products. She works from 9:00 am until 9:00 pm every day. One of the problems she has is going out to sell her products with the crime in the area where she lives. With the loan she wants to buy chairs, containers, and tubs for her business. In the future, she wants to have a locale where she can better offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONTAINERS, TUBS, CHAIRS

loans.name: Sheila Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Sheila María S. R., es  una persona de 34 años quien  Labora como Jefe de Despacho B en la Decana Tura de la facultad de Ciencias y Sistema en la universidad de ingenieria , ella tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y este  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado un crédito con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y pintura para el cambio de techo de su casa de habitación, por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Sheyla dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sheila is 34 years old and works as the chief of dispatch B in the science and engineering department of the University of Engineering. She is married and has one school-aged son. She has had one loan through CEPRODEL within the last year, which she used to make some improvements to her home. She was able to do this thanks to CEPRODEL. She is asking for this loan in order to buy building materials, such as zinc sheet metal, beams, and paint in order to fix the roof on her house because it is in bad shape.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Ayeni

texts.en: I. is a fashion designer and he turns out lovely Nigerian and western designs for his customers. He loves this business because he makes his customers look good. He hopes to own a fashion house in the future. He has been in this business for a long time and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain more customers. He is 48 years old, married with 5 children. His wife also sells foodstuffs to support their home. He is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to boost his business.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to boost his business

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal N., 29 (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Sam-ang Heang, 30, have been married since 2007 and just have a young daughter. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sophal has been operating grocery store for a year. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market and sells in front of her house. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional grocery items for her stock.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal, 51, lives with her husband and four daughters in Hovd province, Mongolia, in an apartment. Her oldest daughter attends a university and her youngest two daughters attend a local secondary school.

Bayanjargal operates a meat trading business at a local food market. She has been operating her business since 2000 and has built a stable operation. The whole family supports her business and they have been planning to grow their business in future.

She has been paying her daughter's university fee with her earnings and providing money for her family expenses. Bayanjargal says, “I am working hard to provide good educations for my four daughters.”

She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase meat at wholesales price because demand is high in spring time.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lolahon Eshanjonova Group

texts.ru:
Лолахон является лидером группы, ей 40 лет. Она проживает в Араванском районе вместе со своей семьей. У нее 3 детей: дочерям 19 и 17 лет, сыну 15 лет. Старшие дочери активно помогают по семейному хозяйству, старший сын учится в школе. А супруг работает строителем. Клиент в свою очередь откармливает МРС, клиентка планирует закупить доенную КРС на этот кредит.

Халимахон 56 лет. Она замужем, но ее супруг не работает, так как он инвалид второй группы. У нее 3 детей: с ней проживает сын, невестке, и внуку 3 года. Клиентка работает в больнице в отделе стерилизации медсестрой. На кредит она планирует купить холодильник.

Манзурахан, 44, замужем. Ее супруг строитель, работает в основном в родном селе.  Клиентка откармливает доенную корову с быком, сама работает в больнице в отделении ССО санитаркой. Цель кредита - закупить бычков для откорма и перепродажи. 

Наргизахон. 29, замужем. У нее трое сыновые. Старшие двое детей ходят в школу. Она откармливает телку, кур, а также активно занимается сельским хозяйством. Цель кредита -закупить 4х МРС для откорма и перепродажи.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Lolahon is the leader of this group. She is 40 years old. She lives in the Aravan district together with her family. She has 3 children: the daughters are 19 and 17 years old, and the son is 15 years old. The oldest daughters actively help with the family household, and the son goes to school. Lolahon’s husband works as a construction worker. The client fattens small livestock. She plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow. Halimahon is 56 years old. She is married; however, her husband does not work because he is disabled. She has 3 children. Her son, daughter-in-law and a 3-year-old grandson live with Halimahon. The client works as a nurse at a sterilization department in a hospital. She wants to use this loan to buy a refrigerator. Manzurahan is 44 years old, married. Her husband is a construction worker, who mainly works in their native village. The client fattens a dairy cow and a bull and also works as an orderly at a hospital. The goal of this loan is to purchase calves for fattening and resale. Nargizahon is 29 years old, married. She has three sons. The oldest two children go to school. Nargizahon fattens a heifer, chickens and is also actively involved in agriculture. The goal of this loan is to purchase 4 heads of small livestock for fattening and resale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia C. is from the village of Christine, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old, married, and has six adult children.

Leticia owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI.

Leticia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: labour, étendre ses surfaces cultivables et acheter des engrais

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn N. is a 53-year-old woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents who died of senility. She uses this land to raise crops and a few pigs. Vorn N. is a  mother blessed with five children. Two of them are already married and live away from home, while the remaining three are unmarried. Almost all of the children are employed. As another source of family income, Vorn N.’s husband sells firewood that he buys from the forest. To help alleviate the hard physical labor of the business activities, Vorn N. is seeking a loan to purchase a pair of water buffalo that she will use to plow the farmland and carry the firewood from the forest.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of water buffalo.

loans.name: Elvis Omar

texts.es:
Elvis Omar A. A. tiene 33 años. Es soltero vive con sus padres, tiene 1 hijo, Ana (3) vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Elvis  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Elvis  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembrado cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la misma comunidad sus productos los vende en el Cantón Bucal.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en le cultivo de cacao. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener más producción  y tener una casa para su familia. Enfrenta desafíos como el cambio del clima, y los caminos para llegar a los terrenos que no están en buen estado. 

Le gusta salir a caminar, escuchar música y pasear con la familiar.
texts.en:
Elvis Omar A. A., 33, is single and lives with his parents. He has a child, Ana, 3. He lives in Chillanes canton in Bolívar province. Elvis is a member of the Rey de Reyes (King of Kings) communal bank located an hour and a half from Chillanes. It has a total of 23 members who are mostly farmers. This is the first loan they have gotten from Cooperative San José. Elvis is a cacao farmer. He makes his purchases monthly in the same community and sells his products in Bucal canton. He is asking for funding to invest in his cacao crops. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to have more production and a house of his own for his family. He faces challenges due to weather changes and that the access roads to his fields are in poor condition. He enjoys going out for walks, listening to music and family outings

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in cacao crops.

loans.name: Florenda's Group

texts.en:
Florenda S. is from the town of Dumabato Sur Maddela, Quirino. She is 43 years old. Florenda is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Florenda S..

Florenda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Florenda owns & operates a business making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Florenda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florenda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florenda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: I. Hasan is 46 years old and is married with six children. His wife is a housekeeper and Hasan’s business is their main source of income. Hasan has provided transportation services for the last eleven years. He dreams that all of his children will be well-educated and so he is working hard towards that. As a result the business generates a significant income, allowing him to support his large family. Currently Hasan needs to purchase spare parts for repairing his lorry (truck). He believes that this will make his business more profitable. With this purpose in mind, he requests 1,000 USD. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his lorry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand his business

loans.name: Norng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Norng S. is a 56-year-old married woman and was selected as the leader of a group loan consisting of five members, located in Ta Reap Doun Sa village, Kandal province. 

Norng S. works at fishing and is able to earn a small income to support her family. She lacks money to support the business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat and fishnets. Her husband, Mr. Sae Hean, is 65 years old, and works as a traditional healer and also helps his wife in the business. This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and one is a security guard while another is a fishermen who helps his mother with fishing.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat and fishnets
